cSxh26ueozB3znYw_DyJOg.text: View was nice. Food was just ok. Dessert was terrible and kids were running around screaming.

72KERt4wCEXieHQGXe6J5g.text: We went here for my wife's birthday on Thursday November 3rd and had an unpleasant experience. That was the fourth time we have been to Ventano's and enjoyed the atmosphere until that night. We had a group 9 (family that surprised us from California) with two children to include an infant. As dinner was winding down and moving into getting desert, my father in law picked up my infant and walked him close to the kitchen to take a peek. We all know how baby's can be. Then as I'm returning from the restroom about to take my seat, one of the employees (not a waiter) wearing a white long sleeve bringing food out obnoxiously says "somebody better tell that guy (my father in law holding my baby) to get away from the glass (that separates the kitchen from the dining area) because that's $15,000!" The whole table heard him and immediately made a memorable night for my wife and family turn sour. There is a way to politely tell us to not have them close to the "treasured" Ventano glass and we would have gladly directed my father in law away from there. I do not care if that piece is worth 15k and just disgusted by your employee's demeanor. We immediately payed the bill and left. Not impressed at all.

O4iJT9siWXKMR7sZ_FdK1Q.text: Nice place for Italian.  We (party of 3) arrived on a Saturday night sans a reservation, which wasn't a problem but there was a 25 minute wait.  We waited in the bar area, which, sadly, was very smokey.  My friend and I had a glass of the inexpensive pinot noir.  I forgot how weird it is to sit at a bar with video poker.  Thankfully, we were seated not too long after.  We ordered the bruschetta as an appetizer; it was okay but nothing to write home about.  The tomatoes tasted a bit bland.  They also serve complimentary bread sticks, which were good, but somewhat reminiscent of the Olive Garden.  The food was better.  Feeling somewhat adventurous, I ordered the Ventano tortellini (hey, my go-to is gnocchi).  It was pretty good; hot, cheesy, and very rich.  The pink sauce was a nice compliment.  For dessert, I had the tiramisu.  It was also pretty good but, truthfully, at this point, I was so stuffed that I didn't have much of it.  The restaurant itself is agreeable; spacious and nice decor.  The food was good but I'm not sure that, if I wasn't already in the area, I'd go out of my way to go back again.

7yqy4wXcJdH11bx0TXlQag.text: I've been attending trade shows in Las Vegas for about 40 years, and have tried on- and off-strip restaurants from one end to the other; some good, some quite bad.  On the occasion of the recent CES show, my wife and I took a side trip to Henderson, mostly to see the Ethel M. Chocolate Factory.  Her GPS found Ventano around dinnertime and we gave it a try.  The meals we had were, by far, among the best (if not THE best) we have had anywhere near Vegas.  Well worth the 20 minutes or so it takes to get there from the convention area.  The menu is well-rounded, the conceptualization of the dishes challenges perfection, and the food is... well, superb.  Service was 'young but pleasant,' and the view of the sun setting over the strip, and over the mountains beyond, was, itself, worth the visit.  The wine list was surprisingly good for a neighborhood restaurant; one of our favorite Zins was on it.  Well done Mr. Briand!

alnJAhYbRtJEfeSAJmW98A.text: It was just great! I went with my friends from Los Angeles for NY Eve. Made reservation through Yelp! website.  Food was great! I had Cioppino - other than could use slightly less salt - perfect with beautiful view. My friends had Pasta, Salmon and Cioppino with Rizotto added, etc.  Highly recommend and will be one of my favorite Italian Restaurant... Great view of Las Vegas Blvd...

_7HdQ7Hsze5uscn54isC2w.text: AMAZING!  The service is hand down the best.  Ask for Carlos!  Straight from Italy...sit on the patio and enjoy the view.  Truly will not find a better Italian restaurant in Vegas.

txfuPnUnOhnVUYIYpHBtfw.text: Very impressed with the Establishment, Adam and Aldo are a Class Act Team .We ordered the Cesar Salads with Salmon and Scallops and will say both were excellent. I was surprised at the low prices. The entire staff displayed passionate attitudes for the jobs they were tasked with;and it showed. Adam and Aldo you guys were great keep up the good work. Thanks for the Wine tip Adam. Will Definitely return 5+ to Management.

03-ISajevbBIlTm29JdimA.text: I live nearby, so this is a convenient place for good Italian food. However, I think the prices reflect amazing Italian food, which it really isn't. Not to be picky, but they serve breadsticks rather than real bread, and that made me feel like I was at Fazoli's. I think it would serve them well to have "real" fresh Italian bread. I do like the fact that I always bring home leftovers when I eat here!   The service was mediocre at best. I typically just drink water, and I think they forgot that I needed refills, because I had to ask more than once.   This is a good place for a date as it has a nice, romantic ambience.

_nFUUHJCU2YHfZll_ixh2A.text: Had a great dinner last night with family! Delicious food, and the wait team was fantastic. Will definitely be back!

5o_SiRzNlyBacGu-zc-_lA.text: Service is perfect and if you sitting in the right spot you can take in a view of the strip.  Lots of choices on the Wine menu too.  That being said it's hit or miss on the dinner selections.  The Veal Marsala tasted like a 70's TV dinner but the Baked Buccatini was delicious.  Choose wisely!

XDofaEAlDXn2F2nmHhBIDw.text: I love Ventano and am a regular (go once or twice a month). They have gluten free penne with the best meaty bolognese in Vegas. It's a real treat for those that are gluten free. They also have gluten free pizza, but I haven't tried it yet.  I can't eat the bread sticks with olive oil and balsamic, but everyone tells me they are delicious. Everything everyone eats around me makes my mouth water, but the bolognese keeps me happy. It really is that good.  I went to a beer dinner at Ventano recently. It was a blast. They offered a free ride home to anyone that tried all the beer.  Portions are large. Great wine list. Service is always great. They have a rewards card, so be sure to ask for that. I've had a few free meals from the points.

a-iCndbQkcN6NYIt35VIGA.text: With the boy out and about I had a chance to partake in a date night with the GF.  We were in the mood for some Italian and bounced over to VIG&S.  Given that it was Saturday night, parking lot was full and we did not do reservations, we were able to make it in after the 7:00 dinner rush.  We were even able to get a table next to a large window with a great view of valley.  Our waitress was friendly and explained the menu and specials with much happiness.  We started off with the "Arancine" risotto bals stuffed with peas, beef and cheese..delicious.  I ate the "Francese" chicken which was lightly sauteed in egg batter and parmesan and covered in a lemon butter sauce. I gave up bread but because everything was so damn tasty, I even ate it.  Cool atom, great views, tasty chow...I will be back.

4s7kdufF4wJ2mT7auk-d5g.text: If romance is part of your agenda, you can't go wrong with adding Ventano to your list.   This restaurant is tucked away in a clean and quiet neighborhood in Henderson. There's a large parking lot next to the restaurant building but the entrance is on the other side of the parking lot next to the gas station. It's dimly lit with large windows surrounding the entire restaurant. You can request to sit out on the patio - I would recommend this if the weather permits.   The view from the patio is quite breathtaking. I've been here during the day and at night. Come during the night time to see an amazing view of the lights of Vegas.   The food is alright. Not the best, but satisfying. I thought it was neat how they served their bread in a paper bag and not on a plate or a basket. Their portions are large and filling. During my last visit, I had the Lobster Ravioli for $24.50. The ravioli is topped with three ginormous pieces of blackened shrimp and is paired with some grilled asparagus. It was good, although I didn't really get a punch of lobster flavor from the ravioli. The shrimp was juicy and well seasoned and was definitely my favorite part of the dish. My friend ordered the Gnocchi con pesto. This was a disappointment. Not enough sauce. Gnocchi was dry and real chewy. Seems like it was sitting out for awhile.   I was contemplating for a minute on whether I should rate Ventano a 3 or a 4. My final decision is that Ventano is a 3.5 but they get the 4 on Yelp because of the beautiful view. If I'm ever around in that area, I wouldn't mind going back. Just have to remember to not order the gnocchi.

FZA1ISG0t4g3Fk2rUKvneg.text: Pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere and staff are exceptional. The food was phenominal. can't wait to go back.

3oPuz6nposIXkzdRM4SnKw.text: We came here awhile back for lunch. We came here b/c at the time It said that we would get a % off If we mentioned we saw this on Yelp. This is the specific reason we went there and had even heard of it.   I ordered the Puttanesca and my bf ordered a baked cheese something or another. His tasted great, mine was very bland. I wouldnt reorder this again. The breadsticks in the bag were good and garlicky but I cant eat them so it was more torture to just get a small nibble . . to know its good and not be able to eat it.. :(  Well here's where the deduction for the add'l 2 starts comes from: We asked for the check and mentioned we saw this on Yelp. He said he didnt know anything about it. Normally I'd just let this go but it was the way he spoke to us very condescending and I felt a little disrespected. I asked him if he had a manager (which I NEVER EVER do) he left and came back and said oh he's out for a little bit, I said ok, well can you call him?  yes... that was little ole me asking for the manager to be phoned. I said I didnt think it was right to advertise buy one get one 1/2 off  if you mention you saw it on Yelp and then take it back once you get people in. that's False advertising...   He came back and said he called the manager, and that he agreed to take off the discount which was probably no more than $6 or $7 at most. All that for $6.00, really? you're willing to risk losing a customers over that? well they must not be hurting if they can risk being rude. .   Would I come back? maybe, ok, let's be honest probably not likely considering there are sooo many places in LV and Henderson where I can spend my $.   They do have a nice view in the afternoon/night if you sit by the window. HOwever, I've also heard you get that same great view if you goto Lindo Michoacan. . .

NGsYJ6gmwN3RRZ6OX14f4g.text: On my second visit (the only reason I went back was that the group I was with picked it) it was even worse.  The first time they burned my chicken parm, had bad meatballs and the shrimp on the stone was totally tasteless.  This time, my shrimp cocktail was uncleaned, so I sent it back with instructions to build a whole new one.  When they brought it back, they had evidently just washed it in the sink (as it was dripping) and left my squeezed lemon from the first go round on the plate.  The pasta fagiola was either overcooked or left in the steam table too long, as the pasta was totally disintegrated... not to mention totally tasteless.  The severs were kind and apologetic.

4DoHz86BUX6NxvuX560Z1A.text: They forgot about us, put us in the corner with the worst view, and treated us poorly (I think due to the fact that we are younger). The food and drinks were also meh for the price, and a great view can't make up for that.

hwIL1TGAvNwuOAZjJsx2MA.text: Excellent food and the service is even better. It has a great view of the city with outdoor seating.

QjzOhaRG-pFMATCMT6a83Q.text: Great service.  Walked in late in the evening and asked for a patio table (even though the place looked busy) hostess said let me check and guess what, she got us in. Now the food on the other hand was very mediocre. Shrimp scampi tasted like it had sprite and mango sauce mixed in it (had to send it back), shrimp platter was so so.  Not the best overall food experience.  However the waiter, hostess and atmosphere bumped it up a notch. Maybe just an off night for the kitchen.

rfY5FlCrJ058LVSAtL5Mww.text: Pasta sauce was very watery and way to much garlic in the sauce. Waiter forgot to refill our drinks... until we asked after our main course was brought. Waiter also never asked how our food was, because I took two bites and let it sit in front of me for 20 mins until he brought the check. Very unhappy,  will never return.

efg-f9cHfJl2EDIC_0LmQA.text: Second time there and again we were impressed. Our friends and us wanted to get away from the crazy crowds on the strip so we took a short drive to Ventano in Henderson. Glad we did. Great food, great view, and great service. My wife had the oysters to start which were delish. Eggplant dishes are good. The side of meatballs was very good too. I'll definitely go back for Italian food again.

T1D-KFxra8_-wu6BhrXZTQ.text: We live right down the street and visit this restaurant often. The service here is excellent. We also ask for Carlos' area. He is always so friendly and helpful. He always has us try a new wine or entree. Food is always cooked perfectly. We love the groupons that they offer and always take advantage of them when we can. I always recommend this place to tourists if they can make it to Henderson.

loznjds673p1ytAwezZbvg.text: Went here on the fourth of july and the food was awesome took family with me and they all had the same feeling this place is wonderful.

AcUkdbdlza6dzqJ9-Nt5vw.text: Food is ok. Service is slow at best. Saving grace is great views of the LV  strip. Would not repeat for dinner.

e2l8vIhQmklBXB5I902jbw.text: Ate here on New Years Eve and our table was so far from anything you can call a view, so we decided to try again. We were seated as what was called the the best seat in the house-window side and it was really great. Finally! Now, I know what all the fuss is about! The view is spectacular!  I ordered a small green salad-I believe a restaurant is only as good as it's house dressing. And it was outstanding.  My husband ordered Tortellini Ventano-cheese tortellini, mushrooms and chicken in pink sauce and he loved it. Definitely would order again. Served piping hot-like usual. When I say piping, I mean this food is served so hot it takes awhile to cool down, so order another glass of wine and relax!  I ordered a combination of linguine with shrimp in a creamy, lemon garlic butter sauce and Ventano Spiedini-chicken cutlets, lightly breaded, stuffed with mozzarella & Parmesan, rolled and skewered. topped with pomodoro sauce. OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!! The shrimp scampi sauce was a bit to lemony, but it was really delicious. Those chicken cutlets were extraordinary. I can't imagine ever having a more delicious chicken dish at any restaurant. They serve the Spiedini as an entree which I would not hesitate to order, but I couldn't decide between a seafood dish and the chicken, so I opted for the combo. Was not disappointed and will return again and again and again!   The restaurant is nice with an open seating area and a level of elevated seating that looks like a great place to enjoy the view if you are not lucky enough to get a window seat. There is an outdoor patio which I bet is fabulous when it's not freezing cold! Can't wait to enjoy a meal out there!   This place has won me over and the service was equally as great! I can not say enough great things about this place!   So, I was right; in my first review I stated that the food is probably better--and prices too--if you sit at a table with a view. The food & the view totally play off eachother--is the view so wonderful cuz the food is great? Or is the food great cuz the view is so amazing? Who knows? Who cares?! I'm in!

OIYwCgPO7L0z7Mx9-pmLbQ.text: Real italian food. The sauces are a True meaning of gravy.

9qKtYbtQjwmeKjfTFtUvhQ.text: Chicken Spiedini is great! Chicken Parmagiana was fair!Antipasti was good! Service is good.

KENOSD7uOFJwk8LpUKyszw.text: I went there with my wife and was really concerned about salty food, bad service, high prices and other things mentioned in Yelp reviews.  Boy were they off-base.  Our server, Danielle, was great and let us order at our pace - though there was no real wait after giving the order.  She helped us through the menu looking for lower salt foods and made really good suggestions.I ordered the Risotto Pescadore and my wife the House Fillipino Special (chicken, shrimp, risotto and vegetables with some brown sugar effect.)  This after splitting a Warm Spinach Salad (split in the kitchen at no charge.)  My dish was a surprise since it was so loaded with clams, mussels and calamari swimming in a light tomato base sauce/soup to make it comparable with a Boullliabase from the south of France.  My wife loved her dish.  If there could be a complaint it was that the size of the serving was larger than either one of us could handle.  Next time we go through the courses and split each one.  Then the bill came and it was completely reasonable.  Surpise, Surprise after all the Yelp reviews calling this place expensive.  If you really think that then you should stick to the buffets and their steam tables or to fast food restaurants.  I think that Ventano's is something special.

z6ypcgci79Qbcya1cmn5Zg.text: I have been meaning to review this restaurant since I and my family dined there a month ago.  I am in love!  The wine list was wonderful and the calamari was crazy good!  Even my three-year-old daughter ate it and she is a picky eater.  They served my daughter meatballs the size of her head and my lobster ravioli was amazing!  Pricing was reasonable; we will definitely be visiting Ventano's again! #yum

z-nlegqWoHRL3CpPTSRrEQ.text: love the grill hearts of romaine, bisque and shrimp on the stone. Nice wine dinners and list. Great service and staff including Arenode and Rudy. Ask for Amy as watress. Great patio dining with view of all of vegas!

rHflOv74hIvFhQ3ddC3YFw.text: I am sitting here eating my leftovers from last night as I type this review.  This was the best meal that I have eaten in quite a while in the Las Vegas area.  Funny thing is, we live very close to this restaurant, but have never tried it for some odd reason.  I decided I was hungry for Italian last night and decided to give it a whirl.  I am somewhat of a picky diner and I have to tell you that I was thoroughly impressed with everything!  From walking in the front door with the friendly hostess, to being seated and taken care of by a very knowledgeable and friendly waiter (turns out that he was the General Manager).  He recommended several dishes to us, took the time to discuss and explain a dish to my 12 year old inquisitive son, and was generally outgoing and super friendly.  Food was exceptional - every dish that we got was amazing.  We ended the night withe Creme brulee and Spumoni cake for all of us to share and the creme brulee was to die for.  My only complaint is that I didn't find this restaurant much sooner as I can say that I will definitely be back - and SOON!  My new favorite spot!

oAMrinI4zJ9Rwu_r0jvCQQ.text: I love eating here and have been multiple times. It has become one of my favorites restaurants. The hot stone shrimp is some of the best I have ever had!

6wRjZ28phJhMibq4mvMlcg.text: We had dinner there on Sunday, January 26, 2014. The service, food, and atmosphere was wonderful!  The owner/chef came to our table and chatted with us for a few minutes. We will definitely go back!

2oAaR8Zq685XLe6h4Z1tLg.text: grilled Shrimp was amazing, i could not stop eating them.  we sat outside, with the view of the Las Vegas Strip in the background, it was a wonderful view.  i really enjoyed my dinner, and the atmosphere was great. can't wait till i am back in Vegas to eat here again.

9Gv3g1cmy-ZOS-hZ99hrFw.text: In a few words: Great food, terrible service. I have been to Ventano three times now.  They have a lovely wine list, and all the food I or anyone in my party has ordered was delicious.  I especially recommend the Spiedini, which is an impossibly amazing "What if they mated?" love child of mozzerella sticks and chicken tenders.  NOMNOMNOM. The problem, and the reason I will not be going back, is the service.  It is simply incompetent.  The first time I went, we were not seated for 20 minutes, and later found out that the hostess completely forgot about us, EVEN THOUGH WE WERE STANDING RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER.  During one visit, we had a waiter who would rather talk to other waiters than pay any attention to us, and during another, we had two waiters who were taking duplicate orders for the first half of our meal, and then could not attract the attention of either during the second half, short of actually waving our arms in the air. In addition to the incompetent staff, this restaurant employs the most annoying technology I have ever seen- they bring a portable credit card machine to your table and make you CHECK YOURSELF OUT.  I have never seen anything so tacky at a supposedly nice restaurant.  You have to swipe your own credit card like you were at Subway, then select your tip from the choices of "18%," "20%," or "other."  Needless to say, I chose "other."  I should have chosen ZERO. Get it together, Ventano.  Your food is too good to have such terrible waitstaff and a fast-food check-out.  Let me know when you fix it and I'll be back.

3RIYEL6Cb1ZuBBaZsoONZg.text: This place was okay. We went around 6pm on a Saturday and did not wait. The place was pretty busy though. I had the Cioppino, which tasted a bit bland. I used the bread sticks to dip into it. That tasted a bit good. My girlfriend has the Rigatoni, that also tasted a bit bland. Even with the sauce and additions to it, tasted like plain pasta. The best part of the meal to me was the Bruschetta appetizer. I am sure I will be venturing back to this place eventually to try something else, but not anytime soon. Just my 2 cents opinion.

1Qin3aHTOQsAKA3zSHuYnw.text: We stopped here on our way back from the Hoover Dam, because we were too hungry to make it back to Vegas.  We were really glad we did.  We got a table with a wonderful view.  The four of us ordered: rigatoni portofino, linguine vongole, shrimp scampi, and lasagna.  The lasagna seemed to be a bit oily, but the rest of us raved about our dishes.  They had a good beer and wine selection as well. Service was a bit slow, but not bad.  Highly recommend.

ESS1KqcGnlC7Nr_ZGwqXKA.text: Amazing food.....exceptional service.....gorgeous view!  Who could want more???  I could have made an entire meal off of the bread that was served prior to the meal.....warm and SO delicious!  Every person in our party LOVED every item ordered....we left full and happy!  Don't skip dessert....the creme brulee' and tiramisu were both outstanding!  I'll definitely be back when I'm in town......

orgNPDc-rjLAeSzGRGbk2A.text: I am writing this review while waiting for my check.   My wife and I came here for the first time on our anniversary for dinner and everything was excellent. Amazing food and Carlos, gave us great service with great suggestions and explanations. This is our second time here and this time around, we decided to come for lunch. Bad move. We first walk in and we are greeted but and we sat down, one guy asks us if ee want beverages and he brings my wife the wrong beverage. In addition, We had a groupon that we wanted to use and we asked them 3 different times if it was acceptable even though it said dinner. He finally tells us it is no good then walks away instead of asking us if we were ready to order even though we had been ready for ten minutes already. We asked for some bread and he says right away, 15 minutes later we still don't have any bread. I assumed it was cooking but he never told us it was in the oven and it would be a few more minutes or anything like that. Finally we order and it takes another 30 minutes or so. So roughly, 50 minutes into us being there we finally get our food. It was delicious. Sometime during the meal I asked for more bread and of course, we never get it nor does he ever tell us it was cooking. I asked for a refill on water and I get another Ginger Ale. It seemed like this duo couldn't grt a damn thing right. Did I mention we had an empty glass sitting on our table for half an hour while eating our food? The food is delicious but if this is the service we get, then surely it will be the last time we come here. If we are gracious enough to come back, we are definitely going for dinner, not lunch.

G8W_FpXyU04hquD6vQYjMA.text: Low key the food was hella good, the service was excellen.For all the negative review go eat an italian sausage. I will definitely be back!!!

ADU8Z6wSewgeQEp8yhtK7Q.text: Talk about being foodie side swiped by a random suburban Italian restaurant.   I meet my mom here for dinner and to be honest, my mom's taste in restaurants mostly falls into the "chain" categories, nothing fancy and convenient. So I was surprised when I read the reviews on Ventano's and more even more taken back by the look of the place.  Normally I avoid places that have the words, "Video Poker" or "24hr Lounge" on the side of the building. This just says mediocre food and smoke filled rooms of sad degenerates. Not the case here at all here, first off the bar with the Video Poker is 100% separated from the dining area and is sealed off with heavy glass doors. The dining area is completely smoke-free, not a hint of smoky smell seeps into the dining room.   The view from the dining area is amazing; really no matter where you sit in the dining area you'll get a full view of the Vegas valley. I do recommend sitting in the raised portion of the dining room for a fully unobstructed view or if the weather is nice just enjoy the patio and glass of wine.    We ordered Grilled Shrimp on the Stone to split and two chicken Caesar salads. Not the normal hearty Italian meal, but I had just left the gym. The shrimp was amazing and seasoned simply with garlic and lemon, served literally on a searing hot stone. It also comes with two side dipping sauces, but these shrimp are so good on their own that you really don't need them.   I know what you're thinking, can a chicken Caesar salad really be that good? Yes, the mountain of greens, chicken and dressing was delicious. Not overly dressed, just a touch of Parmesan, but what really made this so good was the way the chicken was prepared. You could tell it had been flattened with a mallet, seasoned and seared on a super hot surface to create that crunch on the outside while still juicy on the inside. The salad game is strong with this place.   The service was immaculate from top to bottom. Plates cleared quickly and my water glass was never empty. I will definitely be back and my next trip will include a little vino and some ravioli or gnocchi.

Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

ycOVZbY8oTCyEw7bY94EWA.text: It didn't disappoint! From the moment we walked in, my wife and I, along with our boys, were very impressed by the reception, decor and view. We were greeted with a smile and sat in a back booth with an excellent view of the strip! We got our drink order in the blink of an eye! Super fast and professional service. Our waiter Carlos was out of this world, if there were a Masters program for his craft, he would be the one teaching it. He checked on us often and was the most polite, professional and friendly waiter I have encountered in years! Great job Carlos!!!  The food: I ordered the Veal Parmesan, wife had the potato wrapped salmon, one kid had the Fettuccine Alfredo and the other kid had a bowl of clam chowder soup. We all tasted each other's food and it was all delicious! Tasted like home made, I can't wait to go back! Highly recommend, kids loved it, and they never hold back!  Thanks Ventano for such a fine dining experience!

vzCwkcf_XrzUAYb_jMTgBg.text: View is great my spaghetti Bolognese was mediocre and my friends pizza he says was not worth eating.

bfd8aN1oWtU5_p60FS4cNA.text: I love this restaurant so much, I have been many times and never had a bad meal. One favorite is the baked clams, which you can't find hardly anywhere but I love the eggplant rollatini, the shrimp ventano and so much more. I should have posted something before, this place is great. The food, the servers etc.

cnGU33Aurta7GtaKKZOfBw.text: We've eaten here a couple times and food is always quite good. At night the view over the LV valley is quite pretty.  The appetizers are good, bruschetta and hot shrimp on a stone is great. This time eating there, food ordered was fra diavolo with grilled chicken, kids spaghetti, chicken Marsala and cheese raviolis. Everything was very good. We got the chocolate cake with a bday candle for my daughter, which was good, a little too sweet and chocolaty for my tastes, but good.  Service; our waiter was super nice, pretty attentive, and I appreciated how when I called to make a reservation for our family I mentioned it was my daughter's bday dinner they asked if I'd like to pre-order a dessert for her, they'd make sure they'd put a candle in it for her. I requested a table by the window with a view, at which we were seated.  Very good experience.  Total bill minus tip, $130.

Gb6fYI0Eze7mMNzrqScBiA.text: Valentines Day disappointment! No atmosphere at all. Noisy bright lights could have been dimmed. No candles or music. Food was poorly prepared. Steak sent back as raw and returned as rare when medium was ordered. The veal I ordered was one of the worst cuts ever with hard chunks of either bone or tendons. I asked for it to be pounded but evidently not as this would have been discovered. When brought to the kitchen's attention they acted ignorant. Overall a very poor experience. If you're looking for a good meal with atmosphere this isn't the place. Locals want good food not just a place with a view!

mXlI9Et0hEYRggOuH6bgcA.text: On a Friday afternoon we stopped by for lunch, the calamari and shrimp appetizer was delicious, the service was excellent, very attentive and friendly staff. So glad that we stopped by, will be back.

-FucpmK5VCfkuP_wBbt3KQ.text: This place was amazing !!! Great food I loved the chicken parmigiana. It's delicious. The owner came around and check with all of us how the food was. He's extremely nice. Best costumer service I have had in a long time I will be going back for sure.

T1OrVGkEqQ8XuyJMnHIFnA.text: Have been here several times but never posted a review. My first visit would have been a 1 star due to the horrible service. I asked the waiter what the special was and he replied "uh...I think maybe chicken?". After ordering the chef came to our table and when I explained what had happened he informed me the special was an orange roughy with risotto. Needless to say I changed my order. The second would be a 3, again due to service, because our main course came before our appetizer, although the food was excellent. This last time was great! Excellent service, excellent food, just great!

9VKxa2gIdJR5Vr-rrJwIWA.text: We have been here several times and it's been quite good in the past. We went tonight and were not pleased. It took 20 mins to get drinks, 30 mins to get bread, and then after 35 mins they brought out the wrong appetizer. When we finally got our dinner, it was far too peppery to enjoy. They did give us a complimentary dessert that said "happy anniversary."

_HP4rHhjKOLkdU-zLbEt5A.text: This place sucks, try it, no seriously try it! You'll find it sucks too!!  You can get better Italian at most taverns in town.  The one thing they have going is the view.  Maybe that explains the high reviews.  If you want to try the worst thing on the menu, try the Lasagna or the Chicken Parmesan, they are awful.  The Lasagna meat has no spice and it's not cheesy either, just some noodles stacked on top of each other with some chef boy'r'dee sauce in the middle and a tiny bit of mozeralla, and not even the good mozeralla.

YCgSlkJ4fRfina39Vbg28A.text: The first review I gave this place wasn't glowing in fact it was barely 3 stars. A good friend of mine wanted to take me to dinner here about a month ago and I didn't want to say no to her since she picked the place and said it was one of her favorites so I decided I would go. Well I can tell you whatever was wrong the first time was corrected because I had the shrimp scampi and it was absolutely out of this world. My friend had the salmon and gave me a taste-it was delicious to say the least. Perfectly done.  The service here has always been excellent so no problem there. I'm glad I went this time and will definitely go back again.

3N0e9ytaFXHmEbuKyl7DVw.text: Second time around this place was a completely different experience, for the worse. It started from the time we walked in. The hostess was rude and dismissive. My steak was over cooked and tough. However the worse part was when the manager flat out lied about the price of the wine. He quoted the price for a split and served the full bottle. When the check arrived the wine was twice what he quoted. Then he lied and said he told us that. If you like crappy food and being taken advantage of, this place is for you. We'll never go back.

H-hLXsGTlARtpg9MtYlwGw.text: Very marginal Italian fare.  Was hoping for better.  Service was outstanding and perhaps I caught them on a bad night, but it was only at 50% capacity.

h7ZRhnUIi_rb86i2-dzeVA.text: I went here expecting to pay an arm and a leg for some good food and wine, but I was wrong, Ventano's has AMAZING chefs who put some serious love and care into their food. The price was perfectly balanced. I believe my total came to 140 for 2 appetizers, 2 entree's and 2 $35 bottles of wine and a ton of their delicious free bread. Not to mention the BEAUTIFUL view of the strip at night  . It was an al around awesome experience and it all comes with top notch service, my gf cut her arm somehow and the waiter went out of his way to find the first aid kit so I could patch up her arm. Everything about this place just screams " we care about your experience and night out" if you're going out on a date for the first time or if you're taking your significant other out for just a night of fine wine, delicious food and a beautiful view, Ventano's  is right for you! Trust me when I say the pictures do not do it any justice! This place was absolutely delightful. Top notch Chefs, waiting staff, bartenders and bussers, they were all so polite and amazing. Thank you for making our night out so special!

KIt-ftKDbUux3mzy23TJTw.text: This is my favorite place to grab Italian food, Rapha the bartender always takes care of me and I choose to go here at least once a week to order food and have a couple drinks! Always request Rapha and you will not be disappointed! Rapha always takes care of industry people!

zQIGTot7owfNuwo-P1Lu3w.text: Amazing flexibility and hospitality. Down turn but  and classy. Amazing menu, view, & ambiance. I love the place!

e4-1nv_zh67tOOG44OTdQw.text: Lovely view of the city!   Our group decided on Italian and Seafood for dinner.  Ventano's was perfect for this.  We walked in without reservations but were still seated immediately.  Sitting along the windows, you get a great view overlooking the city with the strip in the background.  Service here was good from our waiter Carlos.  Attentive and friendly!  Complimentary garlic breadsticks are brought to the table in a brown paper bag.  Definitely strange but they are delicious... especially dipped in the oil and vinegar. I chose the Tuscan Salad for dinner.  This is mixed greens, mushrooms, onions and walnuts.  It's then topped with a warm bacon dressing.  I then ordered the grilled shrimp on the hot stone. I thought the shrimp would compliment the salad nicely. I placed about half of the shrimp on the salad.  It was great!   It was definitely a pleasant dining experience and would love to try out their lunch menu.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Warm Spinach Salad
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled shrimp on the hot stone

zR0bBLSaayXtZfmkAcbFGg.text: Delicious, family oriented and great customer service!!! The chef/owner came to congratulate us on our anniversary himself! We are so happy to have found this restaurant and will definitely be back! Ps. The seafood is fresh!!!

sty3NuEypRHUvInUZGEOfA.text: I've heard mixed reviews on Ventano's but felt I had to try it. They have a very comprehensive menu with items ranging from from nineteen to thirty one dollars. My wife and I shared a Caesar salad and it was more than we could eat. They served just out of the oven bread sticks that were wonderful. My wife had the Tortellini Ventano and thought it was really good. I took our waiters recommendation and had the Chicken Marsala which is one of my go to dishes. Ventanos Chicken Marsala is the best I've ever had. I will not hesitate in ordering it again. We will not hesitate in returning to this restaurant.

zZ7hhWfFcQNRQ4-TFzLWDA.text: Really good food. Our server Austin was efficient and super polite.   We had calamari, manicotti, fettuccine with pink sauce and tiramisu!   Definitely would come back.

tjyIb09Tih5h9_z4tHyurA.text: An hour wait for our food at 8:00 at night,we asked to speak to the manager...server said he wouldn't come out!?  Just offered us discounts on some below average Italian food. The place needs a major renovation, so dated!  It used to be a decent local restaurant a few years ago but it's really declined. However the server was the only reason we stayed and finished our meal, hope he opens his own restaurant and moves on from this place. Go to Gaetanos if you want fresh Italian food in a beautiful,clean setting.

4D4UKg0wDNt_ukIR6576PA.text: Aesthetically, the restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful and boasts a romantic view of the strip.  It offers al fresco dining and has a private room that can host parties.  It has such a romantic ambiance that is perfect for date night.  The service was great and very attentive.  My glass of water was never empty and there never felt like a long gap between visits from our server Amy.  The bread in a bag they give you was delicious.  It was warm and soft and I had to stop myself from filling up on that to save room for dinner. I like that they pour olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette into a plate as a dipping sauce for you.  I ordered the mahi mahi special.  It came with giant sea scallops, mahi mahi topped with crab, jasmine rice (although our server had said risotto), and asparagus.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  There was a miso demi glaze on the scallops, but I couldn't find the miso flavor.  It tasted just a bit more like sweet and sour sauce to me.  The flavor profile was a tad on the bland side for my taste, but nothing a little salt and pepper couldn't fix.  Overall, my food was good.  Just a few notes.  The outside patio overlooks the parking lot as well as the gorgeous view of the strip.  It's unfortunate the parking lot is there, but that view over sunset and at night is beautiful.  The patio is also on a slight decline.  Our table and items placed on the table slanted just a bit.  It's nothing terrible, but it's noticeable.  And lastly, they don't give you prices for the specials.  If you're budget conscious, ensure to ask.  The mahi mahi special set me back $32 whereas most of their dinner items were $16-25ish.  Overall, the food was more like 3.5 stars (my date had the pesto gnocchi which was very one note in flavor and gummy because it was overcooked,  a disappointment, but my food was pretty good), service was 4 stars, and the restaurant itself and atmosphere are 5 stars. So it all evens out to a 4 star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Mahi mahi dinner special with scallops, miso Demi glaze, jasmine rice, asparagus, and crab on top of the mahi mahi.

Cgm5di9DIuKNi4lYoimNIQ.text: What a lovely find! Beautiful view overlooking the strip, with a a fantastic home style ambiance;)) Our first visit was memorable, shrimp fra diavolo for me, extra spicy with the addition of fresh spinach as requested...just beautiful! Husby had the homemade meaty lasagna and did not regret. Grilled romaine starter with bleu cheese was fabulous. What looks to be a rather lovely tiramisu to go....we will definitely be back, yummo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. View from terraced seating, the glittering Strip beyond
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp linguine fra diavolo, extra spicy + fresh spinach !

wqkkyc_reILVrffNOkwUDg.text: Amazing Italian food in a restful setting, complete with a beautiful view of the strip. We chose to sit outside, although the dining room was also beautiful.   Service was exceptional, very attentive, great menu suggestions. Hubby loved the chicken saltimbucca - great flavors & the wilted spinach was fantastic! My shrimp & scallops in garlic were flavorful, bright & cooked perfectly. Glad I had leftovers to look forward to the next day!

6YVltn1VxvyEzgOILv3mFg.text: Fantastic find! Loved it all from the service, which was non intrusive and no rushing and very knowledgable to be view off the patio of the Las Vegas strip and the beautiful sunset to the food which was perfect. I had the Spedini with bucatini, my wife had the linguine Vongole (clam sauce) and my daughter had the ravioli. All great and presented well. We started off with lamb chops on the stone and we knew at that point all was good! Great prices on the wines as well...highly recommend the Tobin James Sangiovese. We will make this a regular spot, you will love it! The ambiance is beautiful too!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. My beautiful wife enjoying her wine...
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The strip from a distance
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Our view of the sun setting

cy1puySgGAtHUv15OW4BMg.text: I ate here about six months ago when I was in town for business and it was amazing. Now that I have moved to town I plan on making this one of my regular spots. Excellent food excellent service

ni8wGAQfMN0gwkUuMvHj9w.text: My wife and I have been there several times. Our server is Mike we always asked for him. The food is great the owner is very polite. We say it's our favorite restaurant I would definitely recommend. We can dine indoors or Outdoors great sunsets I can't say enough good things about these people

OzgIbXGREBmIxZRpiBnwJQ.text: This restaurant is not what it used to be.  The staff and Chef are very friendly and the atmosphere is nice however the service and quality of food has gone down hill.  Took 30-40 minutes to bring out the appetizers.  Sitting there eating way too much bread.  The mushrooms were soggy and stuffed w bread crumbs?  Mushy and bland.  The muscles were half empty and my steak tasted like meatloaf.  The Chef did accommodate us but the food was not good.  Not for the price.  Not sure if the ownership is cheaping out on the quality of the food these days but it's not the same great tasting restaurant as it used to be a year or 3 ago.  What happened to this place???

_srXRb7tFn9vNre_DLkrJw.text: Well wish we could give this place 5stars. I've had great service in the restaurant but not so much in the bar. We've come in 2or 3 times, including this new years eve 2014 where we have been treated as if we were not here. Bartenders did not acknowledge us when we Sat down and wasn't even busy. We probably will not come back to bar area again. So sad

jmdYs9hlPdgrkz2-hhmOcQ.text: We came here a few years ago for my mom's birthday and had a great time and decided to go again this year. Based on this more recent experience, we won't be spending any more birthdays here.  We made a reservation with a note asking for a booth for my mother's birthday with their nice view. It was a bit busy, but we watched multiple groups who had walked in get booths long after our reservation time had come and gone. Half an hour after our reservation time and after everyone else waiting had been seated, the hostess (who we had to repeatedly prompt for a table...) offered us a table without a view. That was fine -- we could see that they were busy. They put us at a table that still had to be wiped down with only two chairs for our party of four. We asked if we could be put at the next table over (which was ready), and she gladly placed us there... and then took away one of the table settings. After we told her there were four of us, she retrieved the silverware and unceremoniously dumped it in a pile for our fourth person. Well, we figured, at least we had a table now.  Our waiter was very kind and friendly, though we did have to ask for drink refills a few times. The food was mostly delicious, with a couple of just decent dishes. They were busy that night (a Saturday), but the 30-40 minutes between our appetizers and entrees was still a bit long and without any updates. They initially forgot one of the boxes with some leftovers, but we got that sorted out.  Overall just a disappointing meal for what was supposed to be a nice birthday dinner for my mom. I've heard that the staff usually doesn't care if you have a special event here, and I have to agree with that. Good food, but unremarkable service. Happy whatever birthday, Mom.

uUzopCXvK2-tmW6GCCiQcQ.text: One of my favorite places in the valley. Staff are always polite, and willing to go the extra mile to make your service excellent. Has a beautiful view over looking the city that gives this Henderson location something out of the norm.   Food is good, although I must be honest and usually get shrimp on stone.

VGGg-2TD1d4xHVtZnLsRmQ.text: With some of the most spectacular strip views of any restaurant around here, I always expect so much more from this place. I love the ambiance. The space is inviting for small and intimate parties or big groups. I've been here with large birthday parties and for romantic date nights. The large windows in the back that overlook the strip are the perfect spot for a romantic dinner, and we've even seen an engagement happen there! The employees are friendly and the service is decent enough. But the food isn't consistent and I often wonder if the ravioli are fresh or frozen. It's been cold multiple times that I've gotten it. For these prices, which would be reasonable for a much higher end locale and a much more palatable experience, the ravioli just doesn't live up to my standards. And bread in a paper bag? This would be charming at, let's say, Pizza Rock, but here, it just seems out of place. This is one of my favorite locations to celebrate because of the views, ambiance and proximity to my house. But it just isn't my favorite dining experience.

CQZuxLsihKM5cPrQqREBGw.text: @Ventano_LV our meal and experience was great! The chef came to our table a couple times to visit and chit chat! Our waiter was great! Can't remember his name, but he was a dark haired spunky guy! We will definitely be back!! The view at sunset was fantastic!!

EABua3P_b8q3gIGuGdtMgw.text: Attended a very lovely luncheon for a friend's 25th wedding anniversary.  Wish I could remember the Sauvignon Blanc we were drinking - it was really, really nice!  A little more round and soft than most Sauvignon Blancs I've tried, it was refreshing and really easy to drink.  For starters, a tray of antipasti was passed with roasted red peppers, artichokes, salami, and mushrooms.  Next were two hot appetizers:  calamari and shrimp on a hot stone.  The calamari was fresh and had a nice fried crunch (hate soggy calamari), and the shrimp was sizzling.  There was a choice of main entrees, and I opted for the potato-crusted salmon and risotto.  The salmon was fresh and cooked perfectly, the risotto consistency was a bit too much like oatmeal.  I heard the wine menu is extensive, and I'd like to try Ventano again with the hubby - a few appetizers and some vino sound just right!

W1g2V-HxDC8UluPdtcH4ug.text: This place is so good! I sat outside but, there's Carpenter beetles outside so maybe bring a sweater if you're eating outside. Now, about the food. I got the Cheese Ravioli and words cannot even describe how good this food is. The meat sauce is very good with the Ravioli. It's very calm and not like a football joint like Buffalo Wild Wings. If you hate bugs, bring a sweater because it's a little chilly. On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd give this restaurant a 100. Would totally come back here!

oPhJuCAQYXkYnyFe3ITF0w.text: Very good food to include salads, pastas and seafood. I brought my in-laws and kids and everyone liked their meals. I just ate my left-overs and they were great. A little pricey for kids meals and kids drinks so I assume they want to minimize kids in the restaurant. I guess their business is good enough without having too many families visit. We'll definitely go back but this won't be a weekly visit, maybe once a month.

20dfwtZ-DwB7EwztPAya_A.text: I ate here once almost two years ago when I first moved to Henderson and have been meaning to write this review for some time now.   I don't remember exactly we ordered, but I do remember that it was so salty that my friend and I both could barely choke it down. Like spit-it-out ack-sound salty. The only reason we ate more than two bites of our meals was because we knew we were going out drinking after and wanted our tummies to be full. I will most definitely never be eating here again.  The view was beautiful and service was fine.

QNGt4lN5YFnqGoRLVvY_Mw.text: Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood is my all-time favorite Italian Restaurant.  My husband and I have eaten there on many occasions - alone, with family, and with friends; and we have never been disappointed with the service, the food, nor the atmosphere.  We always ask for Carlos's table, because Carlos goes out of his way to make the dining experience at Ventano a great one.  I recently celebrated a birthday there, and Carlos went above and beyond to make my birthday experience one to remember.  I will definitely return to Ventano, and I will definitely recommend it to anyone looking for Italian food.

z7X1jk06qT3Va9ZI3xziAw.text: I've always loved coming to Ventano's. Large portions, excellent Italian food, pretty Tuscan decor, good customer service, gaming available, and it's close to our house!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Cheese ravioli....delicious!!!!
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiano with angel hair pasta!

gnC3J_s7fH8wP1qhWe3yeg.text: Ventana is definitely a nice Italian restaurant. It is very beautiful inside. Everyone that works there is very friendly. Our waiter, was knowledgeable and very funny!   We were first served warm bread, they were more like thick breadsticks. The waiter came and did the oil and vinegar. That was also very nice. Instead of the usual butter. We then got our calamari. It was a very large appetizer portion. The marinara sauce was very tasty and tasted like it was just made.  I'm not very big on pasta, but they had a nice special. It was orange roughy fish served over risotto with scallops and a crabcake. I liked everything very much except for the crabcake, it had too much filling and not enough crab.  We then finished everything off with a Tiramisu. The mascarpone cream was extra fluffy. It was very flavorful and tasted like it was house made. Overall, we had a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. For dessert we got the tiramisu. It was fantastic.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. I got the special. It was the orange roughy fish served over risotto with scallops and a crabcake.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The calamari was absolutely delicious. And, we loved the bread with the oil and vinegar.

Q_CZxNquhytqj4PCCp-7lQ.text: I would have to say pass on this one. They did not seem to busy but our server apparently was. The bus boy took our order. He was very nice and apologetic. So we still had hope the food was good because this was a recommendation from a friend. Sad to say my lasagne was cold in the middle and it was just a mess of melted cheese. One out of the three of the manicotti my husband ordered was good. When I asked our bus boy if they microwaved the food he said no and apologized again. Again our server never acknowledges us and I have to ask the bus boy for the check.I hate to give one star but sorry to say its deserved on this one. Find another venue to eat at.

xqvij5hupj_KowQ653Y6Yw.text: Best Italian restaurant ! I went here again Friday for dinner . The service is truly amazing .   The food took a little longer than usual  so they comped us a bottle of wine . Excellent wine selection . Our favorite dish is the shrimp on the stone .  We get two every time . My favorite salad is the chopped salad , it has roasted red peppers & artichokes.  It is easily enough for 2 . they have the best espresso martinis , not too sweet just perfect . Great ambiance & views .

nAZZuTp7h5og564cSXNO2A.text: This has quickly become our new date night spot! We found Ventano while looking online for restaurants near us with a view and lucked out!   Food: the food at Ventano is amazing. Their pasta selection and specials are sure to include everything you'd want from seafood to pasta with amazing sauce choices. I love their shrimp on the rock for an appetizer which is sizzling shrimp on a stone rock. I love their Shrimo Ventano which is huge shrimp with their pink sauce served with spinach and linguini (I'm dairy free and it's worth the rule breaking.) my husband loves their ravioli.... and their fresh breadsticks!  Drinks: Ventano has a very nice wine selection. There's even the option to do half bottles if you want to do a smaller taste of select options. The price ranges are good so you can splurge or enjoy a reasonably priced bottle.   Service: the servers are always very friendly and the staff is quick to refresh beverages and bring dishes! We have had good convo with everyone we've met there!   We come here at least once a month and love the local view and dinner option!

7VdYy8UJ0eXnjvSwacARYA.text: Great meal!!!! Early dinner on Sunday and the place was unusually busy as our server indicated. It's the busiest they have been on a Sunday early afternoon. Needless to say the food was delicious all things considered.  If you even remotely like shrimp and scallops- get the Scallop and Shrimp pasta. It's in a cream sauce with spinach and sun dried tomatoes. Soooo good!!! The piccata was ordered with shrimp which paired perfectly with the lemony sauce. The special was good, but was not a fan of the breaded halibut. The lobster ravioli was good,  but the blackened shrimp that can with the dish were overwhelmingly spiced. We didn't expect to get the affogato in a bowl, and it's not on the menu btw, but it was still delicious. The tiramisu was tasty but nothing spectacular. The creme brulee was warm- which you don't normally get when you order that and it was amazing. If you want a good Italian meal- this is the place to get it!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Calamari Fritti
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Lobster Ravioli

znFhYqFlMns3b0yoksrr8w.text: We (Party of 4) were at Ventano's for our Thanksgiving Dinner. The restraint was packed when we arrived which was no surprise since it was a Holiday.  With reservations we had a short wait and were seated. We were greeted by our waiter, Mike, and our evening began. Mike was very friendly and He immediately established a fun environment for our evening. Mike was very helpful on describing the choices on the menu and helped the 2 ladies in our party to decide between several dishes that they were interested in.  Our dinner was Great and we totally enjoyed the dishes that we ordered. Through our evening Mike was available to check on us and make sure that we were enjoying our meals and we were well taken care of.  Bottom line, Thank You to Mike for adding so much fun to our evening and for the Great Service. Kuddos to Ventanos for helping us to make a new Thanksgiving memory.

DfrAcVp1Q-QMFh4QW--FRA.text: Excellence in italian food. This place has an amazing patio with a great view of the strip in the distance. I had the veal parm it was fork tender and seasoned throughout. The pasta was a perfect al dente and a great side dish. Don't miss the rice balls they are a great starter dish and are huge.

-oolsP3YGLWTMdDzXypJtw.text: Wonderful experience EXCEPTIONAL service from Carlos, we enjoyed and encouraged his recommendations, from wine, entree , to dessert. Although we declined to have dessert due to our entrees being plentiful.  Great views at sunset if you can sit by a window

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

chB3IK49Exla2G3iv7CDvw.text: Very warm, appealing atmosphere, dimly lit. Open, so can be somewhat noisy. Service is very good and relatively quick.   Portions are relatively large. We split the Caesar salat and each portion was still adequate. I ordered only a cup of the lobster bisque, which was just right as an appetizer and The lobster bisque was exceptional, as good as any I've had. The lamb chops were very good. The brown sauce is not as pleasing to me as other "red/green sauces/jellies I've enjoyed. I was very pleased with th amount and quality of the vegetables that accompanied the lamb.

Udf0iqvLcfQBtWtcruQHCA.text: Great food and service.    The wine list is substantial and there is a good selection of draft beer.   I started with the lamb chops sizzling on a stone, followed with Risotto Alla Milanese(prosciutto & peas risotto) - both terrific.  My wife raved about her Eggplant Parmigiana.  We will be going again soon.

0j6P-sg5J-UaCzRtsX9Z-w.text: One of my most favorite places in all of Las Vegas, and definitely my favorite Italian spot in Henderson!!! They mix elegance, excellent food and service with just the right amount of laid back friendliness! Try the Veal Marsala and the Caramel Pecan Ice Cream Cake for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

fUmzU2GM7iXzFvabFHgSfA.text: Ventano Italian Restaurant is without a doubt the~BEST~Closest to home made Italian food we've ever had~  My husband is 97% Italian~We've eaten at all the best Italian Restaurants in Little Italy~New York~We've cooked Italian for our 57 married years~"Ventano like eating homemade"~  If you want Great Food~Fantastic service with a smile~AMAZING AMBIANCE~Great views~Ventano is all of these & then some~  We highly recommend eating here & give it ~Don & Fran Cifelli~~

B4DVMRDRJAcG9N7B51UG0A.text: Sometimes slow on the service but they are nice people, the food is delicious and their wine deals put the Vegas strip restaurants to shame.

c6w6DqJdCcMk39EmarE0vA.text: Love coming here for date night or family gatherings! Ventanos has become our family gathering spot! The lobster bisque to die for, the bread is delish! There's isn't a dish that haven't loved! You feel like your home when you sit down. The sights are beautiful as well!

UR8y7Eo8qeihsTrgEtAMNA.text: The food was absolutely fantastic!   Delicious classic Italian dishes served steaming hot. The bread came out fresh out of the oven.   I particularly enjoyed the spinach salad. Excellent service too!

VWU48DP36Bn3Fv0UIRIIRw.text: I've come to Ventano's a hundred times and always have top notch service and food. The ambiance is beautiful with a fantastic view if the strip. If you're lucky to dine during dinner, that sunset behind the strip is just breathtaking. Last night I had my husband's surprise birthday party. From start to finish was perfection. Calling to make the reservation and explaining it was a surprise, they went above and beyond to make sure it went off without a hitch. The extra details they thought of was superb. Richie, the bartender, was super helpful with the reservation. He went beyond to make sure my reservation was in place. Wonderful customer service for sure. Mike, the manager went beyond as well with his extra details. Excellent customer services as well! Fantastic manager. I see why his staff is so amazing. Our server was Marcos. Had him before and was so excited to see him as our server again. He handled our party of 25 alone with no issues. So polite, always smiling, extremely respectful and very friendly. Very accommodating as well. I would 100% recommend this amazing restaurant whether it be on a date, with some friends or a large party. Kid friendly, wonderful food and ambiance! Had the best time!

cTTZLfu5HXhHR2PBIZVAjg.text: I used to live a few minutes away when I lived in Vegas. I was a regular so I decided to go back when I was in town last week. Still a great place to get a lovely Italian meal.  It happens to have one of the best views of the entire strip for a beautiful sunset.

akyE82jvCo-cfKlVFtxQCw.text: Ventano's food has always been pretty good. Likewise their service is, every time we've gone there, absolutely TERRIBLE!!

oqyqxNz9hPX5KW7LP1p_LA.text: As always, delicious with good service. Our food was hot and fresh, server was amusing, and we received great recommendations. No Cons for this trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

rD-I-XADlSOr2ntUFJ5KMw.text: Had a trade show on the Strip and was recommended Ventano by one of my local contractors. Made a reservation for 10 the day before for a Thursday night. The place had a few other large parties but the team was very attentive, drinks were refilled, food was timely and delicious. Great selection of wine and price of the meals. For having such a large group I'm very happy with the pace of the evening. The view of the strip was beautiful (nice to see it from afar). I'll absolutely be back next time I'm in town. Super impressed!

eqixB19PL82givxcHDPEXw.text: Yum!! This place is so good! Perfect service, very friendly! The calamari was huge! My 1 year old daughter was gobbling it up! Can't wait to try other appetizers, they all sound so good I plan to return for a meal of just apps! I ordered the shrimp and scallop pasta, with penne instead of linguine (not the best fork spinner with pasta ). It was delicious! Also a large portion I have half for lunch tomorrow! My husband ordered the lobster ravioli with shrimp and it was great too! Will definitely be returning & recommending!

iRPqlkd9oEzOc3aD8Pw2ew.text: Quiet little restaurant-the wine list is decent and the pasta is pretty good- don't disappoint yourself with the capers as salad thought- the tomatoes are sour and the cheese is cheap. Ask for a booth- they have the best views and most comfortable seating- other bar area is closed off and smoking is allowed .

a6Q73c3EY_FaNNTEjpbbzQ.text: Dinner here was such a mixed bag I just closed my eyes and clicked a random star amount.  so I'll break it down by which things earned how ever many stars... (Stick around for the 1 star if you just want to read something hilarious)  5 Stars - Our server (I wish I heard his name more clearly... more on this later): He was cheery and hustled like freshman trying to make varsity his first time out.  Water glasses refilled as soon as they were half empty.  He buzzed about his section ensuring all of his guests were enjoying their meals and did everything with a smile.  The only other detail I could give you is that he mentioned he's worked at the restaurant for over 10 years.   4 Stars - Entrees: I Like my Vitello Francese zesty and it was but i wish it was dialed back just a little, it was also just a tad overdone, overall still quite delicious.  The pasta was cooked 'al dente' and the portions were quite ample, although to be fair I would not have complained about another slice of veal on my plate.  3 Stars - Soup, Salad and Bread: This may be splitting hairs but I thought the salad dressing was a little on the sweet side but the greens were fresh, the pasta fagioli was a little 'meh' (normally one of my favorite parts of going out for Italian food) and the bread sticks were just a little lacking in everything, taste, texture and the ability to sop up oil vinegar or extra pasta sauce... that being said I polished off a whole bag myself.   2 Stars - This may be 'reality check' time for management: bringing bread to the table in a paper bag is weird, off putting and ridiculous.  This of course, unless you want to be Olive Garden, Wait...! No...! Even Olive Garden brings their frozen and reheated bread sticks to the table in a basket!!!!  What the damn hell people?!?!  Maybe the owner thought he was going to run a taqueria and bought all the paper bags for chips for to-go orders, but ended up opening a nice Italian restaurant instead but didn't want to be wasteful so used the paper bags as a way to be a little greener.  Sorry I digress.  What were we talking about? right, 2 stars - I waited a few minutes after entering at the host counter before being greeted.  1 Star - Patrons... sorry, one, individual patron.  Look it's not even the restaurant's fault. I'll throw in an additional star for our waiter for having to deal with this scum bag. Let me describe him for you, mind you he was seated the whole time.  Approximately 6'0, maybe 250, shaved head and a white moustache and goatee.  He wore a bright red aloha shirt and thought the calamari was "Really Good," possibly in his late fifty's early sixty's and very clearly impotent. You read correctly "Clearly Impotent."  Now before you jump down my throat for being insensitive, lacking understanding or for bashing his medical condition, please understand that he was literally yelling the entire time I was at the restaurant about, and these are his words not mine, "Boner Pills!"  Perhaps it is clear why I couldn't hear our kind server tell us his name.  Throughout the meal he mentioned by name his need for, and by brand name, Cialis, all the while talking about his friends and their "hookers." He proceeded to prattle on about this "Chick"  he wanted to (This will be the one time I paraphrase in an attempt to keep things PC) - get with- .  Next it he asked his dining companion advice on a medical procedure that involved a needle and would have resulted in a slightly more permanent solution to his condition. I tried to have a conversation about the nice view from our table of the Vegas strip, but my normal inside voice was drowned out by his bellowing about this woman who would come to town and drop by a friend of his for an adult visit and to purchase something that could easily be confused for baking soda from far enough away.  While I'm all for people having a good time and I am understanding of people and there medical condition's, seedy cravings and I try not to  judge, can we all agree there are some things that we should keep in the comfort of our own homes with people we know?

RlsmTDpjSuw06w1-SCKnHg.text: Read the reviews and there's mixed ratings here, even from some of my Yelp buds.   What it takes to get 4+ star review from me... -The Service -The Wait -The Ambiance -The Food -The Price  5 for 5 on my last visit here at Ventano Italian grill.  It's bee awhile since I got to indulge in some Italian food.  Actually, it was three weeks, but who's counting.  The gf booked Ventano for my birthday weekend with friends.  That alone is 5 stars!! Service was pretty good. We didn't wait since we had reservations, our orders were taken quick, our drinks kept full, and our food didn't take long.  The ambiance at Ventano was one of the highlights.  If you're seated by the windows, you get a good view of the strip. As for the food, it's tough for me to judge what everyone else thought.  But they must have liked their dishes because nothing was left on anyone's plate.  I wanted their Chicken Marsala and Lasagna.  The gf wanted the same. I got the lasagna, she got the Marsala, and we shared.  Just my preference, but I prefer my lasagna to have more pasta and meat over one that is buried in sauce.  Ventano's is buried in sauce, which wasn't bad. It's just not how I like it.  As for their Chicken Marsala, this was pretty good.  This too was covered in their sauce, but I prefer my Chicken Marsala this way.  Ventano hooks this one up with enough pieces of chicken to satisfy your protein needs.  Regarding price, I thought it was about average depending on what you're getting.  Some dishes seemed a little high, while some was just right.    Overall, the food was decent, the service was on par, and the views are fantastic.    PS:  Their breadsticks are addicting.  3 orders please!  YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (025/366)
