T_ec3zVN7B1S9Tmo4OLAtQ.text: Upscale Italian food with an amazing view. Food menu is extensive, if you like Italian you should find what you're looking for. Nice wine selection as well. Staff is always super nice and service is great. They have a patio, but we've always sat inside. They also are open late which is a huge bonus, you can have a fancy meal at 11:30 pm for out of town guests that arrive late. Definitely recommend.

YIfXSEdUDS-bA9_Xb4x_hw.text: I love eating here . My husband and I have dined here several times now and it's simply delicious . I crave the large sized oysters and the clam chowder. We bring our newborn baby and she just relaxes while  mommy and daddy eat . We ended up spending around or more than a 100 ,but that's ok cause the food is amazing . I noticed that there is no women servers tho . Not that it matters but the serving staff is only men. The last time we ate there , they stuck us where all the food and servers walk in a out of . It was rather noisy and the glasses clattering was disturbing my baby's sleep . Next time I'd like to be offered a booth where the nice view is . Just cause I have a stroller shouldn't limit my seating and dining . But bittersweet the food is great!

aBP6RuMCRsNu59xSSHcENA.text: My wife and I have been regulars at Ventano's for almost 10 years. It's truly a hidden gem among the seemingly endless dining options in Las Vegas. The great food, enjoyable ambiance, and friendly staff simply can't be topped. I don't think there has been a birthday, anniversary, or other special occasion that we haven't celebrated here in years.  Let's start with the food. In addition to the well-prepared standard Italian fare with some French and other influences, there are always great steak and seafood specials. My personal weakness is their fillet mignon with rosemary demi glace - whenever that's on the menu, I can't not order it. The various seafood specials are also equally excellent, usually served over a bed of tasty risotto. Dessert is also fantastic - we can never decide between the creme brulee and the tiramisu, because we love both. Be warned - the portions here are large - you won't go home hungry after a meal at Ventano's, unlike many "fine dining" restaurants. Oh, and shrimp on the stone. Just do it.  Ventano's also has a very well-stocked wine cellar. In addition to the well-known names you'd expect to find in the cellar of any decent restaurant are dozens of spectacular wines just waiting to be discovered. I can't count how many times Mike, the manager at Ventano's, has introduced us to wines that we'd never heard of that quickly became some of our favorites.  What really makes this place special, however, is the staff.  I've never walked in and not felt like family the moment I stepped through the door. Everyone is friendly and accommodating, which is the perfect accompaniment to the old-world charm of the ambiance and decor.  Oh, and did I mention that this place has the best view of the Las Vegas Strip you can possibly get?  Living in Las Vegas, there's certainly no shortage of options available for great food.  I think that speaks pretty highly of just how great this hidden gem is, to keep us coming back year after year.

riLYoU0tyfOUn50SXrDPfQ.text: I have been to this place many times and it is one my favorite places to eat in the whole city. Very consistent food, always fantastic and reasonably priced for the experience and service you receive. The service is also consistent and outstanding.   The music is spot on and is never obnoxious.  This restaurant also features and excellent view of the city from inside, but they have patio seating with an even better view.   Because of the tasty food, phenomenal service, the atmosphere and view of the city, Ventano's is one of my favorite places to take family who visits.

PwMILixVFrjEjqhQKGxYuQ.text: Yummy Italian spot and a good space for a big private party. My sister had her dinner rehearsal lunch there and it was nice to have the separate dining room.  Bread was good along with the antipasta.  I had the shrimp pasta which was rich and very good. Dessert platter was also decent.  Service was good as well.  My sister also had a very good experience booking with them. They let her have a free tasting and were overall very easy to work with.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Dessert platter
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Seafood pasta
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Dipping sauces were delish

iCrlIxd5MEfYcSbNDbbVRQ.text: One of the best Italian restaurants around. Every time we have gone, the food & service have been exceptional. They even accommodated us when our family of 5 showed up on the second Saturday of December completely forgetting about all the Company Holiday parties that were going on. We were completely understanding & ready to go somewhere else but they told us to wait a minute & the manager (owner?) came out & said "no worries! Just give us a minute" They were able to get us a table with a 5-10 minute wait, max. & with smiles on their faces! That is going WAY above & beyond in my opinion.   The food gets an A+ & my half-Italian Husband (& I by the fact that I've eaten his Mom's cooking!) know good Italian food. Of course, no one will cook better than his Mom but their Cioppino & Veal Parmesan comes pretty darn close!

Tu_xBraQxjgfij-WpRoHcA.text: Everything from Antipasto to our desserts was excellent!  Warm bread sticks and our drinks were at our table within minutes after being seated.   I had the Spinach salad  topped with warm Bacon dressing.. a very unique touch and  the combination of mushrooms, bacon and bits of hard boiled eggs went well together.  The Shrimp Scampi was cooked to a perfect texture and the lemon butter cream sauce was to die for! I even dipped my asparagus in it!  I had the Spumoni Ice Cream cake with the cookie crumb crust and hubby had the Almond Caramel Pecan ice cream cake with Bananas Fosters. So make room for it! Dessert was insanely good!    Service and staff was top notch. Even the servers from the bar took time to acknowledge us as we were leaving. I also like the fact when you go to pay your server has a card machine and runs the card in front of you. Very convenient and saves time. Very nice atmosphere with an upscale feel to it and it's the perfect location with the view of the Las Vegas skyline. I see why now the place is always packed! Im very lucky that Ventano is in my neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Get here early the place get filled up fast...and time it so you can see the Vegas skyline as the sun sets.

7a8AbHfwr5dMbhJvYoU1FA.text: Carlos and Kevin did a awesome Job! Good food! Good customer service! Will definitely come back again!

Z3hTQt2Peh9W354R3lWn0g.text: I like this place. We have only eaten in the bar since we usually come for a late lunch. Service is always great and the food has been excellent both times we've been here. The menu has everything you could possibly ask for ... the choices make for a very difficult decision, but one worth the work.

nDPPwQcxIiEPesYGKCC3Jw.text: I was so looking forward to dining at this restaurant,  especially since there were rave reviews. The restaurant was crowded but since we made reservations they escorted us to the table. We waited 45 minutes for our food to arrive. We were a party of 6 and three dishes came out..... then the others arrived about 5 minutes later. I had ordered  the veal parm..... according to the preparation on the menu it was  supposed to be breaded. When   I got my plate it was a sea of red sauce and cheese. The veal was undeneath .... NOT BREADED, how dissapointing.  The service was non existent. I expect  that  it would have been better for the prices of the entrees. Sorry to say I will not be returning. The strangest thing around 8pm the restaurant literally cleared out..... on a Friday night??????

DBmQAre5KfdljjxxKXbE4A.text: We had a spectacular dinner with friends and family. The food was delicious and the service was good. Our meals came out as ordered and there was plenty of food. I only wish they didn't call out our orders as they delivered them (Ravioli?)- the server should be adept enough to know who gets what dish without asking the guests. Additionally, I was concerned about my husband's attire. He wore shorts and a colored shirt. However, a couple came in with a tube top and shorts. With such an atmosphere, I didn't expect such sloppy dress. The view as nice and we will return when the weather is nice enough to eat outside with such a beautiful view.

FH0HmCef_qxodpbqvEOW7w.text: The food was very good.  We were four adults having an early dinner on NYE.  The restaurant was about 3/4's full.  First thing I noticed was the clatter of talking and no background music.  Next was there was seating with good views but we were taken to a table in the upper section to the side with no view.  We are fine looking people of average size, and we were dressed nicely, so no reason to hide us.   Next, a bag was plopped in the center of the table.  It was a bag with dinner rolls.  We asked for a bread basket and the waiter declined our request:  "we only provide bread baskets for larger parties."    So, we passed the bag around and when the waiter returned we asked for more bread.  He nodded and never brought us more.  We ordered wine and the antipasto plate (very good!) and the waiter poured the wine and gave each an appropriate amount except one of us was poured about 1/3 of what the others got.   We wanted to simply enjoy our wine and antipasto but the waiter came 3 times prompting us to order, even though the restaurant wasn't full and was actually getting a thinner crowd.  We ordered, I reminded about the bread, and the food came in a short time.  Very good except 2x we had to remind servers that one of us had not gotten the vegetable side dish that came with her entree.  We ordered eggplant, manicotti, and two of the house specialties.  We all liked our meals and they were very generous servings.  Never got more bread.  Just below our table on the main floor, a family was seated while before we ordered our entrees.  A screaming child, 2 other kids and parents (5 humans).  The kids all got macaroni dishes from a kids' menu.  I think their final bill must have been significantly less than our 4 adult meals, antipasto, and 2 bottles of wine.  They got a bread basket.

osuCpo7BoKdKZCnsagpIEg.text: Recently had dinner here celebrating a friends birthday. While overall it was a good experience, my entree order was spaghetti carbonara. The menu description was on the money - sauced w/pancetta, eggs and parmesan. However, what arrived was a version of Alfredo - definitely a lot of cream and almost no bacon/pancetta. I didn't send it back because I didn't want to create a distraction from the birthday boy who had selected the restaurant and was anxious that everyone enjoyed their meal.  Was very disappointed in my meal as authentic carbonara is my favorite.

Egxw0kXCRq6oBh33JyQVmQ.text: This place NEVER lets me or my family down. From the management all the way down they all do a fantastic job and serve great tasting food. My favs are shrimp on stone and lasagna, but no mater what you choose, I'm sure it will be great!

jMK95A8gLYL0me43XcYnWg.text: Food is ok but service is so-so in the evening.  They want to pay more attention to big parties rather than couples.  Last time we were there we were both disappointed in the Shrimp-on-a-stone that is usually outstanding but this time it seemed there was NO seasoning...very bland.  My wife had chicken parmesan and I had Lasagna which was excellent, but we had to catch the waiter's eye or a bus boy to get refills of soda or water.  The bread sticks are good and always hot but I wish they'd serve them with butter, too and not just the olive oil.  We've been "members" of their dining club for years but they seem to be going downhill.  There was something to be disappointed about in both of our last two dining experiences there.

5zVSMhMF9qyX-V619L3jdg.text: This restaurant was absolutely amazing. The server was phenomenal. We ordered what he suggested. It was also great atmosphere, the view and the food.

yeaA-M1ouN1E680A8vJOng.text: I always the large tasty portions of this Italian hidden secret!    Downfall is the acoustics..  Staff are friendly and fast without making you feel rushed.  I had the seafood linguini!  Delish!

zAzi7qFz6e_2NLO_E0EzVA.text: The place looked nice and all. My friend and I ordered Fettuccini Alfredo with chicken, calamari, clam chowder and their specialty dessert (forgot the name of the dessert) we told our server that we want our dessert the same time as our food because my friend won't really eat the dishes we ordered, she just want the dessert. We got our Calamari first and it was Amazing, probably THE BEST calamari I've ever tasted. Then took a while to get my fettuccini.. That was fine.. as I was eating it i noticed that my dish have HAIR! It was okay, i understand but i didnt want to eat anything else so we just asked for our dessert that hasnt came in yet! Our server said it will be right out in a minute.. It's been 1 1/2 hours and no dessert on our table !   Won't come here anytime soon..

K05fLdK6FDjXF5DymHT_rQ.text: So happy we "accidentally" found this gem. Excellent experience from the service (Lalo) and from appetizer through dessert.  If we lived here we'd be regulars.

R5578bpZjNVtVFnQxWzUPA.text: Deelish! The ambiance inside is gorgeous, the service is great and the food was great as well. I had the Rigatoni Portofino and it did not disappoint. My daughter had the kids pepperoni pizza and it was just alright. All in all it was a very nice dining experience. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I've had better Italian food that does earn 5 stars.  However this place is a solid 4 -4 1/2 and will not disappoint. I would love to visit again when I am back in Vegas. I would definitely recommend this place

dafvrYP2YGyofHWUZmzZBg.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time.  The atmosphere is old school Italian, and the place is huge.  It was very busy, but in a good way.  The service was good and the owner came around and talked to us.  He is super nice.  Now to the food....sorry, it was just average.  My linguine was undercooked (to the point it stuck to your teeth).  The food others had did not get rave reviews either.  The food is heavy and a little sloppy on the plate.  The wine we had was great, Coppola Director's Cut Zinfandel.  Overall, it was a fun place but they need to focus on the food more and improve their plating.

4DPmcLXbfluG40DBV4BECg.text: I have to stop the madness. I hate giving negative reviews but it has to stop. The server that's name start with an A .. was our server. Nice guy, but he just blatantly walks up and asks you things by totally interrupting the conversation it drives me MAD! No manners, no courtesy, no "excuse me", NOTHING. I am so tired of this! A great waiter makes his/her presence known but doesn't just barge up HOW ARE YOU? My girlfriend was talking about her very ill husband and it happened at least 3 times by A and even more times by some dark haired kid that I think was a food runner IS EVERYTHING OKAY? DO YOU WANT MORE WATER? HOW IS THE FOOD? Please, servers and/or owners -- LEARN that interrupting RUINS the dining experience for your guests. If you MUST, be polite, say EXCUSE ME and WAIT until you are acknowledged, don't just barge in and say a paragraph while your guests are trying to talk about something ..... it ruined my entire time at Ventano's. And by the way the food WAS DELICIOUS!!! I am sorry for the chef who did such a great job on the food because these under skilled waiters are just horrible and made it all a terrible experience. If I ran/owned a restaurant I would DEMAND my servers LEARN how to be great servers, there is actually a handful of great rules/practices they should be following, and so far at Ventano's they aren't. Big fat bummer.

pJC_cymDzXXuu_eCkyftfw.text: Amazing Italian food with a beautiful view! They have the best lasagna and there warmed caesar salad with prosciutto is mouth watering.

wQ99wnXLiBrraRnnNgVwGA.text: This might be the best place for Italian in the Las Vegas valley!  The lobster ravioli is incredible and ever thing I tasted here was very good and well worth the price.  My wife is obsessed with their breadsticks.    This is the place to bring your out of town friends and family when you want to show them the best of Vegas.  We also met the owner the second time we were there and he was a really awesome host that let us hand pick our table.  That really impressed me.  The wait staff is friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.

gtXEgCfsjXTN4UM_xGJwaA.text: I started looking through yelp for a great italian place to take my wife for mothers day since she loves italian and we rarely eat it when we go out because I am not a fan but after checking out the reviews I decided that we would try Ventanos, I decided to hop on open table and make a reservation for 4 for mothers day. I was pretty excited to take her here because of all the hype that I had read, It is unfortunate that it did not live up to it. Let me explain.   We walked in and let the lady working the door know we had reservations and she says no problem let me see what we can do. After a minute or so she asked us to step to the side and sit in a oddly place booth by the front door while we wait. This may seem nit picky but it seems it would be a much nicer sitting/waiting area without the table.. Anyways, we then waited there for between 10 and 15 minutes while watching them seat other parties of 4 or more while we just sat there.. Another lady who I am assuming is a manager or owner was walking around checking on the place and helped clear a table that is on a raised area right when you walk in and then came and seated us. I can deal with waiting to be seated, yes it is irritating when you make a reservation just to find yourself waiting.   Once we were seated it took quite a while for the server to even come to the table to offer drinks or even say hello. All while I am overhearing the older couple sitting right behind us praise who I am assuming was the manager about how awesome his service was. Once we finally ordered our drinks the next thing that caught me off guard was when he walked by and set a brown bag with bread sticks in it on our table. Now, I don't know if that is the regular procedure and if it is, in our opinion which may not mean too much it is very tacky to come to a restaurant selling $25-$30 entree's and be handed a greasy brown bag with bread sticks in it..   So, now that my kids have breadsticks and are happy that they have some food we are now ready to order and again we waited for an extended amount of time to order and every drink on our table went completely empty. The waiter then came over and we ordered. My son ordered a pizza, my daughter got the alfredo  my wife got the veal marsala and I ordered Filipino chicken adobo... I know that sounds odd but I guess the chef is filipino and has this on the menu. Once the food came I thought it would be the saving grace. My daughters fetticini was grainy but everything else was good, but the part that was odd to me is that the Filipino Adobo dish was by far the best dish at our table... To the point that my wife, the italian food lover took my adobo sauce and put it on her noodles from the marsala because she said the sauce was just ok.   So now we fight the battle of paying the bill, the server came back with the check quite a while after we had finished and I tried to get my card to him quickly and unfortunately he walked away before I could hand it to him so I looked at the bill. $83 for 4 of us with 2 of them being kids.. Kids drinks at a $3 price point each was a little excessive and I although the food was ok it was definitely not worth the $25-$30 price range that is being charged. We sat again for another 25 minutes exactly (yes, we timed it) before the server came back to take our check. Once we paid we filled out the feedback card which I highly doubt made it to management, nobody is going to hand their boss something that says, well the food was just okay and your service was absolutely horrendous.   I personally cannot stiff anyone, and this was the first time in my life that I wanted to walk out without leaving any tip. No drink refills and an $83 lunch that took from 12:45 when we walked in the door until 2:50 when we walked out is crazy, I could only imagine if every server in that place was that slow and non attentive they would seat only 4-8 parties at that table all day with an average 2 hour meal time.  I wanted to like this place because the location is great but the bottom line is that even if the food was just ok and not great and they had stellar service I would come back over and over again but with the food being just ok and the service being horrible I know that I will not go out of my way to go back or recommend anyone to go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. This is how they served our breadsticks..... In a brown bag.... Are we on fremont street???

cUjIHSCnIoDKn_qzi-D0Jw.text: Pleasantly surprised when we went here for dinner recently. Customer service was top notch, food was excellent, great selection of pastas and wine. Huge portions, delicious desserts!    Wanna come back when a little cooler to sit on patio and enjoy the view!

kweJbv-6lRdFxHmwGwQTrA.text: I took my daughter and Wife it was her 50th birthday. This was one of the worst experience we ever had or seen in all my years really sad. After 30 min a hour into it a waiter ask what we ordered then seen some guy go by us with our food back to the kitchen with it wtf. Then 15 min later food finally came. It was cold and dry and terrible i took one bite. Then they said we will only charge you half WOW. NEVER AGAIN

Bd-HsuXBW_8hzYldf3L__w.text: We have been long time customers of this restaurant.  We hadn't been here in about a year because the last time were there, the food was not up to what we were accustomed to.  We had to send back, shrimp was not cooked through. There was also an extremely long wait.    This time, last night, I made a reservation for 7:30 pm, we arrived at 7:15 pm.  Hostess said they were running a little behind.  We said ok.  We sat and waited.... And waited...Several people were seated who entered after us.  At 8:00 I asked the hostess, is our table ready yet?  She said no and proceeded to sit a party of four.  I asked about why they were seated first, she said "their reservation was at 7:00.    At 8:15, we were finally seated.  Waiter was very pleasant.  They brought bread and drinks, we ordered.... Then the wait was on. We noticed nobody was receiving food.    At 8:40 we received our dinner.  We wasn't real hungry by then because we kept eating the bread because no food was coming out and we were hungry.  The food was hot and looked good.  I had chicken marsala, which was always my favorite here.  I started eating, it tasted good until I cut into a thicker piece of chicken... put it in my mouth and realized It was very much under cooked.  I spit it out and just ate some of the pasta that accompanied it.  When the waiter came over at 9:00, asked if I liked the dinner because I hardly eaten it.  I told him the chicken wasn't cooked all of the way, he said he could replace, I said no that we weren't hungry.  We paid the bill and then left.  It's very sad because we used to love this restaurant and would recommend to our friends.  Now, it wouldn't be one that we recommend to any of our friends.   And, we probably would not choose to come back.

104o4EW2-jIsP5-h-9xPfQ.text: Love this restaurant! Every meal ordered was great, including our young sons. This is a must try for anyone in Vegas, local or visiting. They have a wonderful atmosphere inside and out...especially the view from the outside  balcony tables. The service is attentive and accommodating with great attitudes. Our son Chaison Nivatvongs-Tobin  gives them 5 stars and so do I!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The outside balcony area with a great view.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Our son giving it a big approval.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggplant Parma w/ Linguini...my personal fave so far.

BH02AtWtCJyUwdodiiC6Ug.text: We have been dining here for nearly 20 years and are extremely happy with the delicious food, the great service and the wonderful atmosphere.  Between the two of us, we have had almost everything on the menu.  Chef Arnauld quite often leaves his kitchen and greats guests during their dinner to make sure the food and service are up to his standards.

WUve5fj405eVxlKEQ24rrg.text: The dinner this evening was in a word: AMAZING.   The meal started with several appetizers of mussels, clams, shrimp, and meatballs. Salads were delicious: fresh & crisp. The entrees were equally delicious, tasty and hot, Including lamb, ribs, pasta, and seafood dishes.   Besides the taste of the meal, the service was spectacular. Mike and his staff took great care of our party of six and left us wanting nothing. I eagerly look forward to our next meal at Ventano's. Absolutely wonderful.

_j9ZZK5BwGZYFyWCTb_lrA.text: I have eaten here many times the food is always fantastic, service is great, view is one of the best in the city and  Arno the owner and Mike the manager have always taken great care care of us!!  Find dining away from all the hustle and bustle and a great wine selection.  Their seafood specials are phenomenal but I don't think you can order anything that you won't like.  Make sure to try the shrimp on the stone!!!!

_BTYZ-OW_Griz2ybhs7Pvg.text: We went here for our date night. The food was very good! We both ordered a dish with shrimp. The waiter even customized one of the meals because of a dietary restriction to cream based sauces. You have to order the house salad - the vinaigrette is delicious! The service could have been a bit more timely, but all in all it was a great experience. Watch out for the price tag, though. This is not a cheap date!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi. Delicious!
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Scallop and shrimp (oil based sauce instead of cream) minus the scallops.

ecTQOk0Gba1uIbYfkQdtUg.text: Wonderful food. Wonderful service. Very accommodating with pets. I wish they had a doggie menu. Selection of wine is great and the food even better. When in Nevada, I would visit this place again.

LFAe5wEhDuorG49PhdccSw.text: We have been here several times and are never disappointed. The service is excellent and friendly and the owner is usually around to check on things. The food is superb and we've tried several dishes. Especially love the Baked Bucatinni and the Steak Pizzaiola, just fabulous. Fine atmosphere and nice view of the city.

5KDptjHpkxn9MhW6OWnF8Q.text: This is great Italian Cuisine with an awesome view of the strip.  Romantic place to have dinner.  Try it You Will Love It!!

9-FkapOc_vF1ekOPfGBWbQ.text: I only come here once a year and that's only because a really good Provider in our office treats us here for our holiday dinner. I have been here four times. My first three times I can honestly say the food was exceptional. I can't say the same on my most recent visit.   The staff was amazing as always. Place was pretty packed. Nice place to have a group dinner and also a nice date night place. Atmosphere is nice  Food this time was not the best. It lacked flavor in many dishes. It's was really disappointing since I've had amazing food here. I don't know why it was off this time around but I hope it improves because I honestly think Ventano's deserves more than a 3 star rating but I just couldn't give it this time around. One too many dishes lacked flavor. Too much flavor.   This won't stop me from coming and I hope that when I do return it won't take a year to come back, I'll be able to take my family here and having the satisfying meal I know they can offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

2G0H49z0EIvQqGGsFWbaBw.text: Carlos G was our waiter, and he was awesome.  It was really busy and he still have us excellent service. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because the kitchen took a really long time to make our food, which is no fault of Carlos's, because when it did come it was super hot and fresh. We had 3 bottles of wine, and wanted one more of the same kind, but they had run out. Due to this, Carlos gave us 2 desserts on the house.

WkllyFORsE6iRam8e8NSBQ.text: One of our favorite places in Vegas. It was busy on a Thursday night, but even without a reservation we waiting 20 minutes for a table. My husband had ribs and I had Spedini and Risotto. Both were fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

vHEADjMVRrmpN_V2nrnVfA.text: We were back  6 months later for an early lunch and everything was great. If you love a great salad and not much less.    You have to try there " Chopped Salad".......really amazing....oh and the fresh warmed bread. Service was perfect.....again not 100% Italian but great tasting food at $$ prices.

W370-dI5oqSML-5YHahZ0A.text: Since my last review, I have only been here 2 more times. Once was for a large graduation dinner/party, where I thought the food was pretty good. We came again tonight because I had a gift card and we were in the area.  My opinion of the food dropped tremendously since the prior visits. The restaurant was half empty but we had to wait about 15minutes for a table. We decided to get a drink at the bar, which is also a smoking area (yuck), the bartender was too worried about the TV's in the bar than to wait on us, well we finally ordered 2 Ginger and Bulleit, so either the ginger ale was flat or he added water to our drinks because they tasted watered down. We got seated, right behind the waiters station (annoying) even though there were many other tables open (whatever). We both decided to get the specials of the night. He got the New York Strip and I got the Crab stuffed Dover Sole (the waiter raved about it). They both tasted like bad diner meals, I was supposed to have Spinach risotto on the side, it was more like old cold rice with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese mashed into a lump (Gordon Ramsey would have a cow!) I found a shell, I think/I hope in my crab stuffing on top of my fish. Nothing tasted good, it was sad what they did to that food. Our wait staff and hostess were nice and friendly but that doesn't make my tummy happy.  I don't want to go back.

eDamuBZ5E5AXQY11PFTGSg.text: Amazing is all I can say! The eggplant caprese is soooo good. Truly everything in menu is a flavorful mouthful. The family atmosphere  re is great and the team makes sure all guests are satisfied! And the best view in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggplant caprese!!! Amazing!

fmSn2KDxPawMB0tLuXL8jg.text: I LOVE this place!!!  They have it all!!!  I have been coming to this place for for 10 years plus.I have walked in and felt like I was with family!  I can be alone or with friends.  I enjoy the bar area to have a cigarette or 10, if I chose.    The rest of the dining area is non- smoking guests. So if you do not like smoke, take advantage of the entire dining room!!!    The bartenders Pattee, Richie, Archie,Dawn,Matt, and Rafeal are awesome!!

N4c4TpKsQ4LDhAbp9CgTnA.text: First time there and I was impressed with the service and food. Price is very good for the quality of the dish. I'm hooked, I'll be back. Really nothing negative about the entire dinning experience. I especially like the fact that loud hip-hop/dance music is NOT playing while you are enjoying your meal.

jpi59PeRxyhIAi99FR7hCg.text: This place is great!!!!!! It has an amazing view of the city!!! The food is also really yummy and their staff is extremely friendly. A must try!!!!

QsInshUs4vVbuZzgVM5Auw.text: Delicious food. Service here is a hit or miss. Sometimes amazing and detailed serves aware of the menu. Sometimes not so attentive ones. The outside patio is a great spot to check the sunset and the strip's lights. Beautiful view. Good selection of wine, best warm bread :) I do recommend.

Yq7m8mzZOJbrZZU0HdJTcQ.text: We ordered our meal to go tonight and first our order was given away to a Postmates driver...do you not confirm the order is correct?? Then we get home and the order is wrong. I called to have his order remade and not only was the hostess super rude and unhelpful with resolving the issue- no manager came to speak to my husband the first OR the second time and we were still charged for all the errors. The restaurant was not busy so the lack of basic attention to detail or concern for the inconvenience was disappointing. Over an hour of hassle when we can easily go to a closer restaurant with just as good of food but way better service.

DDP4YBgdatQOSWjpXOZsPg.text: The food here is just amazing! Service was great, view of the city and wine a complimentary touch to a wonderful. Nothing better than sending someone your way and they love it as much as we do!!

uW20YGwVYMAQwlLvsfgfmw.text: Beautiful views and delicious food! This location probably has one of the best restaurant views that's not on the strip and local to henderson. Because of that, this is a great go-to for date night or special occasion!

GxCPVhzwuvSHU1OTHXPB-g.text: I had a special event at Ventano in January for you husband: His 20 Yr. Sobriety Party. We used their banquet room, and had 50 people there. I worked heavily with the manager / partner of Ventano, Michael.  This is the place to do a special event. Michael is a tremendous asset, because he really knows events! He completely helped me with whole set up flow, and they even put up the party signs and worked closely with my balloon decorator. The food was great, the service was unbeatable, and I got so many compliments from guests on both! Ethical...I wanted to get more food, and Michael said what I had ordered was going to be plenty. Also, I had paid in advance, and over paid, and he contacted meforthesmall refund right away after the party. Great location, excellent food and service, and honesty! Need I say more?

O97C8dEx_JdQNrYxpLXYNQ.text: Highly recommend! Food is delicious, staff are very friendly. Best Italian food in town!

2GddP5-RgQm1lSHnDIP1KQ.text: This is always my go to spot for Italian in the Valley. Went for dinner tonight and was very impressed as usual. We started with the usual steamed clams and a grilled romaine salad. Since we get this just about every time we are used to the chef's incredible small little neck clams and these were large. Just mentioned to waitress, she immediately stopped by the table and replaced them with perfect smaller ones. This is a serious chef based Italian place and our Veal Parmesan was perfect as usual. Best sauce in town. Perfect meal as usual.

wHdVw5bz5eC_GKk3ULBy4w.text: The breadsticks alone are worth checking this place out.  Our server was incredibly friendly and incredibly knowledgeable of the menu.   The food was authentic (my wife's Italian, she approved) and so delicious are already excited for our next trip back.   The view is a great bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

FVHSLdsyBK4jifGZ_wWRKA.text: We came her last night for dinner with a friend, and although the setting is of this place is romantic with a beautiful view of the strip and an awe experience of the sunset, it was still nice for a little get together  with a long time friend. The staff was very friendly and even chef Arnauld came out to check on everyone including my 9 month old son whom was very well behaved!!  Chef Arnauld has a fun and sarcastic humor which enlightened our experience there!   The food was great! Of course bread was served with olive oil and balsamic vinegar, I ordered the tortellini with pesto which was perfectly made! I am a sucker for pesto! And my friend got the veal de Angelo, and he totally loved it! Everything about our  visit was great, I will say that it was a tad bit warm in there but that's nothing to take away a star for and complain about when everything was delightful!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The view of the sunset from our table
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The view of the strip from our table
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Veal de Angelo!! Yumm!!

ga1yMkhp8AKaJceJhASDKg.text: Me and my husband came here just as a little date night. He made reservations particularly cause he read they have a patio and it's gorgeous outside tonight. To start, the patio has one of the best views in all of Henderson, the ambiance is magnificent with the lights and music, and the service and food was wonderful. Our server was Lalo, absolutely attentive, kind, and fast. Our busser was was Johan and he was very efficient and lovely! We had such a wonderful experience made by these two that we will absolutely be back with family and friends. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Patio

xV-oeENbhNWWAhCkDQI21w.text: First time here.  Came for a birthday dinner and my friend asked me to choose where we were going as he didnt know where to pick so I looked up the menu and reviews and decided that this sounded like a good place.  I loved the way it looked and felt inside.   We were told to seat ourselves and chose a window booth which was quite comfortable, quiet and had a beautiful view of the strip in the distance, I can only imagine what that would be like at night!  I also felt like it had a romantic vibe and would be a great place to take a date, haha, if I had a date to bring!  The waiter, Adam, was super friendly, attentive and made eye contact which isnt as common as you might think!      We werent dicing!  We ordered the beef carrpaccio and bruchetta.   The Bruchetta was AMAZING.    I didnt care as much for the carrpaccio as I used to but that isnt a reflection on the restaurant or chef, Its just not something I am into as much as I once was.  For dinner we ordered, Veal Parmgiana, the potato wrapped salmon and the pesto Gnocchi.     Our friend loves the salmon and I tried a bite and agree, it was DELICATE...JUICY... and full of flavor though I wasnt a personal fan of the sauce it came with but it wasnt my dish and she loved it and that is all that matters.     The Birthday boy had the Veal and said it was good and I had the pesto but it was just OK, I didnt care for how dry it was..but that can be fixed, I brought the leftovers home   :)    Luckily I am a brilliant home cook  :D  Dessert time!  Friend ordered chocolate lava cake or molten cake maybe and it was SOOOO Good, Rich and warm in your mouth, we all like to order 3 different desserts and each of us will try each one to see which is best, I had the amazing succulent creme brulee but the B-day boy, while they did light a candle and Happy B-day was written on the plate in powdered chocolate which was so cool, None of us felt like it had much flavor....  So....  We will return to try dicing here......Its not like we didnt like it...we have just had a better experience....but sure, we'll be back.    :)    The die may leads us to different foods...which will change the experience completely....  Oh and I forgot the spumoni at the end, I asked if it was ice cream as it said Ice cream cake and the waiter said, no its just cold cake so we wanted ice cream and passed but later saw someone else order it and asked them how it was and it was ice cream!  Also...bread in a bag?   do you need me to add you to the wish list (My gift giveaways group) and buy you a basket?

MgP-7pwrObUBCRZYw3I4Xw.text: Came here for the first time last year, I think, as a work lunch get together. I've been back a couple of times for lunch during work. That's how good this place is!  I absolutely love their eggplant dishes and they even have a decent Philly Cheese Steak on the menu. The atmosphere is very cozy during lunch and I can only imagine what it's like at night for dinner as they have an amazing view of the city.   Bookmark this place and check it out if authentic Italian food is your thing. You will not be disappointed! The servers are very polite and on top of things and the owner is a real charmer. Fellas, guard your dates! lol!! j/k!!

jk_MuzRzgYaEFHHA1PGdqQ.text: I will agree with those reviews that are claiming the food was bland. It really, really, was. I had the Lobster Ravioli and boyfriend had Potato Wrapped Salmon.  His portion was generous, and salmon cooked well, but there was very little flavor. No use of herbs, spices, seasoning..nothing.  My lobster ravioli was a fairly skimpy portion for $25 ... four decently sized ravioli and 3 small shrimp. Once again, I wouldn't mind this, had it not been so bland. The sauce was completely unimaginative and left a lot to be desired.  The service was adequate. We were seated immediately and our server was fine. The water was refilled in timely manner and we didn't have to wait too long to get the check. Overall, not worth the $50 for two entrees without drinks or an appetizer.

LJqF_OfwrNRXR4YN5HyWLw.text: Wow is all I can say! Staff were dicks but the food was amazing! Great view of the Strip too

b-1eJAj1RSQazqK5YsHshQ.text: This is by far a hidden gem here in Henderson. The food is magnificent. From the Lamb appetizer to the pizza and egg plant parm, this is a must when you are in the area. Oh and the view of the entire strip is the cherry on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb Appetizer
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. 12in Pizza with Italian Sausage, Pepperoni, and Meatball
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Egg Plant Parm

TmgYj5U9Mm-AgXtWD1go6w.text: The atmosphere is very nice, especially the view. But the food was just okay, and overpriced. Service was good.

8Aqy27prO1ZpFuiiXWHpTA.text: We decided to have lunch here at the suggestion of a co-worker and to check out their banquet room (we are currently debating on a wedding venue and heard good things about their event services).  First of all, the bread with balsamic vinegar and oil is so delicious.  I could have eaten that alone as my entire meal and been satisfied!  I ordered the Ventano Tortellini and my fiance ordered the Fettuccine con Funghi.  The portions are huge and have that special homemade taste about them!  We definitely needed to go boxes. Our server obliged us in showing us the banquet room and patio (where the ceremony would take place).  He answered all of our questions professionally and even had a packet put together with pricing etc.  He gave us the event coordinators information (we came in on a Saturday, so he was not there). We are not sure if this is the place for our wedding, but we will certainly be back for the food!

rDJgDP0oWcJ6t6WacBwRBA.text: Went late night and ate at the bar area with my girlfriend.  She ordered the potato wrapped salmon and I ordered the lasagna.  I have never seen my girlfriend eat a "whole"  plant of food before.  She lived her meal so much she asked me to go to the Chiefs and thank them for the meal.  It was absolutely fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Potato wrapped salmon and Lasagna.  Ate all the fresh bread sticks as well.  It was amazing.

DfLyEkR7K0QOlA7hwagyOQ.text: I took my mom here for her birthday and this place did not disappoint.  We were given a booth by a window with a view of the Las Vegas strip in the distance. They also have outdoor seating overlooking the strip as well if you are willing to sweat it out in the summer.  We were promptly greeted by our server.  Some of the male servers I saw looked like they stepped off a page of GQ. :)  Just an observation. ;) I ordered the shrimp on the stone which was sooooo delicious.  My mom ordered the lasagna, while I ordered the ventano tortellini.  Both were excellent.  Food came out in a timely manner and service was great.  You can check out their menu online, with prices, before you go.  I loved the vibe of this place, and I didn't get a feeling that it was dated at all like some reviews suggest.  But, I also don't judge a place by how it looks, some of the best food I have had came from dated hole in the walls! :) When we were leaving, we were thanked for coming by the hostesses, such a nice touch.  I will be back with my husband for a date night.

B019YwKmt4J2mnj5LdEVmQ.text: Thank you Chef/Owner Arnauld for the great food and service last night. Ventano never disappoints us and the view of the Vegas valley and Strip is wonderful. We look forward to coming back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Beef Carpaccio

ui7GK-EDgUnm7fjmE59Csg.text: We ate here on 11/9. Marcos was our waiter. He realized that it was taking too long for our food to come out, and went to investigate. I'm not going to write out the details, but Marcos figured out what happened, and then made it right, without us having to initiate anything. I really appreciated that from him. Too often service businesses make mistakes, and then put the onus on the customer to try to resolve the issue. But on this night, Marcos made it a very special evening by taking good care of us on his own initiative. We will be back for the great service and the excellent food.

mGwYCchpspdvKJZ4UbOGHg.text: My husband and I have been wanting to try this place for a while. Tonight we finally did. WOW!! Amaaaazzzing!! From the minute we walked in until the minute we left, we were incredibly impressed!! The decor, the view, the service, the smell, the wine, the food, the food, the food, the value, the chef speaking to us at our table, did I mention the food!? Every single thing about our experience was way beyond our expectations! I've been so disappointed lately when we try something new, NOT this time!! 10 stars!!! I would, however like to sit at a better table with better view next time. Do I need a reservation to make this happen??

mX9IQagXBlJ495-MkupzVg.text: My husband and I used to love this place. But they've changed their recipe. The sauce is not as good. My husband had chicken Parmesan and the chicken had a lot of gristle and was tough. The Alfredo was mostly cream and no cheese. We won't go back there to eat.

3heDOug6M1E0Wkf7MH3Wuw.text: My wife, Pam, and I moved to Henderson one month ago.  We are always on the look out for good places to eat.  I had read glowing reviews on Ventano's Italian Grill.  So, we decided to try Ventano's for lunch.   We had great service from Arturo and Austin.  We were off to a great start.  Then, the Bruschetta arrived which was not good.  The tomatoes and bread were tasteless.  I ordered the homemade Lasagna which sounded good but lacked taste.  Pam had the Speciality of the House, Tortellini.  Unfortunately, it tasted the same as my Lasagna.  Both meals arrived in a steaming hot bowl.  The presentation would not have survived in the Chopped Kitchen.  We will not return to Ventano's.  I do hope their evening meals and presentation of food is better.

QOOiZdH_WPtQDgk2PvcSPQ.text: This was one of the worst Italian meals I have ever had. The calamari was sub-par at best and the franchise was essentially alfredo sauce with lemon added. I can here from the ratings but was extremely disappointed. This was topped off with waiting about 20 minutes for our server to come over to get the check when we had clearly been done. The only good part of the dinner was the wine and the view but we will not be back.

luLoNU56U8u6BAPfCyZUsQ.text: Everything is overly large and underwhelming. In the trade off between quality and quantity, Ventano serves up large platters of passe fare. It's not that it's bad per se. It's just not that good. It strikes me as a notch above the Olive Garden, only without the pretense that you're family. You're a customer. But not one they will pay much attention to. A plate pushed to the side sat for ten minutes in a mostly empty restaurant.

vQ5i-WfgzIXvvJRTLTrXMw.text: We were a party of 6 last night to celebrate my birthday. Team Ventano was amazing as usual and made me feel extra special on my special day. Kudos to all for the amazing meal and service. My guests has a wonderful time and raved about the food. Well done Ventanos, well done.

MMRXZpgK1OFeqrErCXtUMw.text: The location and staff were really good. Unfortunately the food is really salty and overdone. I had the Eggplant Rollitini and it was bland in flavor but seemed like the salt level was very high. I normally love Italian food and its complex flavored but they missed it with this one.   The Cesar salad was soggy and had to much dressing. The bread sticks were very tasty though. With all of Las Vegas' food options I think you can do better....

FRO_RPAlbPQlb7uY1AM8FQ.text: We go here every year for NYE. The mussels and clams are amazing. The clam broth is perfect for dipping the hot breadsticks into.   The zeppole dessert is so crazy. You have to order it! I started laughing when I saw it but loved every bite!

_cFDU4-IPZTntwVKUQD5mg.text: Delicious. Great food.  Favorite is the potato wrapped Salmon!  Service, bread and food is wonderful.

hUOQBqVb94ZWhZSOgP4gGQ.text: I used to come here a lot with my parents and the food was delicious, so I took my mother here on her birthday; The food was not nearly as good as it used to be. Service was still great, but the gluten free chicken piccata was bland and the noodles were mushy. My mom got the shrimp parmesan, and it was hard to tell it was even shrimp because of all the breading. My dad got shrimp fra diavolo which wasn't bad.

KDFsB5TurA9i-sumOUEWbQ.text: Love this place and love their food. The servings are huge and taste so good. The very best thing about this place are their cannoli. I don't think I've ever had better ones than these. Staff is very friendly.

6us6zHhv3n94N-prI89Whw.text: One of the best secrets in Las Vegas. The view and food are excellent. Prices are really good too.

sao-CimZf0WY0g32s7EkJw.text: I went to dinner tonight with my fiance to celebrate a special occasion and the food was great! We got seated fairly quick and our server was amazing. I give them a two star because half way through our dinner two employees started to argue out in the dining area. It wasn't too noticeable at first until more tables started to notice as they continued to make a scene. It was very unprofessional to have employees arguing in front of a full restaurant..

4hSSlnTkHBqVFX8rFn1Gpg.text: My boyfriend and I went on a late Valentine's day dinner last night. We didn't get a chance to go out until later in the night (around 9:30). Seeing as a lot of our usual spots were already closed, we searched for a place that was still open online. We figured we'd try out Ventano. This place EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS IN EVERY WAY. We sat at a booth and had a very nice view of the strip. The place was very simply and elegantly decorated with nice lighting (not too dark like most places). I didn't catch his name, but our server was efficient and friendly. And don't even get me started on the food. DELICIOUS. We shared a plate of muscles to start and a couple glasses of the house wine. I got the Lobster Ravioli, probably the best I've ever had and deceptively filling. My boyfriend got the Pennette Arrabiata and added sausage as recommended by the waiter. We did end up adding some salt to his but the flavor of the dish just got better the more we ate. Over all really good portion sizes. Filled us up but left us with a little room for some ice cream at the end. The check ended up being about $100 for everything, which was a steal considering the overall quality of our experience. We will absolutely be back!

jqEh8FswuAMTJy0dYvLy4Q.text: Where's the flavor? Lovely setting, large portions, very good service, but the food was bland and lacked the usual seasonings you expect.  We ordered the shrimp scampi, chicken spidieni, and eggplant parmasean.  The shrimp were large, but the dish lacked the usual garlic and wine flavors that make the dish.  Same lack of seasoning with the other dishes ordered.  We may try again and try some other dishes that people have reviewed and recomended, but last night the flavors we love in the dishes we ordered were just not there.

R5usoGfwpc8iKQGLDqwNHw.text: Live here in Henderson for 18yrs, have driven by the place countless times and this is the first time I've been here. Took family here for my wife's birthday, I'm so mad at myself not coming here before . Service...awesome, polite and courteous, attentive staff. Wife couldn't decided what she wanted in pasta dishes, wanted a light sauce  not tomato base. Waiter listen and said I'll let the Chef create a dish for you. Let me tell you he didn't disappoint, she was very happy.  My and the kids dishes were excellent. Will be back again in a few days, will make up for lost time now coming here sooner!!

pAsrT_hW0OiDeBvD4oQGDA.text: This place was really good. The food was good. Service was on point. Restaurant was nice and relaxed. Went the day after Valentine's Day and it wasn't too busy. Our server was nice and attentive. The bread came in a brown paper bag, which was funny to me. We ordered the lobster ravioli, homemade lasagna, and a dozen oysters, which were all amazing. Finished off with the Tiramisu, which I wish I ordered 2. Lol! Will definitely be back!
