B_UNzqCkquuZ4KQqCV3XaQ.text: This restaurant is amazing! The chef Armand is incredible and our continued fabulous service with Carlos will keep bringing us back! The food is fresh and awesome! Love this place!!!!

DEKFDr3I2-JTZAZSxsJRNA.text: Love the shrimp on a stone! View is amazing and the service was amazing. I have sat in the restaurant as well as the bar and always very happy with the service and food! One of the best Italian places in Henderson!

I6O8qhkuiZY3iEtpTwzuLw.text: Went here for a friends reception .  The food ; Spagehtti with meatballs was so so , calamari appetizer was good . The food took a long time to be served,  and above all this place is so damn hot . I sweated thru my entire meal almost feeling like a sponge from being so soak . Not a great move by management in the middle of summer to turn down the temperature of the a.c... service was good but everything else mediocre .

yNMfAGoBlrWEF4Bp9xRSLA.text: We forget how yummy this restaurant is and always are happy when we return.  Beautiful view of the valley.

8xeocHgI6ydvmF7mxQgVkQ.text: This place is just amazing and what a gem, I wonder if the other diners even know that the owner was the Chef at the Old Palace Court at Caesars?  Back in the day when food was food and not some celebrity front. The Cioppino is to melt over!  The veal Saltimbocca  was mouth melting madness......old school classics done to perfection.  The Lobster Bisque was perfect!  We started with the Beef Carpaccio and Shrimp on a Stone.!!    I love this place.

14Ym1NSYPGeydllDh0tBgA.text: Great food, amazing service.  Recommend it.  We have been looking for a good neighborhood Italian restaurant in Henderson. I think we found it. So far pasta was cooked just right, sauce tasty, my wife's loved her risotto. She is the picky of of the two of us. Somewhat Italian food snub, really. She always talks about the food she had in Italy. Well she wants to come back and that is the only endorsement I care for.  Happy dinning.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Dining room had a nice view of the Strip.

En5l7xt5wa_J5xy0C8WeUw.text: We did not enjoy our meal at all. We were there to celebrate a graduation. It was very overpriced for the bland meals we received. The wait staff were ok. I would definitely recommend other restaurants over this one. It was very disappointing.

nxsJ5uP3L7YHMFrAZOjUMA.text: Bad. Our waiter ignored us the entire time. We had a reservation and still waited 40 minutes for a seat even though it was pretty slow in the restaurant. The hostess was no where to be found. One waiter waiting several tables, all more important than ours. He only talked to us at the end when he brought us the check. The bus boy took our order and refilled beverages. Just super rude and not a luxurious experience at a place which used to be my favorite restaurant for the ambiance. Being cheap and not staffing well enough lost the business a loyal customer.

p2DnAAR87yvc0ZczJDC-1Q.text: We have tried several Italian restaurants in Henderson and Las Vegas, and Ventano is clearly one of the best if not THE best. The atmosphere is cozy but spacious with an amazing view of the Strip. Service is impeccable every time. The food is always delicious, well presented, and delivered in a timely way. My favorite dish is the potato-wrapped salmon, which I always recommend to my guests, and they, too, flip over it -- perfectly cooked but still moist and flaky. Ventano also has special menus for holidays such as Thanksgiving and Christmas Day in addition to their regular fare. Go there and you can't go wrong!

fI4VKes4PppDGA07QIicEA.text: Ventanos is the best local Italian restaurant in Henderson. It has a family feel the people that work there care about your food and experience. Beautiful view of the strip. I am gluten allergic and they accommodate almost any dish for me. Try the shrimp ventanos but honestly everything is delicious.

5SB9Km8CgN2c4vOhw8_1dw.text: It's such a nice place! Delicious food! We don't drink so no alcohol. Dinner was great and only $50. Fabulous service and excellent food for a reasonable price!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

ilJi4trVlKmFvDMHXT4QPQ.text: Ventano's is absolutely one of our very places in Henderson. Just had a fabulous dinner on Christmas Eve with our favorite waiter, Carlos. The food is delicious every single time and you can't beat the ambience. As busy as it was last week, the hostesses were all smiles and greeting everyone as if they are regulars. We've been coming here for years and I've never been let down. It's always a great experience.   P.S. I had the eggplant rollatini that was absolutely amazing and the wine was perfectly paired.

-cYzkqNprBpJF44QiBAWbA.text: One of those restaurants that have been on my bookmarks for a long time, I was finally able to visit them for lunch this week. I made a reservation via OpenTable, but for a weekday morning, it proved unnecessary. My friend arrived first and the host stand was deserted until I arrived a couple minutes later. There seemed to have been no host as one of the servers simply told us to sit wherever we wanted.  We grabbed a table next to the window with a great view and fantastic light, but the table was dirty and it took some time before someone came by. The same server that greeted us finally brought some menus and cleaned our table before disappearing again. We waited again for settings and after we ordered appetizers, it was some time before we were able to order our entrees. This is essentially what happened for the rest of the meal (waiting for water refills, having to chase after a server to pay our bill, etc).  Their complimentary bread is warm breadsticks served in a bag; served with balsamic and olive oil. They're nice (especially fresh out of the oven as ours were), though not particularly special.  We started with a side of Meatballs ($6) and they are fantastic! Delicious and tender with a really good marinara. I would definitely go for the Meatball Hero.  I also ordered the Chopped Salad (Half; $8.50) with grilled zucchini, bell peppers, artichoke, eggplant, mushroom, salami, ham, mozzarella cheese, marinated tomato, balsamic vinaigrette. First, this was one of the worst chopped salads I've ever had. Second, I asked for the dressing on the side because I HATE drowning salads, but it arrived fully dressed. It was miserably wet and unappetizing. This was made even more apparent with the strange addition of bread (as if it were Panzanella), but the ingredient isn't listed on the menu and it was so, so SOGGY. Needless to say, I didn't finish the salad and I am very glad I opted for the half order (even though $8.50 is still too much for this sad execution).  The Linguine alla Vongole ($14) had Littleneck clams and I chose white sauce (I always do).  The clams were nice, though the pasta was overdone and the sauce was unexciting. Overall, it was just okay.  My friend ordered the Ventano Tortellini ($14): Cheese tortellini, chicken, mushroom, pink sauce; topped with cheese and oven-baked. This is where all the flavor is hiding! The tortellini still had a decent bite and the sauce was delicious. The baked cheese wasn't overwhelming either, so it was a really pleasant dish. I really enjoyed this dish as leftovers, too.  Though I enjoyed the meatballs and Ventano Tortellini, it's very concerning that there was such a polarizing experience with another dish. Plus, the substandard service made us feel un-welcomed. My friend, not nearly as picky as myself, also felt that the meal was shrug-worthy.

9sDhngsg7kyDLwZIiGOHrQ.text: Great Italian food. The chef is very friendly.

HdAtnWFJk9zNuMXFLzIX5g.text: My boyfriend and I went out to this restaurant Friday night for dinner and were disappointed.  The view is nice, but the decor inside the restaurant looks cheap and cheesy (presented as fancy and elegant).  We ordered the shrimp on a stone, calamari, carpaccio, rack of lamb, and creme brulee.  Shrimp on a stone-  The generous portion of shrimp was well seasoned, and I enjoyed the horseradish dipping sauce.  The presentation was gimmicky and the size of the shrimp leads me to think the shrimp are frozen and not fresh.  Nothing wrong with that except the appetizer is $12 and the restaurant puts on an air of fine dinning.  I would have preferred a smaller portion of large fresh shrimp with a unique element.  Like most of the other food we tried here, this was good but nothing special.  Calamari-  The calamari had a nice texture and was well cooked.  There were two dipping sauces, a homemade spicy marinara and a sweet sticky sauce (not sure what seasonings were in it).  The marinara was not spicy at all and its viscosity was way too thin for dipping.  The sweet sauce had a great consistency for dipping, but it was a little too sweet for my taste.  A thicker more seasoned marinara or a fun aioli would have been a better pairing.  Carpaccio-  I was skeptical ordering carpaccio here because I've had some amazing carpaccio in Las Vegas.  It's not fair of me to compare Ventano's carpaccio to, say, Carnevino's (which is amazing).  However, I love savoring good raw beef and it is always difficult to pass up carpaccio and steak tartar on a menu.  Unfortunately, I could not enjoy the subtleties in the meat and toppings because they overpowered it with mustard (not mustard oil like menu states).  The ratio of mustard and capers (and I like capers on carpaccio) to meat was off.  Rack of lamb-  We ordered the lamb rare, but it came out medium-rare to medium.  It had a nice lamb flavor, but the balsamic sauce poured over it was not the best complement to the lamb. It was served with an assortment of vegetables: miniature squashes, carrots, onioins, celery, and roasted garlic.  I love squash, and the whole miniature green and yellow squash were a nice surprise.  The celery was a bit out of place, and some of the garlic cloves were under roasted and too firm.  However, the garlic cloves that were roasted to sweet perfection complimented the sauce very well.  Again, the dish was okay but nothing special, and definitely not reflective of its $26.50 price tag.  Creme brulee-  The custard had a wonderful flavor and consistency.  They used real vanilla bean and it made a world of a difference.  It was a good temperature, and the custard just melted in your mouth.  My only complaints here are trivial and often done by even the best restaurants.  The crust on top was a little thin and the strawberry pieces on top were not ripe.  It is extremely difficult to get ripe berries especially in the middle of the desert.  If they put the berries on the custard before sprinkling the sugar and torching it, that would help give the berries more character.  All in all, I would not suggest this restaurant.  There are better restaurants in Las Vegas with the same pricing scale.  If you are looking for good fine dinning in Henderson, I'd suggest Todd's Unique Dinning.  Otherwise, the valley is full of great restaurants more worth your time and money.

RO8Njnq157V6Xr0ucVCXtQ.text: Went there after my brothers graduation last night. Our family loves this spot and we were so excited to go back. Here is what we ordered:  1. Costelette di mialae- honey balsamic ribs served with perfectly seasoned roasted potatoes. lol everyone who ordered this dish thought it tasted and smelled a lot like pork adobo. They used similar ingredients like vinegar, bay leaves, peppercorns, honey. 4 out of the 8 people who went got this dish and the ribs were falling off the bone amazing! 2. Linguine alla vongole- My mom got it with shrimp (6 huge pieces) and I got it with clams, both with a white wine sauce. The dish was good, but out of all the pasta dishes, we feel like they went a little skimpy on the pasta... $18.50 and they gave us literally 4 spoonfuls of pasta.... pasta costs $.50, we wanted to tell the waiter but we were all too hungry to send it back. 3. Ventano Tortellini- My brother ordered this dish and it was another success! Went it got to the table, the cheese & sauce was nice and bubbling because it was cooked in a ceramic pot. Tortellini was perfect 'al dente'. YUM 4. Ventano Chicken Spedini- Came with linguine pasta, the chicken was so tender! 5. Calimari- not greasy, crispy, and the marinara sauce it came with was so fresh.   Overall, everyone left with a satisfied belly. Our family and friends love coming here because the view is just amazing, staff is friendly, and the food is authentic!

4SU3MS3Bv0ueZw1_yWmwwQ.text: OK so my wife and I decided to try this place after reading yelp reviews. We pull up to an olive garden clone looking building on the out side. We decided to continue walking  in also very olive garden'esk .. Lol  We where escorted to a table the service started out well, then we ordered our food and as the out side looks .. it was bland and the noodles where under cooked.. mushroom caps very bland.. chiefs special as not very special to say the least.. We both feel it was an over priced and had no pop... The only thing I could say positive about this place is it has an amazing view of the city.. also bar staff was unsatisfactory also.. I decided to stop by the bar to play machine.. I ask the bar tender to break a hundred dollar bill so I could play he said no problem walked to the end of the bar and proceed to take other customers drink orders.. I waited and waited then he comes back with my change and never asked me if I wanted a drink.. Do your self a favor and pass on this spot..

Lv9eia3yFLytFPAo0WI2tA.text: The food is very good here.  Sometimes a bit packed but service overall is good.  A little on pricy side for a neighborhood place.  I always order the ribeye with peppercorn sauce.  It's to die for!  Actually I call ahead and if it's not on the menu or they can't make it, we don't go.  The only con of what I've had is surprisingly their Alfredo is VERY, VERY bland.  But everything else is full flavored and delicious.  Go figure.

utvCqzfdx4RVk7SEn6hRQQ.text: The design is nice, the view is great, the staff is fine. If you like traditional Italian food this place is going to disappoint you. Probably even traumatise.  I had spaghetti carbonara and that was the most upsetting experience. Past was way overcooked and was soaked in molten butter. Believe me I eat a lot of food with high fat content but this pasta with dripping fat was horrible. Please don't order it if you had a normal (not American-style) Italian food before.

fzOfEzkD2yM-nurcGcuFfg.text: Stopped in here a few nights ago simply driving down Horizon and had never known it was there. It was kinda late and my husband went in and asked if we still had time to get a hot meal and the hostess was very welcoming and told us no problem. We were seated right away and our server was just delightful. I really wasn't expecting much to tell the truth, but WOW. Being a transplanted New Yorker with some Italian roots I was very pleasantly surprised. This was some of the best food I have had in a very long time.The Calamari was so delicately breaded and tender, I had the Eggplant Parm and it was so cheesy and delicious, with wonderful layers of beautifully seasoned eggplant and my husband had the Linguine and white clam sauce that he said was succulent. I can't wait to go back and try EVERYTHING on the menu.

Wn9n0OnHuQZ9ACzmUl5K4g.text: My boyfriend and I ate here on New Year's Eve and it was great. The place was packed to the brim but we were seated promptly at our reservation time. We were greeted by our bus boy Aldo who was very polite and attentive. Our server Austin gave great service as well. We had the Antipasto which was absolutely amazing. Everything was so fresh and house made even down to the roasted peppers which clearly did not come out of a jar. I had the Eggplant Parmigiana and my boyfriend had the Bucatini. We both loved our entrees. We also shared the Bananas Foster Pecan Ice Cream Cake which was like heaven on a plate. I expected service to be delayed on such a busy night but our wine and food came out at just the right times. We didn't feel rushed and Austin made us feel as if we were his only table the whole time. Great dining experience. Too bad I couldn't stay awake past 10pm because it seemed like they had a fun New Year's Eve party planned for later that evening.

EUUdc-RkdeSu-_xTRWQc-A.text: One of my favorite restaurants...I love the interior, the view,  and the food is almost always great....if it isn't they will do whatever they have to, to make it right for you. Oscar is the best server there and it's not inexpensive but worth it to savor shrimp on a hot stone, deep fried scungilli, and their desserts are to die for...

iLTvvWuq0KkX8c9BtmkWMg.text: I found this place on yelp and I'm glad I did or I never would of tried it because of where it's at. I'm only 5 minutes away but almost never go down the street it's on.   First off whom ever does the marketing for this place is smarter then 95% of the business owners out there that don't understand giving coupons on yelp is a cash cow it terms of ROI. You knocked off 20% of my meal for being on yelp and you got a great review and a customer you would of never had.  About the food. It was great. The bread sticks were fresh and hot. The tomato soup was rich and out of this world. Great with the bread sticks. My whole meal was great. I'll be back.

UjkV9u6TGg0J8VmkBvfJiA.text: I took my girlfriend here on our first date and I don't think I could have made a better choice. The interior was softly lit and the music was pleasant. The walls and decorations had a beautiful rustic feel...a perfect romantic atmosphere for any couple. The staff was exquisitely polite. The bread was fantastic and seemed pretty authentic to me. We had a Zinfandel to complement the food and they were generous with the serving size. My girlfriend had the lasagna and I went with a steak. It was one of the best seasoned steaks I've ever had... and it came with seasoned juicy shrimp and this buttery delicious bread that was quite rich. That's not to mention our fabulous view of the strip as the sun was setting. It wasn't exactly cheap but that sort of quality never is. We will definitely be back here.

iq1cxs-tRC_mCJA5EeFvmA.text: I wasn't expecting much when we pulled up to the Olive Garden-esque building, but we were hungry.  The interior of the restaurant was huge, with a wall full of windows facing the strip in the distance.  The view was nice and the place had a relaxing vibe to it.  My friends and I are, sadly, pretty jaded city folks, so they made fun of me for at least 30 minutes for bringing them to this place.  Especially when they drop bread off in a sack at your table.  Thankfully, Ventano has a pretty good wine list, the server knew what he was talking about, and the food looked fantastic, all for a reasonable price.  Ha ha ha, I laugh at them!  I enjoyed a couple of glasses of server recommended zinfandel and he was right, it was tasty.  My friend ordered the caprese salad.  It was huge so a few of us snuck a bite.  So delicious.  But the highlight of the evening was the Rigatoni Portofino.  OMG, so good!  It's been a few weeks since I had it and my mouth is still watering at the thought of it.  The pink sauce was surprisingly light and flavorful.  I was just wishing I had a fridge and microwave to take it home to!  Ventano is definitely a family friendly place, but the food is amazing and well worth the trip.

h11l1NcpmYVb959JA2DkgA.text: The best thing about this place is the view. I came here as I had purchased the Groupon. The food was OK. I found it to be pricey. Shrimp on a stone is good as well as the bread.  The service was very friendly, slow but friendly ! To keep this short I wouldn;t come back unless I had a coupon .

HPTSuDpfE81HxfJgsATI8Q.text: I don't know where to start. Let's say I'm their new #1 fan. My husband used the new OpenTable Yelp function to reserve our Valentine's Day dinner here. He requested a view and by golly we got it. Seated outside (under a ton of wonderful heat lamps) it was very cozy and a view of the entire strip. Quiet, as Frand Sinatra played in the background, we sipped Pellegrino and I had the Special, Filet Mignon with Lobster Claw meat, mashed potatoes and green beans. BEST STEAK ...(((omg)))...WOW! It was like cutting butter, tasted amazing, my husband was eyeing my food all night, but he enjoyed his chicken piccata anyways. Service was very friendly and offered to take our picture as well. Great food, prices, atmosphere. I can't wait to come back soon. (Hint, Hint Alton T.!!!)

nrM75gufo5adI9VsCTynUA.text: (at 7pm) I called to get directions &  then make a reservation @ 730.  I was told that no rez was necessary.  I could tell when we arrived that it would be crowded since the parking lot was completely full.  Luckily, a car started to back out...but when we got in to Ventano's, we were told it would be 30 min or more before we could be seated.  I told the hostesses that I attempted to make a rez but they just shrugged.  Since I had to get my friend to the airport in an hr & 1/2,  I only had 2 choices.  I had the foresight to peek around the corner into the bar area & saw there were ok looking tables there as well as a regular bar.   We sat there.  Our food was fine, we had Veal Piccata & Veal Saltimbocca.   However, I was upset when we left our stuff at/on the table, went outside quickly to look at the view & my leftover was thrown in the garbage.  No apology or anything to save the day.

XBL_GlUpLosB_mjK0x-7aQ.text: it is a good one and the view of outside dinning is awesome. the waiting time is a little bit long, so I suggest to make an appointment in advance.

LzmbiICZyx05_EGBUNADzw.text: Went here for lunch with my husband and was nice being able to pick any seat in the restaurant since it wasn't so packed. We sat by the window and enjoyed a view of the strip... I can only imagine how pretty it is at night with everything lit up. The service was good and the food was delicious. We're planning on going back here sometimes to enjoy a dinner with a view, so i'll update my review once that happens but for now, i'll say that its a great place for a date! :)

iFCUt2UN6ahceE6Fn-pbJw.text: Ventano's was a wonderful place to have dinner in Las Vegas. The restaurant was quite pleasant and the views went on forever. We got there before sunset and were able to watch the sun settle over the mountains and the lights of Las Vegas light up the horizon.  The food was quite tasty and the wine list extensive.  If you want to escape the gaming and noise in Las Vegas. Take the short drive to Henderson to dine at Ventano's. Or if you have been out at Hoover Dam, just stop off on your way back. It is just off the highway.

oDLjOYg8bQDfKzl5IZcJ0g.text: Beautiful views and friendly service. The food was nice and pasta dishes can be ordered as half portions, which is good. The Bread in a bag is not unusual, I have seen it before, and it is not intended to be cute.It is just a different way of serving it .  All round ,a nice meal in a very busy restaurant.

MKKm8j3WaiGkY7B1hbZDEg.text: The service, along with the food, has been very inconsistent.  We have been to this restaurant a few times, and will most likely return, but our visits are never without issues.  Either with the food or with the service, they seem to take turns.  Had to send duck back to the kitchen 3 times once due to improper cooking.  My suggestion, don't order the duck : ).  However, given its convenient location (for us) and for the most part, satisfactory food, we will return.  A+ for the shrimp on a stone!

2Q3HJXlQxIL4C6x5EoIQbQ.text: Sorry to say I brought my elderly parents for dinner last night and I most certainly will never recommend or come back. There were 3 tables with customers, 8 servers 3 front door young girls. We had trouble getting in because my parents are wheelchair bound and I could not get them in because the front doors are big heavy. Finely the girl held the doors for us. We ordered soup and they were cold and not good. We ordered appetizers and when they came they left the used soup bowls on the table that we pushed aside. I had to ask them to remove them so we could have room for the appetizers. I never had silverware or a napkin, I had to get some from the table next to me. We had clams and they gave us a bowl to throw away the shells. it was full and they took it away and never brought another one so we had to put the shells on the table. Ending the night we never could find anyone to give us the bill because everyone was huddled around the young girls. Finely one of the guys with a white shirt on must of seen us waiting and he told the server we were ready for our check. Well 8 minutes later we received it. Now how to get out? No one around the doors to help us out. I had to ask a customer coming in to hold the door then finely the huddle broke and the young girl held the door. If the food was good maybe I could overlook some of these issues but all the way around this restaurant was not a good experience. Too bad it is close to where I live.

k335zGh-frNwLlstD02E1Q.text: Exceptional service the second time around!! My husband and I had a great (second) 11th anniversary dinner thanks to the owner, manager, and staff. Arnauld (owner) and Michael (manager) personally greeted us and made sure we had a wonderful experience. Thank you again! We will be back with our son soon!!

cg2C7XMhBbvXy5p7gfUF9w.text: Absolutely wonderful. We went there as a large party for our company's Christmas party and the staff and food was wonderful. We may have caused a lot of noise during our white elephant gift exchange though, ha! Regardless, staff was super friendly. All the way from bread, shrimp appetizer, chicken alfredo, and variety of desserts, it was awesome. Great spot to grab some nice Italian food.

RF-yk0Fu1UGQsWnqpGpOHA.text: Outstanding food and amazing bartenders. Some of the best views in town. Definitely recommend.

XPL2Ku8pIywFpNwNMbtmDQ.text: Love the food and the waiter, Carlos - best service in town!!  But the three young ladies who were hosting the front door were a little to snippy for me!  We had a 6 pm reservation for 8 people and were never seated until 6:30 with no apologies, except they had our reservation on line but never put it in their books - really?  Then how did I get an email from Ventanos confirming my reservation!  I think they need to be retrained in customer service!  But other than these young girls - the place is awesome!!!

nTMMfjA-WwfvJdAFimDIlg.text: Dined here on Valentines Day. View was fantastic. The veal Scallopini and veal Parmesan was really good. Our servers Austin and Aldo were the best, couldn't have done better . The stuffed mushroom app was dry and needed some type of citrus. All and all a great meal and service.

v67nXiLYNXHh_Iwwve6-Qw.text: I LOVE this spot.  I can't even begin to guess how many times I've visited, but I'll just leave it at a LOT.  Everything I've ever tried is like Tony the Tiger says, GRRRRR-eat!  My personal fav, which is not on the menu is the seafood pizza.  A friend tipped me onto this little heavenly secret and I've gotta tell ya, it's more addictive than crack.  I normally start the night with the Shrimp on the Stone, which is accompanied by a honey mustard dipping sauce to top off the sizzly shrimp goodness.  My partner in crime goes absolutely bananas for their Chicken Saltimbocca, which is cooked with sage and topped with prosciutto in a white wine sauce.  I'm also a sucker for Cioppino, which they don't disappoint.    I like to sit at the bar and play video poker while I dine because they have the very best bartenders who take outstanding care of me.  Rich & Patty - go find them and tell them that Stephanie sent you!  I always have such a blast on every visit, which turns into hours of fun.    If the weather is nice, they have a lovely patio with a gorgeous view of the strip.  I love bringing out of town guest here to dine on the patio.  Located in Henderson, it's truly an off the beaten path gem that tourists are unlikely to stumble upon.  Everyone I've ever brought here has fallen in love.  They often host special wine pairing dinners.  Events include 5 delicious courses, each paired with their own wines.  The pours are very generous.  These events turn into a big party where my friends and I often make new friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Sizzling Shrimp on the Stone app - so yummy!

xE5Sh4-dMlCkHtWa-ugEjg.text: This place never disappoints!  Every time I come here I try something different and I've never been let down. I absolutely love their breadsticks and their wine menu is fantastic, not to mention the beautiful view. I will always be a customer here!

58Zjw-LcorrpVsqWi7jxIQ.text: Service is GREAT. Food is awesome and presented beautifully, although there are a few things I've gotten that have been disappointing. Stick to the basic pasta dishes and you will be happy. Another great thing is that they will mix up a sauce to your liking or even do half and half. Really willing to go the extra mile to make you happy. A few things that keep it from being 5 star: a little pricey for what you get. If the entrees were $2 cheaper, it'd be about right. And  no tablecloths! For the price you'd expect that. It has a nice view though, and there is an outside area that is nice if you can get a spot out there.

ZkwzzND_v6d5wbyjuhsl9w.text: I was torn about trying this neighborhood location. It is a beautiful place tucked behind a gas station, even with that detractor, the place offered a beautiful view of Las Vegas. My perusal of the menu looked tempting but the prices seem a bit on the high side for pasta dishes. Even the side dishes seemed hi with the lower priced items starting at $6.50.  I settled on a pasta dish with a marinara with no meat or vegetables for $19+. The bread was like fat breadsticks and a bit tuff. The oil was severed with balsamic and no herbs. Bland.... Glad I didn't bring company and checked it out on my own.  It wasn't BAD but also wasn't worth the price.

NBrLQK-tzRqU86wT5-VmhA.text: I have had holiday parties here before and the food was amazing. Today I went for lunch with my family and it was horrible. We waited a long time to be given water it looked like there was no one in the kitchen cooking and it was obvious in the quality of our food. I ordered a margarita pizza which came out cold and soggy. The sauce tasted like stewed tomatoes and there was a slice of cold tomato on my pizza. My daughter ordered a cheese pizza same problem my husband ordered the shrimp Diablo it was bland and the sauce was a weird consistency and lacking flavor. The bread sticks tasted like they were the frozen kind and heated up. I was thoroughly disappointed. None of us finished our food not even half was eaten it was so bad. Save your money you get a lot better for the price of this place.

9kjBXA7T39wQ6kvbuBcdwQ.text: Four of us had dinner here after a conference. Beautiful view of downtown Las Vegas. We were also able to catch a beautiful sunset. Staff was very attentive. The food was very good. My husband had the lasagna and raved about it. I had linguine and clams in white sauce. Plenty of clams. It was very good but I have had better. I'm not complaining. Our friend had pasta with shrimp and scallops and they also said it was very good. We finished off with a cannoli which was delicious. Overall I would recommend and return. It definitely beats chain restaurants and is competes well with high priced alternatives.

dymoUR3S2_1y1uaZEGchAA.text: Food can be iffy some times.  I usually order piccatta, and the one and only time I had their veal, it was very tough.   Food is over priced, the atmosphere is the only thing going for this place.  Staff needs to be upgraded and trained all around. In personality, service, and knowledge.   Went to the bar and asked for a mojito. Bartender said she "couldn't" make it. When the manager (I believe his name is Mike or something... blonde.... light complexion.) came around and asked how we were doing, I had brought up the bartender not having the supplies to make drinks... Like a full bar should. He challenged me, by letting me know that they have fresh mint and it is capable.  Well, I got my 'mojito'.  Makes me wonder if the bartender was telling me she couldn't make it because of the mint.... or that she COULDN'T make it...... because...... gag.  Last June, I set up a birthday of about 16 for my husband's birthday. I made a reservation at least a week in advance. Waiter / busser would throw the bag of bread on the table, and then hide. They could barely be found. Had to beg for refills.  We have had one great waiter in the 3 years we have been eating there, and that is only because I took my pregnant self and spoke to the manager and complained hardcore. He told me to make a reservation with him, he comp'd our meal, and I'm sure that is why we were treated so nice.

BDnX7Ur0AYgxSTnaozGC8A.text: We ate here late at night not knowing what to expect.  My wife and I hadn't heard anything good or bad so we were reluctant to go especially so late at night. We were surprised  when we entered at how quant the place was. The staff was super nice and helpful.  The food was great even in the middle of the night. The price was a little higher then we expected but not much, not enough to stop us from coming back.  They also had a wide selection of wine and matching pastas! The lobster bisque was really good! We will come back.

R4LezzoHemJWhYTHOPTggg.text: We had dinner reservations, and showed up an hour early due to s schedule change, and they were able to accommodate us. We had two wait staff with excellent service. The bread they bring out is warm and delicious. We had an appetizer of shrimp on the rock, which was excellent with great flavor. I ate it alongside my grilled romaine salad, which was out of this world. I've never had grilled romaine before, but it was such a great flavor and the dressing was scrumptious. Highly recommend!!!!! Great dining experience, great view of the strip in the distance! Worth the drive to henderson!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled romaine salad
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp on the rock
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken spedeini

lEud1gRsRfDVGb0FQvCvDA.text: I'm giving it 4 for the food.  Would have been a 5 if common sense was a part of the experience.  I aside at 5pm on a tuesday. I asked to be seated by the window to relax and have a view.  I was one of 6 people in the restaurant.  In come a group of 4 and where do they seat them directly in the line of the setting sun, so instead of seating them at one 20 empty tables not in line with the setting sun, they are seated then the sun shade is dropped over the window by my table. So much for the relaxing view.  Lalo my server was spot on great kid.

J-PJ0eBylxaaJ4faOWecxA.text: HUGE Thanks and gratitude to Arnauld Briand and all the valued staff at Ventano Italian for making our wedding nothing short of amazing. Everything was perfect. Now our friends and family know why Ventano Italiano is our favorite restaurant for every occasion.  We had 80 guests and everyone of them was blown away by the food, view, staff service and decor. We could not have asked for anything more. It truly was the best day of our lives. Thank you.

l39sbXASSc4pX7lY6dKyGQ.text: Food is good.  Atmosphere and service are nice.  Love the outdoor patio, but haven't eaten out there yet.

N4MRghjwvlRzk-l-L7aLUQ.text: This is a cute little spot that is seemingly in the middle of nowhere in Henderson.  It sits up on a hill so you can see the entire Las Vegas Strip from the restaurant. There is a huge patio, which is where we sat and that was prime seating for the view.  .    I ordered a caesar salad, and the Ventano Tortellini.  They served bread sticks while we waited for our food.  We also ordered shrimp cocktail.  Everything was really good. I wouldn't say amazing or anything, but good.    I'd definitely go back because it's a cute spot with good food and an awesome view, and it's in my neighborhood.  If I had to judge it on food alone, I'd say I've had much better italian.

OAGLBnHPK9rUc1j_oZdUXA.text: This place is outstanding!  We have been ere three times.  Get the Shrimp on the stone.  As the meal goes on the shrimp at the bottom get crispy brown on the bottom, it's delicious in the sauce.   They give warm bread, and it is also delicious, crispy yet chewy on the inside with dipping oil!  More restaurants need to serve bread, it adds to the value of the meal!  The main dishes are very filling, I go with the veal.  It's always cooked perfect, they know Italian veal here.  Worth the money, great view, great staff!

V19uKIhQR7b8gBUivsLIEA.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant and has been for quite some time. Delicious food and typically very good service. However, I'm pretty sure the last time I went there I was rejected due to attire (jeans and sweater, same as my guest). We got a strange look when we walked in, asked how many people, and then (odd follow up question) if we had a reservation. I stated we did not, as I've never needed one dining at Ventanos. She said they were all booked up this night. It came as a surprise since no one seemed to be dining at the time, from what I could see. Also, if they had already been booked up I'd think the reservation question would have preceded the number of people in my party inquiry. So, we preceded to the bar and I mentioned to the bartender that the dining room was reportedly booked up for the evening. She looked perplexed and preceded to take a look at the dining room herself. She mentioned that was odd. Anyway, my guest and I went to spend our money at another fine dining establishment without an issue. Too bad, I really did enjoy this place.

GhW_xD9dOCufoPFajrr-vg.text: I ate at Ventano once before and it was pretty good, which is why I am giving 2 stars instead of 1. Last night my girlfriend and I ordered takeout and had a much different experience. I ordered the lobster ravioli and she had cheese tortellini - a total bill nearing $50. We were each unimpressed with both dishes. The portions were considerably smaller than when I had eaten at the restaurant - the food already looked like someone's leftovers! The pomodoro was watery and salty. Probably won't order from here again.

mbBpVsj6sFkuJiDxoBS0Cw.text: Starting with the positive: wonderful views of Las Vegas at night. My wife and I went on Yelp reviews, but were disappointed. As others have mentioned, the bread sticks are pitiful. How can you have an Italian restaurant with "bread-sticks" that are a joke? They are served in a greasy paper bag, are soft, salty, and everything good bread is not. Dip these pizza hut sticks in good olive oil? I think not. Entrees are quite overpriced, and do not even include a salad. The pasta was definitely overcooked, I would say redolent of steam table. The copper-bottomed pans up front  look great, but like much of Vegas, this place seems to be all show with little substance. I had the veal Marsala, it was good, if somewhat tough, but four people , one bottle of Coppola wine and $169? Not for me. I will add that the waiter (can I still say that ?) apparently felt that he was there to entertain us, rather than just fill the orders.

AhY7ll0DaKfczFqNam70LQ.text: It was good standard Italian - I was able to try the Calamari (Good), Grilled Lamb Chop (Great), Pasta Carbonara (Ok) and the Carmel Pecan Ice Cream Cake - Banana Foster (Good) - Again a solid place, just needed more Great menu items to be a 4 star.

Te5KwPoSFpOb6U6dPcAhAg.text: The food and the atmosphere were nice, but I thought the restaurant was a bit pricey.  There is an amazing view of the strip & it's a very cute, romantic date night type restaurant.

UHuu0DQMWVTbKZc0zJACgw.text: Always delicious!  My favorites are the shrimp on the stone, grilled hearts of romain salad and lasagna.  The lasagna to go is easily enough for two.

MwIO7UbK2PFvGydqJ3rcfA.text: Excellent food and service in a family friendly atmosphere. Would have given 4 stars however the "free family picture" was inconvenient and clear attempt to up-sale the table.

e-o85MI-XYxBxGJyPSx1tA.text: I love that the chef replied to my review and wasn't defensive. Class act! I seriously can't wait to go back and try everything on the menu. Is there a sampler platter? ;) Bumped up to 5 stars!

3QctR0xwgiCNsGsTpLeTyQ.text: The food and service were both amazing.  The view was fantastic and we left fat and happy!!

1WnA127kPoAarj72wfXc_g.text: I think I've been to Ventano's three times now.  Once a couple of years ago, once in November for lunch, and then again last week.  Each time I thought the food was good but the service was just mediocre.  This past time is the one I will focus on and base my review.  We arrived and the hostess was on the phone.  She continued to stay on the phone for about 4 minutes while we waited.  The she almost talked to us when the phone rang again and, she answered it.  Come on!  Finally, someone else seated us and we were greeted pretty quickly by the waiter.  I'm not going to go through every step of the mean but we had to ask for bread two or three times before they brought it.  They told us it was being made fresh and yet we saw bread going out to other tables.  Not very cool guys.  If I'm eating Italian, I want my bread!  If I'm eating Mexican, I want my chips!  Fast!  The food was good all around.  I had risotto, my wife had ravioli, my bro had pasta carbonara, and his fiance had a salad and the antipasto platter.  No complaints on the food, and when we finally got the bread, it was piping hot and delicious.  I just wish this place would get it together and have some consistent service.  We waited  for the waiter to pick up the check for 12 minutes.  I timed it because that's the kind of guy I am.

CCst98O3_PRbR7nAr7Wb0g.text: Sad mush for eggplant parm... thought that would be an Italian staple..also  marinara sauce is boring at best. left a bad taste in my mouth.

T9YSnPvuh_FfJLl_sRoYZQ.text: The food is delicious, a breathtaking view, make a reservation to sit outside and enjoy both. The service is a little hit or miss, but for the most part we always enjoy ourselves. The eggplant parm and the chicken parm are soo good. The Shrimp on the Stone is delicious and dessert is great if you have room :)

qdK1nxmaZIZKPeePw8cHfA.text: Always great food and beautiful views. We order to go sometimes and love that we have the option of great food without cooking. I definitely recommend this restaurant!

JQ05lly-ZDDMplMyA95GyQ.text: My boyfriend and I had a groupon for this restaurant. We wanted to try this place for a first time. When we got there, we were welcomed and seated in a booth (we had a view of Las Vegas, it's a plus). They put a brown bag  in the table and when I opened the bag, it was two pieces of bread. I tried it, it was warm and soft and then someone came to my table and brought some balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Bread + Balsamic vinegar and oil = delicious.      For appetizer, we order Calamari Fritti. It was good, it has a lot flavor but it was a little greasy. The calamari was crunchy and easy to eat. The serving for the calamari is pretty decent.   For our entree, I ordered Linguine alla Vongole (clams and linguine w/ your choice of red or white sauce) and my boyfriend ordered Lobster Ravioli. My linguine alla vongole was so good. It has a lot of flavor and there was a lot of clams in my dish. My boyfriend also like his food. I asked my bf if I could have a little taste of it. The lobster ravioli was good and it has a lot of flavor but I didn't really taste the lobster, I would rather stick with what I had ordered.     The server and the service at this place was excellent. I would come back again!

nNZH0R7Sx8SGazsK1Usc6w.text: We had a recent family gathering as a celebration of life for our grandparents and wanted Italian food in honor of our grandma.  From the first email and call to Michael I had no desire or need to check into any other places.  (Most of the family was from out of town so we did not have any local experience w/ventanos) Michael was responsive and provided our quote in less than a day and another one with adjustments just as quickly.   The day of pick- up the food was ready to go at the time promised and was delicious!!!! The meatballs were huge! The lasagna and a bruschetta style pasta were fabulous - I just wish I'd been there the next day for left-overs!  There was a lot of food and the price was so reasonable.  Thank you Michael for making this piece of our gatherings of easy!

9pVegKuguxDFa6cI9zfMTQ.text: Just had dinner at Ventano, and it was a great experience. We sat at a booth by the window (which is where most of them are) and had a great view of the skyline. The service was great and our server was very attentive, as well as the remaining staff. The food was delicious, and very reasonably priced. I had the steam clams, and chicken Marsala, which was very tasty! My wife had the fettuccine (spicy) which she found out was a bit more spicy then she wanted, but delicious as well! The thing that hooked us was the warm bread they serve when you sit down. We like to add some salt and pepper to our oil and vinegar to dip the bread in, and it met up to one of our favorite restaurants in California, Sisley. If anything, we'll be coming back just for that! We gave it a 4/5 only because a little live music(jazz, piano, etc etc) would have made it a better experience. Maybe we just came on a wrong night. We'll definitely be back.

-gASgqIdvy9h2GvCizy3bA.text: We eat out frequently since we have just moved to Las Vegas from San Diego.  We have always enjoyed neighborhood Italian restaurants and decided to try Ventano.    After we were seated, we were served a very nice bag of Italian bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.   Nice touch!    Our food order was taken quickly and we received our food within a reasonable amount of time.     The soup was a little bland and the Salad Caprise was a little warm.   My husband ordered the Spagetti Bolanase which was good.  We had to wait a very long time for the check and frequently requested the check be brought to our table.   20 minutes is really too long for a check to be presented after the meal, IMHO.  If you don't like tomatoes in your sauces, this is not the place for you!

AkLTi40PLhTlmWIiZpG3aw.text: I've passed by this place many times and finally I had a chance to try it out. It has nice views of the strip as it sits on a slight hill. I had the mushroom risotto, and it was delicious. It was rich but not overwhelmingly so. I also had the sauteed spinach, which maybe had a bit too much garlic, but it was fine since I like garlic. They were nice enough to sell half orders so I was able to get the pesto gnocchi, along with my risotto. I can never decide between the two. They were both good. All and all, I would go back and try some different things.

dBLRUbALzxJZ5Tdw66Kkyw.text: I was very happy with the meal I had on my first visit to Ventano, but the second time was even better. Chef Arnauld came to our table to ask how we enjoyed our meal, and it was a unanimous thumbs up. His take on classic Italian dishes is well thought out to make them extra special. The seafood is great, the staff is very professional and courteous, and this gem is in our home town!  Considering all factors involved, I think this is the best Italian restaurant in the Vegas Valley, and the great view is just icing in the cake. Bravo Chef and thank you!

tiHNFAFlJnXRt7rbU7tkZQ.text: Almost 5 stars! The service is amazing. Had adam for our waiter and he was beyond excellent. The shrimp scampi was very good. Lots of solid menu options. View from the patio of the city behind ya is very nice as well. Beers are a little pricey. Besides that a very good value

5GWxIv4HSwprvJdGRo4kmg.text: So I went here recently.. Its a very CASUAL restaurant.. people don't dress up here.. and its kinda family style. Nothing fancy or anything..  So..the host seems nice.. and the waiter we got was very attentive. He was a great waiter and made sure to always check on us.   So the bread that comes out to the table was fresh and hot! yum! the oil and vinegar they use was okay dipping but i prefer more of an oil and herb type sauce instead like other restaurants I've been to... or maybe even a soft butter would be nice.   I ordered a lobster bisque soup which was tasty and has lobster chunks in it.. i dipped the bread in it as well.. delishh! The plate I ordered was a pasta dish with a pink sauce but I asked them to add blackened shrimp to the dish... instead they turned the whole plate a spicy blacked dish! mehhh... not what I wanted but whatever.. could have been better if it was made the way I asked. Anyways there wasn't enough shrimp for the dish... maybe 5 shrimps?   So for the end of the meal I ordered a cappuccino ...very delicious! But the tiramisu was the WORST Ive ever had in my life! Lol.. Im a big tiramisu person and had many in my lifetime.. SKIP THE TIRAMISU in my opinion... not good! Even the presentation of the tiramisu was pitiful and messy. smh.   Overall I might give this place another try if I'm in the area... but nothing I will go out of my way to go to...

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. skip the tiramisu !! no bueno
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

cxgsTvYZU7k_PunTmjcIEw.text: Ambiance was amazing ! Such an romantic and pretty view of the valley & strip. My husband and I went Friday for dinner. We decided to sit on the patio as it was perfect weather. Our food was amazing. We stared off to a slow start we were seated and our server gave us water and forgot to come back for 10-15 minutes. Our buser helped up as I asked if we could please order our bottle of wine. He immediately helped and went and got  It to present to us. Didn't see our waiter much but the buser made it a pleasant experience. We will be back

1MHLhohvRHwoORVFLidatg.text: So I ordered the lasagna. It was my first time eating here and I figured lasagna was a good thing to order to help me ascertain if this was a tasty place to eat. Right away I tasted something...familiar. It wasn't bad, just a little salty and SO familiar. Finally as I was just finishing the last bite I recognized the taste of the sauce! Chef Boy R Dee beefaroni. That's not to say it was bad, I actually like beefaroni; I just don't like paying $21 for it

RMz743SrsEBqmWGOI9u5rA.text: I came here with high hopes, after seeing the 4 stars and other compliments. First off I will say the staff is friendly. The server I had was not trained properly and I did not feel like I was served or had the attentive service you should receive when spending $150 on a bill at a restaurant. The food was very mediocre, and some of it tasted like old leftover and not fresh. I am very disappointed and I won't be back. I feel like I totally wasted my money and could have had a better meal elsewhere and had much better service and better food for a 1/3 of what I paid here. Not worth it at all. I would not even come back for free.

hgw-wBB04ncQekfY3kicOg.text: My cousins and I was on vacation in Las Vegas and the bartender at our hotel told us that we had to go to Ventano Italian Grill and Seafood. Let me say that we were all really glad that we chose to listen!! The food was amazing but what made this the best restaurant was the servers Sergio and Adam!! We didn't know what to get because everything looks so good, they took the time and explained to us everything on the menu and gave us great suggestions. Great job guys and keep up the great work!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Lamb Chops on the Stone *
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp Ventano
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. So aghetti Alla Carbonara with blackened chicken!

z3njPkhk5AyrLC8HG4VAEQ.text: I didn't want to give a one-star but after looking back at just my dinner last night it's warranted.  We were invited to dinner with a friend who just loves the place so although our past experience was less than stellar I came with an open mind.  I ordered salmon with mixed veggies as I'm avoiding carbs.  Before I even tasted the food the only veggie was zucchini.   So I sent it back as even when I ordered I was told that instead of just zucchini mixed vegetables was an "option."  After the plate was returned there were 2 small pieces of broccoli added to the zucchini.  Not exactly accommodating.  However, it got much worse.  I took one bite of my salmon and it was so dry that it was hard to swallow.  I finally poured a bit of olive oil on it just to get it down.  Since we were invited to a birthday dinner by our friend I did not send it back.  The birthday cake was brought out and we were very clear that only 5 out of 6 of us wanted a slice.  (I'm on a diet, remember).  So following instructions, they brought out 4 slices and the rest of the cake in a box.  After I mentioned they were were one slice short the waiter went back into the kitchen - without the cake!  After several minutes I just grabbed a plate from an empty table and the problem was solved.  Again, minutes later the manager came over but it was too late.  Terrible communication and followup.  First, my dry overcooked salmon came withe mixed veggies that the manager suggested.  Then they waited forever to even come back to cut another slice of cake.  On the way out I did tell the manager and hope he took the salmon off my friend's bill but I have no way to know.  We won't accept any other invitations to eat at this place.  How they have so many people giving high markets who apparently don't have any taste for quality is beyond me.

HL2xDQt5QqXAwKZ3p4h8Bw.text: Terribly slow service. And I mean TERRIBLE. The tip I left hopefully went to the kitchen because the wait staff sucked soooo hard.   The food was mediocre at best. There are better, closer, more value-for-your-money restaurants in the area. Do yourself a favor and patronize those places.

b20UV28zGf2nyo7WlVMgMw.text: Ventano's one of my semi-regular haunts in Henderson for great Italian. However, I will not be doing a regular review! This review is special -- yesterday my family and I had made reservations to bring a large group if our family and friends, 15 people total, to celebrate my recent graduation from UNLV. So my review will focus specifically on the service and the menu we had for that occasion!  As my mother was setting up the decorations, we all went over early to set up everything for the event, well before our guests started to arrive. Michael, the manager, was extremely attentive and helpful, getting our drinks and helping make sure we were comfortable and ready for the big event.  During the entire event, the regular diners here would come streaming in until the restaurant was busy, and even then we still had spectacular service. Truly wonderful!  Anyway, on to the food -- we had something of a prix fixe menu for the occasion, starting with bruschetta, calamari and their famous shrimp on the stone, along with plenty of their breadsticks. Everyone ate to their satisfaction, and it was all so good -- the shrimp and calamari both got rave reviews in particular! The Caesar and classic salads that we had for everyone also went down treats, as well.  For the main courses, we had five choices -- spaghetti with meatballs, chicken fettuccine Alfredo, fettuccine con funghi, linguine alla vongole, and chicken parmigiana. Of the choices, I discovered that the fettuccine con funghi was the most popular, with over half of our table ordering it and some of the guests taking the leftovers home for later! This isn't to say that all of the pasta wasn't good -- I saw clean plates for some of our guests -- but the fettucini con funghi was the most popular by far.  For our dessert, Michael recommended that we get a dessert buffet setup where we had a little bit of everything come out -- tiramisu, cheesecake, spumoni, zeppoli, and chocolate cake -- and OMIGOD, was it the best decision we made. Everyone was applauding and cheering at the dessert -- we had three total trays of dessert come out -- and one of my guests perfectly described us all as having larger eyes than stomachs! Even though we were all full or almost full at that point, we all ate to our satisfaction. Needless to say, we were all stuffed and very happy with the service, the meal, everything!  There's a good reason why Ventano is such a mainstay here in Henderson since its establishment in 2003: solid food, a great atmosphere, and great service make it impossible for people to stay away for long! Throughout our meal, we were attended to often and we had such a great and relaxing time wining and dining with friends. Whether you want to dine by yourself or with a few or a lot of guests, Ventano is the place to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Parmigiana. Also a hit with some of our guests.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The dessert buffet tray, oh my goodness. 5/5, we tore through these things so quickly...
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. This was a hit with some of our guests.

xuI8TJ7cA2eaYHLYcP-4UA.text: Omg!!!!! That's all I can say. I'm new to Green Valley. I came from LA where food is spectacular. This restaurant surpassed my expectations and experience. Highly recommended. The view of the strip at night is gorgeous. Definitely a date night ladies if you're planning a date.

TPqn_4mRNHuZpOU6u-hfyA.text: We love this place!!!  The view is breathtaking; the ambiance is cozy, and the food is tender, delicious, and cooked to perfection, but the cherry on top is having Carlos as your server. We always request his section because he goes so far above and beyond normal expectations to take care of our table. I have never had a more responsive and caring server. Eating at Ventano's at sunset with Carlos as your server is the recipe for a perfect evening!!

NimsVvysuNK_VWKXm3UK6g.text: I don't normally leave comments but can we talk about the warm spinach bacon salad?! Why is nobody reporting on this? The people need to know!! I don't know what they put in that exactly but it is a  mind blowing experience.  Also can I just give a solid shout out to the staff I'm not sure what my waiters name was or his sidekick but they did amazing. They made sure we were all set drinks bam no dry mouth for you.. not thirsty today... want bread? bam here you go with the oil and balsamic on stand by...food ready pow Parmesan cheese on deck grated fo you fresh by the cheese wizard... then the man himself chef who comes around and make sure your all good showing face to his people.  Man this spot. If you like Italian food and great customer service hit this place up.

iVbxzDDk5qCEJNDqw98C_Q.text: I love Italian food and so far this is the best Italian restaurant I've been. I accidentally  found out about this place when I was driving around Henderson. I ordered their Calamari and it's the best Calamari ever! I really love the sauce it came with it. The fettuccine alfredo with shrimp is outstanding! I'm not a pizza person but when I tasted their pizza I had three slices!

mKg83b2EEREkS9zuVzzslg.text: Well dinner last night was extremely disappointing.  The primary word I would use is BLAND.  It was not different than my middle schooler could cook for us at home but at an average of $25 per entree.  I say this with sadness because as a local we used to love this restaurant.  Calamari for appetizer.  No seasoning.  We salted it and then dipped it into the marinara sauce that tasted like it was out of a grocery store.  The 5 of us finished less than half of this appetizer.  Bread.  Boring.  Ventano bread used to be amazing!!  No longer.  It's OK but nothing special. Again, we left more than half and with high schoolers/middle schoolers who love bread... that's saying something.   Chicken Spedidini.  This used to be the dish that I craved from Ventano!!!  The reason I always wanted to come back.  These were over-cooked chicken blocks.  I ate about 3 bites and no one at the table wanted the rest.  We ordered 4 other pasta and veal dishes and all were.. meh.  Not bad, but nobody cleaned their plate.  I will say that portion sizes are huge so that may be attractive for some patrons??    Overall, it was probably the most boring dinner I have had in years.  Service was good but without good food what is the point??

SIk2k386KUz_hLSYoSj2qQ.text: Very nice view. very good food. Huge selection of wine. good cocktails. and they are open late ! and it's in henderson! 5min from our house  it's a good group dining place. family gathering, birthdays, business dinners.

gD3FNCFnuilV3T2-wca8oA.text: I really wanted to like this place with all the reviews and rewards it's received but it fell very short of all the claims.  We went there on a Wednesday afternoon around 430 in the afternoon. There was only one table when we got there. The server who seemed to be the only one on duty greeted us and told us to take a chair anywhere. He presented us with menus and went and spoke with the other table for about 10 minutes before coming back and taking our drink order.  Another 10 minutes went by before we got our drinks and we were missing half for drinks to begin with. We only got glasses of water and not the ice tea that we asked for. Literally 25 minutes went by after we have placed our order before we got some breadsticks in a paper bag. We went with the recommendations and had a small half house salad, the beef carpaccio, the chicken marsala and the manicotti.  We were there for total of 35 minutes before any of our appetizers came out. The beef carpaccio I gave a 5/5. The aioli that comes on it, a mustard blend, and the fresh arugula with some shaved Parmesan was absolutely delicious. The salad wasn't all that impressive. Some mixed greens with some tomatoes and a vinaigrette. 3/5.  The restaurant started to become full around 445, 5 o'clock. Within about 20 minutes they had seven table sat. Only one server and two bussers for the entire restaurant. Between five and 530 we only saw our waiter one time. We finally got our main course almost an hour after being there. Mind you for about half an hour we were the only table in there.  Let's start with the chicken marsala. Horrible. Noodles were beyond under cooked. Secondly the chicken was very inconsistent. Some parts were rubbery and chewy and some pieces were overcooked and tough. We counted four pieces of mushroom total in the marsala sauce. This was horrible and we didn't touch it. We gave this a 1/5. The pastor noticed we didn't like it and asked if we would like anything else and we politely declined. We were fine paying for the entree but he told us he would take it off.  The manicotti was a 3/5. Nothing special. Bland red sauce with shells stuffed with a standard ricotta cheese blend. And honestly tasted like they had prepped it earlier on in the week and just kept frozen. Nothing special at all. Good portion size though, as it came with four pieces.  The poor server was definitely overrun with as many tables as he had. Overall service was lacking, food was mediocre at best and we probably won't be going back.

3JRxHopJF5OS5wvSUtYoQw.text: Place is great, food was well prepared, the view is indeed nice. The restaurant is rather huge and there are many tables. By the time we were done with our early dinner it had gotten crowded but to my surprise it remained relatively low on noise. I had the pasta with shrimp and indeed it was prepared to perfection. The lobster bisque was amazing. It was served in a bread bowl. I recommend they serve that bread instead of the one they toss in a paper bag as a starter. Kids' pizza and pasta was superb as well. I wish our server had mentioned that they have specials. Omitting this important part of a dining experience was not pleasant and I will make sure to be on the lookout next time around.

YZJyW_8INs0wR6dpPqmKeA.text: My friends and I had dinner on a Friday evening.   Based on other reviews I had high expectations.   On the positive side: - Fresh warm bread - Friendly service - View of Vegas  On the negative side: - Water glasses frequently left empty for extended periods - Slow service even though the restaurant was not full - Caprese - tomatoes lacked flavor and serving included a tomato 'end' slice    - White sauce - thick and excessive  - Eggplant Parmigiana - bland and no texture    We were all disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggplant

Q4Omzh59KpzJ1LgIBVbJIw.text: What a beautiful restaurant. Visited for dinner with the bf and wow this place is so nice when you walk in. They were kind enough to seat us right in front of the huge window with a perfect view of the strip. I felt so bad we came in 30 mins before the dining room closed, the hours were off on Yelp. We offered to come back again another night and they absolutely insisted we stay.    We ordered a glass of sauv and Jameson both perfect. For food I ordered the mussels in a tomato basil sauce and the bf ordered the shrimp scallop linguini in a pink sauce. He switched the pasta out for angel hair. He fell absolutely in love with that dish, I admit it was pretty spectacular. I love mussels but the mussels here could use a little more flavor, maybe garlic. But best believe I ate it all lol. We will definitely be returning.

i9_b-fQBDd-h6CrODTqrtA.text: I had dinner and drinks there last Saturday night for the first time and really enjoyed it. I sat in the bar (at the bar) to play video poker and enjoy a martini as I was by myself. The bartender and fellow patrons couldn't have been any nicer! They made me feel very welcome and comfortable to be there. One of the other diners at the bar likened it to the Cheers bar. I can completely agree with that as they all seem to know each other and enjoyed spending time together. It's always a good sign when the same people keep coming back to the same place! Something must be right!  I kept seeing and smelling appetizing dishes all around me. Even though I didn't intend to necessarily eat there, I couldn't resist.   I started with a half dozen oysters on the half shell. So good!  Very fresh and chilled just the way I like them. They were served with cocktail sauce and horseradish and they were both good.   Next I had the appetizer portion of the meatballs. Outstanding!  Loved the sauce they were in and they were accompanied by some warm bread served in a paper bag. Delicious!  I look forward to my next visit in the very near future. Thanks Archie and Richard!

2lThBlAbOjSzUP0cVZKoUQ.text: Well I called in after seeing shrimp scampi listed as $15 dollars on here. When I arrive I find out it's actually 25 and that the $15 is the lunch menu. Lame. So I pay and when I get home I open it up and we'll the picture speaks volumes.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

s2ulhxYi561hCe9FImbqIg.text: View of Las Vegas is great.  The place is nice.  Lobster chunks in Lobster Bisque were cold in the middle. Otherwise, the Bisque was mediocre. Spaghetti Alla Carbonara is good.  Spaghetti Alla Puttanesca is not great.  Service is slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Spaghetti Puttanesca is much more boring than the puttanesca I&#39;m used to.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Spaghetti Carbonara is very good.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Bread sticks came in a little brown bag. (Tasted good though.) But every other table has a nice bread basket.

jfW8kI-2SjraDfSXh497mA.text: Lasagna is homemade & out of this world. Rigatoni Portifino & prosciutto chicken also amazing. These 3 entrees were so delicious not sure if I would try different entrees. Will defianately be back.

HAv9lbTmhocW5qIHFxRX9g.text: I went here late night last week. I sat at the bar. The bartender Matt helped me out. He made some really good wine and food suggestions. And provided really good service which is rare to find these days.  And if the good food and service  wasnt enough. I ended up making some money on the machines. I Will be back for sure. Hard to find places with service and quality like this anymore. Thanks Matt keep it up.

HIrRZhuPuTiDu7abJdwdmw.text: Excellent as always. Great food great service. Clam chowder is fantastic, pasta cooked to perfection.

aONxVdfSBeH_ySNtggBO6w.text: My experience with Ventano's started the day before when I called to make a reservation.  A male by the name of Adam answered the phone and took my reservation.  He was very polite and helpful.  I explained it was my wife and I's anniversary and I heard they had an amazing view.  He promised the view and took down it was our anniversary.    I must say Ventano's is a different venue than I was used to.  It is a large stand-alone restaurant with a separate bar, situated by itself with an incredible view of the Las Vegas Strip and sunset.  We drove 40 minutes to try Ventano's and the view alone was worth it.  It was 6 pm on a Friday night, the dining area was busy and three hostesses greeted us cheerfully.  They said congratulations on your anniversary and gave us the option of a fabulous booth by the window with the view or patio dining with the view, my wife chose the booth inside.  I should also mention there is a full bar with video poker machines to the right as you enter.  You might miss it because it is closed off by a glass door and you can't see it from the restaurant.  Quite interesting.    The theme of the dining area is very Italian indeed.  It is well decorated and rather large.  Now, we did not know going in how fancy it actually was, I can say there isn't much of a dress code and it is kid friendly.  You can eat Ventano's dressed casually if you like.  This does not take away from the service though.  The service makes it feel like fine dining.    Our server's name was Danielle.  Danielle was very helpful and quite nice.  She was a pleasure to have as a server.  With her help we chose these wonderful "rice balls" for an appetizer, I don't remember their Italian name now.  I had a Sierra Nevada Beer Camp IPA which they had on draft, followed by a glass of red wine which Danielle recommended.  Very pleased with both.  They bring you out bread sticks in a paper bag with oil and vinegar, these are dangerously good.  The wife and I ordered the classics, a Chicken Parm and an Eggplant Parm.  Her Chicken Parm was perfect and my Eggplant Parm might have been the best I have had in Vegas.  It was plated very uniquely and the sauce, cheese, breading and thickness of the eggplant was perfect.  All the portion sizes were massive.  For dessert we had the Creme Brulee which came highly recommended and met the recommendation with ease.  We enjoyed the view throughout the sunset and as we sat for almost two hours we were never rushed or made to wait.  The staff played off our pace perfectly.  In summary, the quality of the food for the price is unequaled, it is not overly fancy, so if that is what you want this isn't the place.  I can tell you the long drive was well worth it and we will be back.  We have a new favorite Italian spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Very reasonable bill
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The south side patio
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Creme brulee

ytGM-53eHNlb2iInQMUlIA.text: Food is amazing and the service is great! One of our favorite family spots. The shrimp on stone is a must have. Love your place Arnauld Briand!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Wow! What a meal! Great food and service. Best date night spot!

jy8IQMeEPcPBBepOCZlgOw.text: I love this place. Came here for a dinner date around 8pm and sat outside as it was a warm summer evening. Service was awesome. Had the pleasure of being helped by a very well spoken young man named Austin who was extremely attentive and helpful. Started w the Caesar salad based on a previous Yelp review and it was amazing. Delicious. I had the fettuccine and my date had the cioppino (assorted seafood in a tomato wine broth) which she loved.   And for dessert... o em gee... house made tiramisu. Holy cow. So delicious. All of this with the beautiful view of Vegas just hit the spot. Make a reservation if your dining in for dinner. Great spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. House made tiramisu  I&#39;m in love!!

1vANIDO_V4ILvlVx5fB8tw.text: This was our second time here in two years. Wife was in the mood for some good tiramisu and I was in the mood for a salad (of all things). We were greeted by server Adam, who was very friendly and pleasant to deal with. Started with some lamb chops on the hot rock which was fantastic. Wife got the shrimp scampi that came with risotto. The shrimp unfortunately were nothing special but at least they were a decent medium size and the risotto was absolutely perfect.  I got a cup size (doesn't show that they have a cup size on the menu but was told by the server it was available, as well as a bread bowl) clam chowder and it was absolutely amazing. The soup was delightfully chunky and full of flavor. The ingredients (clams, potatoes and prosciutto) were all diced into tiny pieces. I think this was the key to the amazing flavor. I also had the Caesar salad that had their own homemade dressing with anchovies blended into it. I had them add anchovies on top of the salad also and it was just the right balance of saltiness to compliment the salad. Our kid got Mac and cheese which was very creamy and buttery, not dry at all (kids menu) and we finished our meal with a beautiful tiramisu that was loaded with booze! Thank you for the end of a wonderful evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Lamb chops
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu

-XJPmHlM8xbi6VP3KyuM4A.text: Excellent as always!  Great food and great service.  Our favorite place for lunch! Awesome view of the strip, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Orange Roughy w scallops
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmmm oysters!

Vq6PuQsewCaERMycK6r6Rg.text: Oh my God...the Puno is fantastic, ask Mike for it, not on the menu.  great place to come with your friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. This is the best Puno in the world...ask Mike for a glass

wvxVIXpm9oA8g226mft3wg.text: My friends and I went out to lunch today to celebrate a birthday. Lalo was our waiter and went ot of his way to make sure that our lunch was remarkable.  The food was excellent,  the wine 2as excellent and the company was excellent,  what more could one ask for.

22S-PNDNd5tob4g-NbIQcw.text: One of my favorite Italian restaurants without a doubt. The staff is great, always tending to your every needs. The food is absolutely ridiculously good, my favorite thing is the gorgeous view of the city. Anyone of the servers are great there I personally like going with marcos or Efren. Very funny guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Favorite Italian place by far

qUBboTWAtbupW8q_be7acQ.text: 100% recommend. Top 3 Italian restaurant in Vegas. The food was well presented and tasted amazing. It gets a bit crowded so MAKE RESERVATIONS!

szRlbTedySvWzn386Fyb8g.text: Really love this spot.  It's cozy with a nice view. The bread is fresh and soft.  Service is welcoming, friendly, and on point. Selection is great and tastes very good.  Love the clams in white sauce.  The bread in the sauce is so yum! My favorite wine by the bottle is the German Riesling $30 if you like it sweet.  Nice date spot.
