Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Bread
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Tortellini

symgHJJMcZ6zK9OQi9_tMA.text: Tonight was super bowl Sunday. I did not realize until after I made the reservation for 7:45 PM. At about 6 I received a call to confirm the reservation and was welcomed to come early. We did just that.   My boyfriend and I arrived to find that we were the only ones in the restaurant. That's when I realized that normal Americans were at home watching the game.   We were given the choice to seat wherever we liked by our server, Carlos. This was very nice and romantic, which was what I was going for.    When we were given the wine menu Adam showed up with a delicious sample of a Red Zinfandel. I thought it was a very appropriate wine and I was leaning towards choosing it But my boy friend decided another wine would be a better idea. I don't know which wine that Adam helped him decide on, but whatever it was, it was perfect.   The bag of bread has been my favorite since I was a kid.  I've been coming here since the doors opened and I have always looked forward to their bag of bread with olive oil and balsamic dipping.   We ordered calamari and shrimp on stone(also a favorite since day one). Delicious!!! The calamari was perfection. Nice big pieces. The shrimp was perfectly cooked.  The stone is perfect for keeping it nice and hot while you enjoy it. The marinara for the calamari was so delicious. Great fresh flavor. The calamari had another sauce that was delicious. The shrimp had two amazing sauces that I wasn't sure what they were but they were amazing.   I was recommended the steak with potatoes, green beans, and jumbo shrimp. I say the steak because I forget what kind of steak. Either way, it was so delicious. I can't believe how amazing it was.  My boy friend had the chicken parmesan. Perfectly al dente pasta. Deliciousness.   Our entire meal was epic and both of our servers were amazingly friendly and knowledgable of the menu. I felt quite at home.   My boyfriend was impressed and I was shown that nothing has changed since this place opened.  It always been amazing. Great memories. Such a romantic atmosphere. Perfect for date nights, family dinners, and even large groups.   I was overly pleased with my visit and will be sure to be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The best calamari I have ever had. A delicious marinara and a sweet sauce are served with it. Huge serving.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

BfyDBwysjm_JUcYknIa3Vw.text: I've been here for Father's Day, a first date, and most recently, my mother's birthday. They have a great food & drink menu. On my mother's birthday, we sat outside and were fascinated with the beautiful weather. Our server was very patient with us when we told him that we needed more time to decide on what we should order. We will definitely be back another time!

2_Hddb84AjAQMAQdRSMxyw.text: Four of us went here last night at 7:00 pm. We were seated promptly and provided menus, water and bread. We waited 15 minutes for a waiter who wanted to take our drink order but we were not provided  a wine list so we had to wait another 15 minutes to place our order. We then waited 35 minutes for our food. The waiter offered us free dessert for the wait- the restaurant was not busy. He asked if 1 of our party wanted more wine and they said yes but the wine did not arrive until after he finished eating so he turned the wine away. Our waiter also stood behind us when speaking to us which was very odd- 2 of our party could not see him as he spoke. The food was good but we will not return.

IW_dD_RLsDzPPRmHWuLOYA.text: Spaghetti Carbonara--bland.   I had to send back   Second time was better but I've had homemade better.   Guy sitting next to me had a pizza made and they forgot the pepperoni.    Big disappointment!!

TvA4-CIPtsYq5nv4ftnlbQ.text: This is my go to for Italian food. I love the hot out of the oven bread sticks and chicken marsala. My husband and I usually leave with left overs so we can enjoy it again. The view of the strip is amazing and the service is excellent.

kBpnoRIBhyezhE1zlc28hg.text: We had chicken spedini and lasagna as our main dishes . . . . Exceptional cuisine, warm romantic atmosphere and the view was incredible as we watch a spectacular sunset! All combined it was a great value! Don't miss this dining experience! Bellisimo!

wYhzVmRI4Waxttjzx3zgmQ.text: First off, this isn't an endorsed message I just love this place! Hands down the best italian resturant in Las Vegas. We go here to eat at least once a month and every time we have a visitor from out of town we bring them here and they all LOVE it and request to go back the next time they visit! Great wine selection, great bruschetta, I always get the eggplant parm (comes with your choice of pasta) or the ravioli (I'm a vegetarian) and my husband gets the chicken parm (comes with your choice of pasta) or the salmon (comes with veggies and mashed potato), everything is ALWAYS fantastic. They give you hot bread right out of the oven when you sit down which is delicious with the olive oil and vinegar. You can sit outside at night for a great view of Vegas which is always romantic :) The staff are all great and the manager is always walking around making sure all of the customers are happy. I've tried many many italian restaurants in Vegas and Ventano's is by far the best of the best. If you are planning to go on a weekend for dinner be sure to make a reservation as it can get really busy. Hope you enjoy this place as much as I do!

cQZA2D-Z1X-W5KvyxKifTg.text: My tradition was to take my gal during the holidays and have a nice experience for many years. We went last night for the last time. Dirty tables, broken booths, inflated prices, poor service. Oh and the way they serve their greasy bread in a brown bag, no class at all, has cheap written all over it. Sorry, I can no longer recommend this place for anything.

HZlHbxxmSCEdpnU1mcBNyg.text: Thanks to Manager Michael & his staff our party of 25 had an amazing birthday dinner party. Michael helped me with the planning every step of the way, including bakery suggestions for the cake. We chose 3 appetizers (baked clams, aracinos, antipasto) 2 salads, & choice of 5 entrees. We all raved about the quality of our meals. They even served a last minute special meal (salmon) to one of the diners with dietary restrictions.  Despite our constant interruptions for photos and toasts the staff remained friendly and patient. Michael kindly took our group photos.  This will always be a memorable night for our family and thanks to Ventano's it will be a very happy one. Btw. several of us had the leftovers the following day and we were still talking about how great the food was.

mvKSNbnyW_0M-WLgCd0Miw.text: This is a True gem in terms of the beautiful view of the city without the drama of being on the strip.  It is a perfect casual date spot with reasonable prices, good food, and a great selection of specialty cocktails and wine.  If you are in the area after dark, it is worth a stop, even if it's just for the view.

0uF4cq1QR7n1IGbvUKZxyQ.text: Overpriced mediocre food.  Topped off by the waiter cleaning the table by pushing the crumbs onto the floor. ..wow, classless!

lLKog_eVtiQ72G5WdSBlQg.text: My boyfriend and I went here a few weeks ago on date night, and what a lovely restaurant! Great atmosphere, definitely sit outside and enjoy the views of Vegas. Their food was delicious, and they have a decent wine list with plenty of wines by the glass, 1/2 or full bottle. And very friendly and attentive waitstaff. I'll definitely be bringing family here when they come to visit!

zitDxVgtMsZfUW6avtny_A.text: Very delicious Italian food and great customer service! They give big portions so definitely worth the price! Recommend the lasagna and chicken francese, both are my favorite

2WVCOBynIdNgOJYVSyANqA.text: Overall, nice local place to enjoy with A-1 View.  View - OK, the view is better than the food, but that is because it is a great view.  Reservationists - The staff taking reservations are generally very nice and pleasant.  Local restaurant, Doesn't seem to have a database to remember you by, or to promote their restaurant to you for more visits.  Ambiance - Very nice overall. From very casual and family in shorts to business / smart casual or more.  Parking - Great and easy.  Food - Stone crab appetizers are great. Mussels are wonderful. All the food here is good. Anything outstanding, naw, but overall, you will never go wrong.  The Baby Back Ribs were quite a pleasant surprise and I would recommend this to anyone that is not sure what they want.   The Cioppino is something not on all menus and this is a nice dish.  I tend to measure a great Italian Restaurant by it's Osso Bucco, but this is not on the menu. Plenty of other good t hings though.  Check it out you will be happy.

jaiZlMT52SKxE814aD4TVw.text: Great lobster bisque...get the bread bowl to really enjoy it!!  Bar with gamblers bonus gaming.  810 on a 5 spot keno.  Classy restaurant.  Good Italian food.  Parking on site.  A few outside seats by the bar and views of the strip.

SyqTMuY_Xww6GNX0zUCFdQ.text: I absolutely love to bring clients here to celebrate closing on a house for some great food and amazing wine. I love the atmosphere and they are always so friendly and fast!

grVWDdUMIApQIfZ7hglSqw.text: Made reservations tonight for four. It is our best friends' birthday and my husband and I decided to treat him and his wife to a nice dinner. We got there early which was nice since it wasn't busy and ordered the stone shrimp for an appetizer. It was not what we expected. Okay at best. Our server was nonexistent all night, choosing to spend her time on one of the many banquet tables tonight. The food was alright. Seriously disappointed. We will not be going back. Service was awful.

KstW0Cli5Yn_vzyE0lViHQ.text: Just returned home from another exquisite meal at Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood. What a delight! I would gladly give 10 stars if I could! Arnauld, Mike and the entire staff strive diligently to ensure each guest has a wonderful dining experience. And it shows!! Tonight, we were served by Adam and Adrian. We had barely been seated when Adrian appears at our table with our drinks. No, we did not have to tell him what we wanted ... they already knew. Where else can one find this kind of service? Amazing attention to detail! We dined on the special this evening, Filet Mignon with scalloped potatoes, green beans and grilled shrimp. The steak was so tender and juicy it just melted in your mouth. And, the scalloped potatoes? Simply divine! Please give Ventano's a try. You'll be glad you did!

nkk7r_S6r485nMZmnA_4vA.text: 0 stars is deserved. Absolutely tragic. Vantano's is tragic!!!!!! I have been in the service industry for 20 plus years now and this was the WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD at a restaurant. Period. I wanted to put this part last, but it needs to be read first. They make you split your bill and figure out the tax yourself. They blame it on the POS system that's, "new and doesn't allow us to split checks unless you want to wait for 45 minutes." Riiiiiiiiiiiiiiight..... The new technology doesn't allow for spilt checks.... Being a server myself, the only time that this happens is when the computer system is down/offline, or because I didn't check to see of the party was splitting their checks at the beginning. I even told the server that my girlfriend and I were together on one check, which was recognized by our server with a head shake and an, "I've got you." Nothing. It took us more than 45 minutes to split the parties check up, figure out our tax that needed to be added and then pay. All without a manager ever coming to see how things were. I can't believe it. And it was birthday party. We were a semi-big party of 15 people for my friends birthday dinner. He's actually a regular, or was, before this pathetic experience happened. We get there and everything is fine at the beginning. The server does his job for the first round.  Drinks arrived and were NEVER offered to be refilled. How can a server NEVER OFFER TO REFILL YOUR BEVERAGE the entire evening??? Not even the soda/pop. Then the food comes. No seasoning on the shrimp, not even salt. Fine, we muscle through the mediocrity. It was the least offensive part of the overall experience. Next, the cake that my friend's wife purchased for him was treated with the utmost disrepect possible. The first piece came out, looked nice as an end piece. Then the food runner put the plate on top of the birthday cards that my friend was opening for his birthday, as he's opening them. Really, dude?? You're just going to drop his cake on top of all of his cards and gifts?? AMATEUR HOUR. The rest of the pieces looked to have been thrown on the plate, literally. She spent all of that money on a cake just to have it destroyed by the server(s)/Edward-Scissor-Hands that cut and plated it. Zero excuses for that. Incredibly disrespectful and completely unacceptable. The right thing would be to reimburse my friend for that cake. The ONLY SAVING GRACE, is that the owner was not there that evening to take responsibility for his decision in a new computer system or to help his server(s) out. This was the server simply not caring. I certainly hope that the owner will fix these major flaws in his restaurant and teach his servers respect for guests, especially on their birthday.

XGLRYRF8L4VgzX3BEB8BJg.text: When eating here you should allow for time from your order to come to your table.  If you are on a romantic evening that can be fine as the appetizers and bread are quite good to bide your time.  The food is quite good even for a jaded New Yorker like me, I have never had a bad dish nor my fellow diners.    I just had lunch here and that was pretty good as well, although expensive .  Cole slaw with Gorgonzola cheeze  was a tasty side with my Sausage and Pepper sandwich.

frdZeEq3zbzwa4TIM_NzXg.text: Don't come any earlier than dusk or it will be blinding light in the dining room....yummy breadsticks come in a paper bag!  Downside: it's expensive.  Make a reservation for outside.  Gorgeous   view!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

inytmVK4wTS2uSUWHehjfw.text: Amazing view and the staff are great. We were referred here by the hotel we were staying at in Las Vegas and soooo happy we went out of our way to this place!!! If it had 6 stars I would have gave it 6!!

6GgZXQ5so6QN_pMUUappsA.text: Had a wonderful meal of lamb chops on stone, mussels, carpaccio and creme brulee. Chef Arnaud was most gracious and quite handsome too!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. At ventanos

ZyZ8Ul9BGPp-BzDOAxF2bw.text: Let me start by saying that I am an Italian girl and I have a hard time finding good Italian food in the Las Vegas valley. Well folks, I have found heaven...on a plate! I have been going to Ventano's since they opened in 2003 and I fell in love with their food from the first time I ate there.   Tucked away in a quiet, residental area you will find Ventano's. Perfectly perched on a small hill with breathtaking views of Las Vegas. Sit on the patio with your honey for a nice romantic dinner or dine inside the restaurant where the lights are dimmed and gaze out the window to see the dazzling strip lights at night. Try the "shrimp on the stone" for a yummy appetizer to start with, crack open a bottle of delightful Riesling, taste the delicious entrees (Rigatoni Portafino is my fav), and of course indulge in dessert.   The have a good sized kids menu. My munchkin enjoys their delicious cheese pizza (Mommy enjoys it too, sssssh!). I normally don't eat the crust on my pizzas but boy, I sure do here.  The staff is excellent on checking back on your table to make sure you are satisified and the owner comes table to table to ask how your experience is going. Sign up online to receive discounts and the occasional free appetizer or look for flyers in the mail. They also have a large back room for parties and events. Our company had our 2009 Christmas party at Ventano's and it was the best one yet! They have an extensive wine list, gaming in the bar, and a menu full of delicious food. You NEED to check them out!   Bon appetit :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Creme brûlée birthday dessert!

zxBupgi31oG3VvCOqAkeLg.text: I've been here twice and their alfredo is one of the best I've ever tasted. I also favor their steamed mussels very much- their white wine, garlic and herb broth is absolutely mouth watering... Their lobster ravioli is also amazing. One complaint though, for the amount they charge for their food... quite high end, I am VERY disappointed in their presentation, their plates (were chipped and flowers were faded and had knife scrapes) and platters are the kind you find at outlets.. their silverware isn't very clean. And their presentation lacks creativity. If you are a high end restaurant serving expensive food, you'd think you could serve your food on high caliber, top of the line plates and platters. Charge me $40 for a steak (yes quite delicious) then give me garlic bread in a paper bag. Eh.

alh6drBLP1YxEaHAibk3nw.text: We went here on a late Sat afternoon and as we approached the hostess area, she was just seating another couple and let's us know that she will be right with us. She goes to seat the couple in front of us and then DOES NOT RETURN FOR 10 minutes. Wth? Did she seat the couple and then go on break? Anyways she finally comes back and asks if we have a reservation. We let her know that we do not and she says that's it's ok and she can seat us. We decided to sit outside and she took us to our table which was a little dirty and unkept but whatever she said she will send someone over to clean up. She gives us the menus and said someone will be right over. Looking at the menu, this place is WAY OVERPRICED.....$21 dollars for gnocchi?? This is just some bar/restaurant behind a gas station and there prices are like a fine Italian restaurant at the Wynn....Anyways, 10 more minutes pass and no one has come over to take our drink order or "clean up" the table yet. So we end our misery and just get up and leave. This place needs a strong manager and if they have someone in charge, they need to replace that person.

mCQjqMLjMB-fCSqQ1_Enag.text: We didn't want to hassle with the Strip, but wanted a nice meal, and this place was perfect. The food was excellent! Best halibut we've had in forever and priced at $34!? You won't find that on the Strip. Wait staff was great. The only negative is that we were seated next to a table of foul mouthed women. No fault of the restaurant, but maybe one of those "ladies" will read this and leave their f-bombs home next time.

7EF7ihF0WzlkMJI2JmbiZg.text: Having dinner tonite and it is delicious as usual. They never disappoint. Service is excellent.   Atmosphere friendly and inviting. Love this place.

lwKwj_wQDprcBGO-_pYaMA.text: Ok...just ok. The first time we went the food was great. This time it was ok. The bread was disappointing. It was less than Olive Garden quality with Ventano prices.

BEodBeM9mpGEb8SAH12rmA.text: Its was ok. The service was slow and the food was average.  The prices are too high for the bland food.  The view saved the evening. I wouldnt go back.

xnLva3q8SaV_P7orKHkZ0A.text: I understand that 4th of July weekend is a busy weekend for the food industry and service might be slow, but the service was HORRIBLE!!!!  We had a party of 4, on 7/4. We're seated in a "okay" matter of time, but the couple in front of us seemed like they were waiting for a while and was getting really mad... We got a window seat to see the fireworks on the strip and the neighboring casinos.  There seemed like 3 waitress & waiters, with 10 bus-boys running around. Our waters and soda never went dry but we waited over 30minutes to get our desserts and another 15 to get the bill. Honestly I can't remember my meal because I was so annoyed with how poor the service was.  I gave one star because the Tiramisu was pretty good. Otherwise I will not be going there again.... If my bf can play a game on my iPhone and win his highest scoring game, there is a BIG issue with the service... :(

o0E4HuCQHNHzyk_Pgz-FPg.text: A few weeks ago was looking on yelp for a place fairly close to home with a patio ... which is not easy to find in this town.  Crazy, since I'm originally from Chicago in which the weather is good approximately 5 days a year (insert  sarcasm here) and yet there is a patio on every other eating establishment.  Anyway, I digress....  Let's start off with the view - fan-flipping-tastic!  If you find yourself in Henderson this is the place for a great view of the strip and also a nice sunset.  The patio has heaters and misters, too!  Now the food - the shrimp appetizer on the rock was okay, differnet and good sauce.  Just didn't blow me away.  BF had the lobster ravioli and loved it.  My first visit I had the dish with chicken/mushrooms/pasta that is baked - yummy!  The second visit I had the rigatoni portofino - super yummy!  The bf must have really liked the lobster rav a bunch since he had it on the second visit, too!  As for the food, what did blow me away was the grilled romaine salad.  It has gorgonzola cheese and proscuitto and OMG - it does rock my world!  I may have to try this at home, which I am sure won't be quite as good as this.  This is as good as it gets!  Its a large salad so we did share (2 of us).    GREAT wine list and VERY reasonable prices. Friendly staff, servers and GM.   Look forward to going to a wine dinner, which the GM indicated they have every now and again if we get on the mail list.  So we did!  He indicated they are usually on Fridays.  Go for the view and stay for the food....and can't forget some good decent priced wine, too!

WuQowQ87a88yKvVM9Lt_9w.text: Horrible carry out service. Gave me wrong order, had to drive back to pick up correct order while rest of food got cold. They didn't even offer an apology. Will not go back. Try Tuscany for dinner much better food and service. How do you mess up spaghetti with meat sauce? Come on really?

j39Bc6EnHCkDrHuEruo4NA.text: Michael and his staff are friendly, food ALWAYS comes out hot and if there's a problem their more than happy to take care of it....Can be a little spendy but I would NOT say it's over priced..you get what ya pay for..

yN3wE9fx8_w0RG6QP9JLDA.text: Went with the husband for dinner just as the sun was going down. We were seated at a booth with a nice view. Service was great and the food was excellent. I had the chicken spideini and asked for the spicy marinara with my angel hair pasta. Absolutely loved it. The pasta had the perfect kick to it. My husband had the shrimp scampi and enjoyed it as well.

avyOcKBT2ntCj6soLUeKow.text: Had a sub par experience for a simple birthday dinner for my mom. Not sure why we had a so so time because we were the only people in the restaurant at 430pm. Started with the calamari which had too much breading so I could barely taste the good quality squid. For main course it was risotto Milanese which was amazing. So this is when the service got weird, I told them ahead of time is was a bday dinner so I was expecting a simple ice cream or whatever but instead we got tiramisu-but I had ordered that for myself not for my mom. So remember to order ALL your desserts not what you think your going to get just because it's someone's bday. And to top it off I didn't get my doggie bag of my unfinished risotto, I think they tossed it even though the waiter specifically said he was having it bagged up. I guess he was more interested in checking us out rather than making sure we were being taken care of. So I doubt I will come back here ever again.  Two stars because of the service, would have been four because the food was decent but these days service is 50% of the experience.

9WukQhO9fSBXkxFVPfCO-Q.text: Lat night two couples got together and went to Ventano.  I had heard about the view of the Las Vegas, but it was better in person.  I can't wait to come back and sit outside or at a table with an even better view!  The food was AWESOME!  Every dish was excellent.  We all ended up sampling each others food, because we couldn't believe how good it was.  We started with Caprese and oysters on the half shell.  Terrific!  I had the eggplant rollie, others had eggplant parmesane, lasagna and a veal dish.  EVERY dish was excellent.  The service is some of the best, I have ever had.  Walked you through meal choices, asked what you normally like, etc, etc.  The wine list is better than average, with better prices than most.  We all will be back!

8k_zEqCBrxuX58hAgVz_XQ.text: Ventano's has been our favorite southern Italian restaurant since it first opened.   Although this was a Friday night, the restaurant was not as busy as usual.  We took a pass on the bread and shared a delicious spinach salad with onions, hard boiled egg and mushrooms in a warm bacon dressing.  As is customary, we shared our an eggplant rollatini, but the portion size had been reduced by 50% and the ricotta filling was a memory compared to prior visits.  It was initially served in one dish, as opposed to 2 in the past, and the amount of marinara was barely covered the top of the eggplant.  I had ordered a side of sauteed spinach in order to approximate the value of our Groupon, but the waiter substituted it for the usual sides of ziti so we were forced to order a creme brulee.  LOL Unfortunately it was overcooked and very disappointing.  I don't know whether we caught the restaurant on a bad night or not, but I am not inclined to rush back.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Spinach salad
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Decorations
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Decoration

nplCJ5wJ3ffX0WT-RjshAQ.text: Fantastic food and service.  We've held our company Christmas party here the last couple of years (the last one being just this last Friday night) and we couldn't be happier with Michael and his staff.  They handled our 90+ group well and were very accommodating to our needs. This is one of my favorite restaurants in all of Las Vegas and enjoy coming here on my own whenever possible.  Highly recommend for a nice romantic dinner or for your corporate event.

zpFEpSPE_TUHBVqGTmvbjg.text: Amazing food (try the shrimp on a stone), amazing views (remember to head up there as the sun goes down), lovely staff...and breadsticks to die for; i dare you to only eat one!  If you sign up for their mailing list they also have special deals on wine and really amazing winery dinners from between $65 to $85 for 7 courses including reception drinks.

3epUN-vOYL6Ix_PxSwlryw.text: Food is good. Bar is full of smokers so if you don't smoke sit in restaurant section.

qO7c9Yq2BSvDKpuEN9Jj4w.text: Pricey but signs but at the door says no tank tops allowed. Food was good though.  My date's salmon filet a better choice than my penne. For some reason they won't lift the curtains to allow us to watch the sunset which is just odd. Understand the glare but those last few minutes of the sunset, they should just pull the curtains aside. Glare was long gone. Family friendly. House photographer is a sure sign that this is a tourist trap - $15 for a photo, no thanks. I will point out that the porch is magnificent. Sitting there looking at Las Vegas in the distance with a glass of wine is heaven.

4wRojdBoSCfJqCvDQKJ-_g.text: We made reservations for Valentine's Day 3 weeks in advance and when we checked in with the hostess 10 minutes early we were told in a not so nice way that we would have to wait until our reservation time to be seated and to wait over by the Oyster Bar which we did not know where it was.  We saw a bar but no indication that it was a Oyster Bar as it had at least 50 dirty wine glasses stacked on it.  Once our name was called which we were identified by incorrectly we were seated by another hostess who too was not very nice.  When she showed us to our table, there was no place settings.  The hostess then slammed down the place settings which included a dirty bread plate.  When the busboy came by to bring us water, I showed him the plate and requested a new one.  No problem.  While looking at our menus a "runner" came to our table with another table's salads trying to give them to us, we informed him that we had not ordered yet.  The busboy then came by to check on us and realized that we had not ordered, he then called over the waiter.  The waiter came and took our drink order and brought it to us, then took our dinner order.  That was the only time we saw our waiter until I requested him at the end of our dinner to show him that I had foreign object in my wine glass that had came out of the carafe.  His comment to us was that it must had come out of the "machine".  Based on what we saw when we came in at the Oyster Bar, I am assuming he used a dirty carafe to pour my wine into.  He offered a new glass of wine at no charge, but by that time I was pretty grossed out.  When brought the new glass of wine he also brought our check, no offer of dessert.  It was like hurry up and get out of here.    While eating, we noticed a table behind us who had been seated before us that had not been served until after we were and they too complained stating that they would be leaving if their food did not arrive in 5 minutes.  We also noticed that none of the candles were lit on the tables throughout the restaurant.  This was Valentine's Day and we and others were treated as it was not a special day, which it should have been.  When walking out, we overheard a couple of patrons mentioning that they too were not happy with the food and service.    Overall, the food was mediocre, nothing special, over priced and the staff with the exception of the busboy were rude and not attentive.  We were highly disappointed in our experience as we expected a nicer restaurant with great service and food. I highly doubt that we would ever come back to this restaurant based on this experience.  There are far more Italian restaurants in town that are better to choose from.

kSDR3dmWgwc4GcplfXUhTw.text: Took our sons and 1 girlfriend to Ventano's after they arrived from New York on the 24th of November.  It was close to 9:00 pm when we arrived and our waiter asured us that it was not a problem to serve us.  I have unfortunately lost our receipt with his name on it otherwise I would mention him in this review.  Wonderful service from a server who knows what he's doing and seemingly enjoys his job.  There were five of us in the party, maybe he will be located in that fashion.  Anyway, we ordered beverages for dinner including a bottle of Ca'Nani cabernet that was very delicious.  I mentioned that two of us would be sharing a chicken parm dinner and a carbonara dinner.  The others ordered either veal or chicken parm.  When dinner arrived, the two shared plates had been plated with half of each entree on each plate.  Now that's what I call awesome service from someone that paid attention.  We all loved, loved, loved our meals. None of us felt pressure to hurry up and get the heck out, as it was past 10:00 when we were finished with our meals. The service remained terrific throughout the evening and the view was spectacular.  We will definately be returning to this gem and if I have my way, it will be very, very soon.

wcwSuuonvDdRZgKW00AcGA.text: We are so proud to have this fine restaurant just minutes from our house. Several years ago when it first opened, we had lunch and were hooked ever since. Great lunch menu and we are never dissapointed. My wife loves the chicken sandwich, with pasta salad. I will usually have the same, but with coleslaw. Hot fresh bread is served in a bag as a starter and then everything is just fantastic from there on. Always good service although sometimes they may be slightly short handed at lunch time if they are caught off guard and the place fills up, but don't worry about it. The crew is very good! Nice views and modern/rustic decor. They have a private banquet room that was built a year or so ago and that is great for big gatherings. Just a excellent place that we can always count on and bring friends and family when we don't want to drive all over town for dinner. A hidden gem in Henderson!

D7jSQxwr6NR9NM3Cv4k9kw.text: Below average service, above average food.  When I dined here, in late February 2010, we went through 3 servers. The first server took our appetizer order, and he was wonderful. Then our *new* server came to finish our order for the entrees. When our food was delivered, my entree was completely wrong, he admitted to me that he pressed the wrong button, honest mistake. That was the last of him, I didn't receive my meal till after the rest of my party had finished theirs, and our *new new* server came to drop off our check.  The food was good, I had the lobster ravioli, and my one of my friends had the mahi mahi special. This place is priced moderately, and the view is pretty nice.   Ask for a balcony seat, weather permitting, real nice scenery.

6Vx1oahO7luGPERqVXtDTg.text: Great view of the city and great food.  We will dine there again! Everyone was happy with their meal.  We went there for my mom's B-day.  Service was good but took a while to get the bill to pay.  Plus ordered Ice Cream with a candle to celebrate my mom's b-day because they do not do anything special for b-days and that took a while to get.  But over all it was a nice place.

PaMSffGhbYIhTvQMSIhiHQ.text: The Cioppino is amazing! A local gem! Beautiful view of the strip

XR7EQhE7WRzcbxdmcnT8_w.text: I have been here in Vegas for 5 years. This is the first restaurant we found when I moved here. And haven't stopped going since. My husband and I had our wedding reception here. The food is absolutely delicious. I've tried almost everything on the menu and it's all so yummy. The most authentic Italian I've ever had. My husband and I recommend: shrimp on the stone and calamari for starters. I love the eggplant rollatini and my husband gets nothing but the lasagna. Mike is great!!! Enjoy! There is a lot of food so make sure not to eat a lot before. :)

t9edpR3zz5i2Mum8t-3qFA.text: I would like the owner to know that i am the person with the Mushroom Risotto and the "indecent".....i have decided to remove my previous review of my experience because of the way the owner handled himself...he was very nice and actually cared about what happened, unlike his manager and staff...i am also a business owner and i know how important YELP can be.........he handled the situation better then his staff...and his managers....and although my "experience" at the restaurant cannot be removed from my memory....i have decided to take this action anyway.....i still would like to say that he needs to work on his menu a bit.....it is not as "italian" as it claims to  be...my family is fresh off the boat Italian so we know our food.. ..His bruschetta needs work as well as the involtini...they are not made correctly.....Anyway....thank you to the owner for at least taking the time to contact us and make right of a horrible wrong....

M7Zx5ThiZp-yPd3_PX-Lyw.text: Love this place.  My wife and I go there often for date nights.  Service is always good and food is excellent.  We always start with the stuffed mushrooms.  The view is incredible.

7zIJAL0acRMLHDxjaLpdqA.text: What can I say I love this place. The food is always fresh and everything is hot. I have been here a lot and love to see the chef in the dining room talking with customers. I come from an Italian family and I have to say that their eggplant parm is better than my grandmother's. I do have two favorites the lasagna and manicotti always delight. I love the views at sunset, this place has the best views of Vegas. I'm not sure how they make their sauce but I can't get enough of it.  I'm not sure why people would go to an Italian restaurant and get fish so I can't really comment on the fish but I've tried most of the menu and everything has been wonderful. I don't understand how people can say the food is bland,  I'm Italian from an Italian family and I've been to a lot of Italian restaurants and have eaten Italian food my whole life, this place by far has the best tasting sauce, I wish I knew thier secret. The dining room has a lot of seating and the staff is always friendly and when they mention you by name shows class. I'm only giving 4 stars because nobody beats my grandmother's cooking and I leave that star for her.

DfBgeCLktlXQcYzNzwK8OA.text: This place has great Italian food. My family and I came here to celebrate my mom's nursing graduation. My husband had the Gnocchi and it was the best Gnocchi's I've ever had! I had the Cioppino and it was good. We also tried the calamari which was delicious and the new england clam chowder was not good. It tasted like canned soup. My mom had the potato wrapped salmon and that was good too. I highly recommend the Gnocchi! The venue is nice but it wasn't grand as I expected.

uiZ4enyF3Z1WJeaY5t1swQ.text: Very disappointed!!!! I have gone to this restaurant before and it was wonderful. Now it's going on a downward spiral. Service just sucked!!! We were told they had immediate seating and ended up waiting 15 mins for a table. Finally we sat down and orders drinks. Waited a little for the server to come back to order our food. We ordered shrimp on the hot stone, chicken piccata and manicotti. The only good thing about this dinner was the shrimp. Very tasty and cooked perfectly. However the entrees were horrible!!!! I couldn't eat the manicotti right away bc it was still bubbling hot. I did ask for some more bread while I waited for it to cool. Never got the bread. Then when I did eat the manicotti it was so salty that I couldn't eat it! And the piccata was salty as well. We wanted to complain but our waiter was nowhere to be found. Fed up we just wanted  our food to go and leave. Oh I had veggies also. They were mush and the waiter forgot to box them. The only reason I boxed it to go is maybe my dogs could have a bite. I left feeling bloated and disappointed. Never again.

WZagh3tdpUe678PWC7qxxQ.text: Definitely will not be coming back. Food is mediocre at a high price. Came here for Easter and ordered the "special" which was $35. It included not so fresh fried halibut with pasty crab stuff on top, over done broiled asparagus and tomato, shrimp (good sized), rice (not Risotto they claim it to be) in a champagne sauce with skin on it that had to be peeled back. Disgusting and sent it back. Waited 15 minutes for wine to finally come out. We had a $10 coupon that stated for use on any day and the server refused to honor it or even so much as offer to ask management about it. For close to $100 for 3 people (one just ordered a bowl of soup), this was the worst food and waste of money.

-kX2sbq3WfJxpYVkayCtQQ.text: I haven't posted a review of anyplace negatively - but here's my first one. We had dinner for 5 people for  a birthday on the patio - seating was very fast and a fantastic view. The rest of the experience was awful . The restaurant was less than 50 % occupied , yet it took 20 minutes to get a cocktail , then at the 35 minute mark I had to flag down the busboy to take our food order as we had a show to get to ( 630 reservation - 9pm show ) . The food arrived  at 750pm , all of it was boring and bland - marinara tasted like canned tomato sauce , chicken parm average , cheese tortellini tasted like store bought , chicken marsala barely average . Had to flag waiter to get 2nd Rd of drinks , no checking to see if water was needed , no follow up to see if we wanted dessert and had to have the busses tell the waiter to bring the bill at 815 after rushing thru the meal . I can see why the place was dead on a Saturday night . We won't be returning,  such a shame with a view like that ...very very disappointed .

nYiHUpw-HsXKpAI_HhoNQw.text: I haven't been here yet, but all my friends (who I trust) are RAVING. I can't wait to get back to Vegas to go here!

8KqNWsP8otTdUjgAo_cNDw.text: Best margarita in town! I can't wait to go back for more clams, salad, and drinks!

woZcAaPSNr1jGM4h92FfCA.text: A group of 4 of us came to Ventano's based upon the reviews on yelp and they were pretty much right on.  The view of the strip in the distance is BY FAR the best attribute of the restaurant.  In fact, they have a patio that would have been nice to have dined on but it was still too cold and windy to do so.  We look forward to coming back and having a glass of wine out there.  However, I'm not sure we will be ordering much food on our next trip as it was just ok.  A bit pricy for what you get too.  Should a 4 inch by 4 inch piece of lasagna served a la carte worth $18.50? The food was good, but a bit bland.  But certainly not like Olive Garden as some have stated.  Much better than that!!!  Like other reviewers stated, the service was good.  And it was quite busy for a Tuesday night as well.  I look forward to coming back to the patio, but just to order wine, appetizers and to enjoy the fantastic view.

2eEEPMdMGu0lv0AHwAkKZg.text: Completely competent gluten free dining.  Much appreciated!

yeRMJejDoSwAPBQ6uTNzVA.text: Each time we go it is an amazing experience.  Carlos has been our server twice and he goes out of his way to be courteous.  The manager Michael also serves tables at times and he is also quite fabulous.  Shrimp on a stone is wonderful, the sauce it's served with is quite yummy.  This last time we went my grandmother tried the lamb chops on a stone and practically licked the bones clean.  Chicken Procuitto and Shrimp Fra Diavolo are great, portions are huge, plan for leftovers.  The Ventano's Tortellini is also one of my favorite items.

az95zj9ioZiWl5E0k3F65w.text: I tried to go at Sunset, had reservations at 6:30pm and we were immediately seated. Finally the sunset at the very end of dinner. Next time I'd go at 7pm. Seeing the strip lit up was nice. Ask for a window booth so you can see the sunset and lights on the strip, or else sit outside on the patio.  One of us had the shrimp pasta fra diavolo. Very hot! I eat jalapenos and such, this was much hotter. Make sure that you can take really hot food. Another had the lasagna. Wow! Very good! I would highly recommend this. I had the Ventano Tortellini. It is cheese tortellini with chicken and mushroom in pink sauce. It is very tasty. The three meals, no drinks, after taxes were $64.  From the menu online, it appears that the lunches are the same thing for about $5 cheaper. Not sure if the serving sizes are the same or not though. And no sunset view would come with that either. Good food. You need to try it.

XkrcDW30WlXe9pr9Mz44Zg.text: Really, really disappointed. The view is great, the atmosphere nice. But it took a while to get the food, and it's a Wednesday night, probably not one of their peak days. I ordered angel hair pasta with pink sauce and meatballs. Most of my meatballs had a tough charred spot, not yummy. And the pink sauce had an odd flavor. My husband ordered a dish that had "large" shrimp (which still had the tails on, one of my husband's pet peeves), pasta in a lemon butter sauce, which had a vague burnt flavor, as if they cooked the butter too long. It also came with a side of these chicken rolls that had mozzarella and parmesan in them, and were crusted. Unfortunately, super dry and not tasty. My husband and I barely ate our dishes, and we're still hungry. All we ordered was our dishes and water, which cost us a whopping $48 and some change. I've never dined and dashed, but boy did I want to! It hurt to pay for this meal! We won't be back, and if I were you, I'd go elsewhere. :(

EZwc0Tw2zzbPTB2JwUnFeQ.text: My boyfriend and I got a Groupon deal for this place after reading all the great reviews.  I would have to say this place is HIGHLY overrated.  In my opinion it's nothing more than an slightly upscaled Olive Garden.  I personally would have rather gone to Macaroni Grill.    The bread in bags wasn't exciting at all, nothing special about the bread and I don't really think it's a "cute" idea to have bread in paper bags in a "fine dining" restaurant.  Cheap presentation in my opinion.  The appetizer we got was the lamb chops which were extremely bland, no seasoning and no sauce.  We seasoned them ourselves with salt and pepper to make them edible.  Definitely not recommended.  I will say our entree's were good.  I got the Fettuccini con Funghi, the shrimp was huge, the sauce was great.  My boyfriend got the Lobster Ravioli.  They weren't cheap with the lobster stuffing, and the sauce was great as well.  The entree's are about $20 a plate, give or take.  I would recommend both of those plates if you do decide to eat here.  The decor was cheesy.  I don't like the look of the walls, they try to make them look like the old buildings in Italy, did a poor job.  It just make the restaurant look cheap. The lighting is very dim, which I did like, it made for a great date setting.  And there is a beautiful view of the strip.  It would be nice to sit outside during the springtime with the view this restaurant has.   The service was pretty good, I'd give the service 4 stars.  We made reservations and still had to wait a good 15 - 20 minutes for a table, so this place is very busy.    We got an appetizer, 2 entrees & a bottle of wine ($40, which is $20 in stores, typical I guess - It was a Cab called Decoy. I was a fan, boyfriend didn't like it) and the bill was $110.  I wouldn't consider this "fine dining" what-so-ever, we could have spent half the price at Macaroni Grill and probably had a better meal overall.  But with all the other great reviews I guess it would be worth giving this place a try and seeing for yourself.

5zBRS768gAQg2eFj3AY9sw.text: Despite the fact that the table we sat at was right next to the pathway for all of the bus boys and waiters to walk through, the view was amazing and the food was good. Ambiance plays a good role in having a nice, romantic dinner but we had a good time.  It's kind of awkward driving up through residential areas to finally find this restaurant but it is beautiful.

ekHJwG4LTi95aR6ogx3lSg.text: The ambiance of this place is great. It rightfully boasts one of the best views of the strip! The only place that is better is the Foudation Room at Mandalay Bay or maybe the Stratosphere. The service is always great and the food is even better. I highly recommend the 'Shrimp on the Stone' appetizer, it is amazing with its side of wasabi cream sauce. My favorite entree is the 'Chicken Spiedini'. This is an awesome place to go with the fam, friends, or for a nice dinner and can be casual or fancy.

tezspW06Oe6vaK6hZmOsrQ.text: Ventano may have the view, but their food isn't authentic italian. Their pasta is dried from a box and sauces as well. They don't even make their pesto. The bread comes from the same company as Capriotti's. For the price it's nice and the view can't be beat. Decor is pretty out of date as well.  Service wasn't good. Owner is rude and makes inappropriate comments to woman. Young staff and slow to get food.

9CGmRVDEG9k2YJSPY_5iPA.text: Been here twice in the last month. Wonderful city view in the distance and very classy. I'm not really a pasta guy but this place has made my 5 star Yelp review. Both times I had the  Jumbo Sea Scallops & Shrimp tossed with linguine pasta.  I highly recommend this dish.  Can't wait to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Jumbo Sea Scallops &amp; Shrimp tossed with linguine pasta. My favorite dish here.

Ym5mL9mDQmi95QPOJJXi_w.text: My parents always raved about this place but I we heat isn't to go due to the distance from my home. After the first bite there, now I could care less about the distance. The staff is friendly and helpful with guiding you through the menu. The shrimp cooked on the hot stone is decent but definitely has it downfalls. 1. The shrimp are small so cook quickly and can burn if you are not quick enough. 2. I can't tell of there are the frozen precooked shrimp 3. The sauces that come with them are a "different " despite its downfalls it is still good just not something I must order every time. The calamari is outstanding in my top 3 best calamari in Vegas, fresh, tender, and tasteful. As far as the entree my favorites must have are the las ha and shrimp and garlic pasta. The ambience is nice to with beautiful views in the outdoor seating area. They also ha e a bar area where you can smoke if you're in to that

Btm-biY71-ZW7vIxX2e_ug.text: Great food, service was amazing, very friendly staff. I had the potato wrapped salmon and was absolutely delicious, my husbands pasta amazing and the creme brule is a must to try. A little out of the way but worth the drive, beautiful scenery of Las Vegas. Will certainly return on our next visit to Las Vegas

EJ82aQ3nu1Wg2tBAPEdnYQ.text: Part A We went here for a (semi-formal) wedding reception- the room was huge. The guest tables were round tables with chairs. Elegant ambiance. The food was excellent. The dish I remember the most is the grilled shrimp (so delicious) on the stone- when we saw the stones getting taken back with some shrimp left, we thought, "What a waste!" The staff, although busy, was excellent in their table service (several courses/sit down dinner). I hate when they start taking away plates when you're not done- but that didn't happen here. The event was well-organized as far as wedding receptions go. So, the four stars are strictly for the wedding reception and food.   Part B The location of the restaurant overlooking a sweeping view of the Las Vegas Strip was pretty strategic/smart. Didn't really witness it at this particular time (as it got dark- Part A), but we did notice it when having dinner with the in-laws (live on that side of town). Of course this was foiled since the restaurant was closed for an event, which was funny, because there should be a sign of some sort. Instead of, "We're sorry, we're closed for an event. We're not really taking any more customers" So we went to Carrabba's instead.

nXNF8-jb7VhzrT5DwYaH9g.text: I heard from a couple of people at my work that this place was excellent. My experience overall wasn't that great. The service was ok, the guy was nice, didn't see him much, but was pretty busy, at least at first, the crowd died down but still didn't see much of our waiter. The food came out and was nothing special, not bad but for the price I expected much more. The atmosphere of the place was nice, and had a great view. I really wish the food was better, unfortunately I will probably not be going back.

TDpCdvlv2TY6mCfCeCsbYQ.text: Amy is the best server in Las Vegas!!!!!  Ventano is a beautiful place with a fantastic view.   I can totally tell that there is some French influence in the italian dishes. Everything is tasty and fresh!

GedtUJyF1lTdMp6uGPI6xg.text: Came here with a reservation for two. Only really good thing was the view; the rest was overwhelmingly mediocre.  Bread was bland; nothing fancy, not even lightly-seasoned breadsticks like Olive Garden of all places, just plain bread. Wasn't that good.  I got chicken alfredo. Pasta itself was good, chicken was underwhelming and tasted off. My dinner partner got shrimp scampi; according to her it was average but the pasta was dry and could've used more sauce.  Would ordinarily be a three-star review but we both experienced upset stomachs not long after eating the meal.   Probably won't be going back. Can get similar quality food from other places for quite cheaper.

nQYIkJ3txvfpqzygZX1IPg.text: The food and service were amazing! I highly recommended this place if you have a Gluten Sensitivity or like myself Celiac disease they were so accommodating. I had the chicken picatta  and the server informed me that my pasta will be cooked in fresh water. The dish was amazing!

NgUwKRDt07SeTuy5jg05hg.text: Our server, Carlos, was awesome! Great food, service! Had the bone-in rib eye special. It was fabulous and my husband was jealous. We will definitely be back!

vVGAgCVd7dXuhmKDBSnhXQ.text: This is good Italian food and at a fair price. Sat in the bar and had to deal with the poker machine getting in the way of my plate, but this is Vegas after all. The bartender was attentive and friendly.  In short, this place is good, but there was nothing about it that stood out and made it more than an average experience.

PIyAh67vZ3s5gb01IxZT2A.text: Lovely Valentines dinner on the patio.   With our engaged daughter & fiancee and his parents visiting from Detroit.  "Young loves" have been to Ventanos 4 out of the 5 years they have been together for Valentines Day.   It's a special place for them!  Excellent service, view and great food!  Well done!

TSv6Rt6Pk4CxIZ4i18R7Ow.text: The staff here was amazing. We never had a glass of water become empty. Our server was excellent and attentive but not overwhelming. The bread was okay. I didn't like how they mixed the balsamic vinegar and oil together without asking, but it really wasn't a big deal. We got the steamed mussels and they were great and they came with close to two dozen. The white wine sauce was perfect. I got the spicy marina shrimp (not the real name) and my husband got the veal parmigiana. I'd recommend both. The view was beautiful. Great place!

io_uZGO5JNLuoq4N1vXXWw.text: Meh. Exactly 2 stars.  I love Italian food and been to many types of restaurants from Scarpetta to Olive Garden. Although I hate to say this because I really like supporting local spots, Ventano leans much closer to the Olive Garden side.  There was nothing creative or unique about the menu, everything tasted VERY bland and it was unbelievably smoky inside.  Service was decent, but I definitely won't go out of my way to return. Perhaps try the Pasta Shop (delicious!) on Horizon Ridge or Bratalian on Eastern.

MCzloio-mb7Xim6h-aDDEA.text: The best shrimp scampi! Simple to the point! The services are always good.  A hidden Jem of Green Valley Ranch

sQjpaU9b4M5jtmZmTD6zeQ.text: I'll go as much as say 2 1/2 stars.  That is based on the good things I experienced.    The good: The staff was pretty friendly and attentive.  We arrived on a Saturday Night at around 5 with no reservation.  Got in right away and had a great view of the city out on the patio.  The place seemed clean, comfy, and had a great ambiance.  It had a large wine list that had reasonable pricing.  We were greeted, offered drinks and had our picture take right away.  The bread was pretty delicious.  The entire meal the staff was attentive and polite.    Now the bad:  The food!!!! Not horrible...but not great.  I equate it to an Olive Garden on the wrong side of town. Matter of fact..Olive Garden would have been better.  Ok...so you're saying, what do I know about "Italian food"?.  Enough.  I love food...I've eaten all over the world and spent plenty of time trying to eat my way across New Jersey and New York.  Italian food is about simplicity....simple dishes that are seasoned well with fresh ingredients which allow you to taste every little nuance of the dish.  This food was bland.  The appetizer was ok.  1/2 pound grilled shrimp on a hot stone.  All good except for served with a side of honey mustard.  Save the sauce for chicken tenders.    My girlfriend ordered Chicken Scalopini.  The chicken a little tough and it was not seasoned...fine..it has a sauce with it right, but if the sauce is bland then all of it is bland.  Not that it tasted horrible...it just didn't taste like much...couldn't taste butter, wine, salt, herbs, anything really.  The spaghetti that came with it was tasty.  Al dente with a simple marinara.    I ordered the special which was NY strip steak, "creamy polenta", french green beans, and 3 blackened shrimp served on a hot stone.  I guess it was my fault for not keying in on "hot stone".  Steak came out cooked (and pre-sliced) to proper temperature of medium.  Although by the time I got through half the steak the other half had been cooked more to med-well, well by the hot stone.  Not to mention that again.....steak was bland! Ok it's steak...taste like meat....but some salt please.  Peppercorn sauce that was served with it was ok...very very peppery....I like pepper so I didn't mind but it could be a bit much for some.  Polenta was more bready than creamy and I think they confused Cajun with Blackened because shrimp were seasons with cajun seasoning but not blackend.  Maybe they assumed the hot rock would blacken the shrimp.  Which it did not...just over cook them.  Green beans were good.  The quality of the special was not worth the $34 price tag....which I didn't see until the bill.  My fault for not asking.  Just guessed since nothing else was over $28 it wouldn't be either.    Finally....The most tacky thing I've ever seen...which has been mentioned by others.  I paid with a debit card..as most do now a days.  They bring me a machine and have me swipe my own card...the kid says, "you'll do it and I'll stand right here and watch".  So as I swipe it asks for tip - 20%, 18% or other.  Service was good so I don't mind tipping....but as he hovers over me, I thought how awkward this would be if service was crap and he's hovering over me as I choose other and commence to put a smaller amount.  Just strange to me.    All and all I've been to worse places...but I've definitely been to better.  Food is just to blah...maybe I'll try again...prob not.

xFiIEnNcGFc1LTDqoAW3Sw.text: If you're looking for authentic, delicious and big portions, look no further.  Ventanos is my go to spot anytime of the week.  The service is great and atmosphere is incredible!  You can sit and watch the strip as you sip wine and enjoy great company.  My fave is the chicken picata with angel hair pasta.  Be prepared to eat a lot of great food

KDQe1rTf-Qc3Ou2WYVDOOg.text: Came here last night for the first time to celebrate my mom's birthday. Requested to sit by the window and although the building's wall covered part of our view, the view of the strip at night was breathtaking. The restaurant itself was fairly big and had a sense of warmth to it, unlike typical restaurants, Ventano felt like I walked into a house, homey feeling.  The food was delicious, my favorite was the lasagna that we had ordered and shared, family style dishes! We also received complimentary breadsticks, but was a little taken back that it came in a paper bag, not sure if that actually is better for the bread than the usual baskets. Anyways, our server, Adam, was amazing and a super sweet guy.  We also ended the night with dessert, Zeppole, I think it was. Baby doughnuts with Spumoni gelato and whip cream to top it off. Omg! One of the best desserts I have ever eaten! In the end, my mom enjoyed her birthday dinner and we had a great experience in both service and in food. Would definitely come back!

Sfb_8lxi5n6jGFzlnX6e8g.text: Ok we usually are not disappointed when we visit Ventano's. Tonite they were off their game. The $40 prime rib left a lot to be desired for the price. It came with either Caesar or wedge salad, corn on the cob, baked potato and shrimp. Prime rib covered in gravy (au jus maybe.. Not gravy please), corn was not sweet so sent it back but it was still old and flavorless, potato ok.  Now for $40 bucks you'd think at least jumbo shrimp. These may have been before they were cooked down to a shrunken over done, dry, swimming in gravy sz 40. The service was still on point. All servers were very pleasant and accommodating. My daughter liked her side of risotto. (They could have made it smaller since it was a side) and less pricey. And, the shrimp on the stone was as tasty as ever. We'll return but next time will ask more question..$..presentation.. Temp on the shrimp.

EVv4NGzkIR3LB5YafJx4AQ.text: I've reviewed this restaurant before and this note is to update my already high regard for this place. I held a memorial dinner for my father here 10/2014 and it couldn't have gone better. My wife and I told them what we wanted and Michael the manager handled every detail perfectly. We held it in their private room and everything went smoothly from drinks to dessert. I just want to say thanks Ventanos for helping make a very difficult time a little easier.

8yog2mldqryFo_uwPOFz3w.text: Excellent!  Nice atmosphere, outstanding customer service. I had 1/2 plate of chicken Saltimbuca and shrimp scampi. Wonderful flavors.  We also had the bucatini pasta with sausage. Again another winner. You can taste the fresh ingredients and spices. The bread is freshly made too. I highly recommend this place.

8Vg5ZtZq52Q_AdaR9rrs3A.text: I'm always in favor of Italian food when I go out on a date. I already had high expectations and they were exceeded. Food was so good I savored every bite. The service was excellent and the server, Carlos, could not have done a better job. Will always be back.

Sjelyp2WBxHkkoPQNRFSrg.text: I called this restaurant and asked what time I could come purchase a gift card the next day for my boss.  I drove 45 minutes to get there the next day and arrived at the time I was told.  They told me they were busy and to come back later.  I was late to my office party and gift exchange because of this. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE especially during the holidays when we ALL are busy!!

O_kan6r09bhV73voDwKqHw.text: Absolutely love this restaurant! Went their for the first time last week. I had the Linguini with clams and my wife had the Spaghetti Carbonara. Both were absolutely delicious. Can't wait to go back and try something different.

VY4v82DWOKkgZ9g1PZo5DQ.text: I feel like i have a brick in my stomach, and i ate less than half my entree.   With such rave reviews i was bound to find myself here eventually. Unfortunately, this was a case of me reading the wrong reviews obviously. From the photos you would think that the dining room is nice, which it's not really. Very dated, and in need of a bit of restyle for the price of the menu. The view is worthwhile, but you need to dim the lighting in the dining room so there isn't so much of a glare and you can actually see the view better. Service was in a word, sloppy. When I was seated the salt/pepper and other items on the table were a bit thrown around because i chose to sat facing the view. My waiters shirt was about 4 sizes too big for him and looked very untidy. And when the waiter mentioned he would return with bread sticks to the table, he never did. All small items but at the cost of the menu, i would expect more. I ordered the Carbonara $21, and it was incredibly heavy with way too much cheese and just felt a mess when eating. I could only stomach about a 1/3 of it and asked for a box for the rest which actually was tossed on my way out the door as i knew i wouldn't eat it later. Never again, and i hope i can save others who are looking for a quality Italian meal.   If you are looking for a HUGE portion, with very heavy food, with a very mediocre ambiance and service then this is your spot. A tip for anyone who likes a good Carbonara like myself, try Otto at the Venetian $22 and its quite delicious with top service and a great atmosphere.

g4SG7Z-b9Ci59edMy8lR5g.text: The food wasnt bad once it got to us. We came in at lunch time and there was only 2 customers. Took 25 minutes to get our drinks. Bread came and waiter said he will be right back with oil and vinegar. Never came back. Food came 50 min later. Waited over 20 min to get ice tea refilled. I will not be a repeat customer unfortunately.

8OYe-Jox3EMtW8bnBnG7-A.text: Went for a mid-afternoon lunch on a Thursday - really quiet time.  Staff and service were excellent and the food was fabulous.  I'm Sicilian and, at least according to my family and friends, a really good Italian cook.  The food here all tasted home made - like I would make it myself.  I do not like over-sauced, red-checked tablecloth, Italian-style food.  This was fine cooking.  Plus, the place is quiet, pretty and anyplace that has a sign in the front advising people to keep their children seated is A-1 in my book.

ZYNr_yFNi-RIv-szm1bBpw.text: Just celebrated our 39th wedding anniversary there. I wish I could say the food was Awesome but it is just "OK" in fact maybe not even OK? just acceptable. I gotta be honest. The reason for the 5 stars is they were good enough to surprise our small party of 5 with a great desert cake with Happy Anniversary written on the platter!! Great surprise. Ironically We also spent or 38th anniversary there as well. Serice was phenomenal.  Thanks for your help making our night wonderful

I2H0D2wrMW1BUkgqPrGZVA.text: Excellent food, great location with view of the strip. Lived in GV for several years have never visited until now. What the heck was wrong with me?! Our server , Austin, very knowledgeable and passionate about service, made our meal that more enjoyable. We dug in to our entrees before we could snap a pic,  sorry. We had the rib eye special,  excellent and the Boccatini (sp?) also, very good, large portion . Thank you,  will definately return!@

60mMINGgoeiHI7kZXo2ZYA.text: Ventano lives up to their top notch reputation. The atmosphere is exceptional. Waiters are simply outstanding; especially Carlos, Marcos, and the beautiful Hostess. We give this restaurant 5rating. We have been telling our family & friends Ventano is the place to go when you want great Italian food, and no pressure just relax the ambience... Thank you Ventano !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Good wine

fpjeup4GZFUJcWmQbeVo6Q.text: We went to Ventano early for lunch on a Monday, around 11:30.  We were the only people in the dining room, but another table sat down after about 10 minutes.  The server approached us after a few minutes, which is understandable as they were getting ready for the day.  She brought us drinks immediately and we didn't have to wait thereafter for refills.  To start, we tried the grilled shrimp on a stone.  This was a LOT of the small rock shrimp on a hot stone.  I was worried when I saw it was the rock shrimp, as those can easily be overcooked and rubbery.  But, these were fantastic.  Loads of garlic and very tender.  It comes with 2 sauces, a wasabi sauce and a sweeter type sauce.  The wasabi was definitely the winner, had just enough kick without being overpowering.  This was a very good appetizer, lots of food and quality.  Recommended.  To eat, I had the chicken spiednini, which is thin chicken cutlets rolled with cheese then fried.  The lunch portion is 3 pieces and comes with your choice of pasta.  I liked the dish, but it was dry in spots.  The sauce was very simple, heavy on tomato flavor.  It was not as strong as the appetizer.  The wife had clam chowder with caprese salad.  The clam chowder was fantastic, thick and hearty with good clam flavor.  The caprese was average, the balsamic was solid.  The tomatoes were not very juicy, but the cheese was of good quality.    We will definitely return, it was a great lunch with excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Veal saltimbocca with angel hair instead of potatoes.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled shrimp on a stone with 2 dipping sauces.

O6vfJVbjSa2qbOQyEHcnOA.text: The food was fine. Unremarkable, but fine. What drove me to write this review was the astonishingly bad service. Our waiter, Adam, did not ask how our salads were. He did not ask how our food was. He did not ask if we wanted more to drink (we had to flag down a busboy for that). He did not ask if we wanted a check. In fact, after he took our orders he  never came back by our table. It was almost funny--he would pass within inches of our table without acknowledging us. I was out of soda for 10 minutes before my grandparents asked a busboy for help.   Given the cost of the meal and the quality of the food, this restaurant can't afford to have such terrible service.

Is9i1KPgzH0jtNc8HKJAgw.text: If you want a place with great food, service, and a beautiful view of Las Vegas at night, this is the place. I was looking for seafood and was informed by Adam of the daily orange roughy special with scallops. It was probably the best roughy and scallops I've had since dining on the east coast near sea ports.  For an appetizer, I had the calamari. It was good, but I've had better. Next time I will pick a different appetizer as they offer many. I had the cannoli's for dessert. The filling is made in the restaurant, and it is very good.   They have an extensive wine menu too! I had a glass of Chardonnay for $9.00, and I thought it was a decent pour for that price.    Adam offered exceptional service, and I really appreciate when servers take the time to pack my left overs instead of placing a to-go box on the table. Thanks Adam!   The restaurant has a bar with televisions, a separate room for social functions, and outdoor seating. The entree items are between $25-$30.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Cannoli&#39;s
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Orange Roughy w/ Scallops

rMSb9heO8xkdGfxhGtSYeQ.text: Italian is always a good choice in my book. My friend and I stumbled upon this place one day when venturing out for ice cream and decided to give it a try. The first time we went we went during lunch hours. Their lunch menu is definitely significantly smaller than their full dinner menu. But, you will still be able to find something you will enjoy.   The second time we went was for dinner and I definitely enjoyed the wider variety of options. As for their dishes, I feel like they're hit or miss. The lasagna was amazing and I will probably get it time and time again when we go back. There were a few appetizers I didn't love, but that won't stop me from going back and trying out a few more options on the menu. Their tiramisu is AMAZING!   I've had great service when there. The wait staff is personable and friendly with their patrons and I really appreciated that.   The best part about this place? The view!! Definitely one of the best restaurants with the best view of the strip. I can't wait to go back when the heat calms down a little bit and sit on the back porch outdoor seating they offer. I can imagine a wonderful sunset dinner happening at Ventano. The vibes this venue offers are definitely adaptive. This place would be great for a romantic dinner for two, but it could also be wonderful for a family night out. I will definitely be classing it up with my girlfriends one evening for a special occasion. All are welcome and all will feel welcome when eating at Ventano.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Classic Lasagna and it was uh-maze-ing
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. White sangria
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Gnocchi with pesto

q0kF7IIWQ-6v0xNs2NnoFQ.text: Hidden Gem for sure! Food and service is pretty amazing! Plus it's a nice little joint over looking all of the strip! Next time we're going to request terrace seating!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Ventano Tortellini
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Fish Special!
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Caramel Pecan Ice Cream Cake (Banana Foster)

rQSblCb-_ruHne8bghVuzQ.text: Food was tasty and had a nice selection (vegetarian). It was busy and Im assuming it was a short staffed night because we had three different people helping us throughout the meal to make sure we weren't forgotten which was nice. The food came out quick and was yummy (2 toretellinis one with pesto one with pink sauce) as well as the fresh bread. We also got a cream brulee for dessert!  Coffee liquor drink was also strong!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Creme brûlée

-ekZTZvfPJ-AQHn-T2ukuA.text: Visited for a going away last dinner for our neighbor & friend, a career Elvis impersonator. His selection of the restaurant. We had shrimp on a stone & lamb chops for apps. Both were exceptional. Entrees were crab stuffed mahi mahi with risotto & veggies, shrimp & scallops with sun dried tomatoes & a garlic cream sauce over angel hair pasta. Accompanied by a bottle of house Cabernet. All were outstanding. Cabernet was reasonable, $35 for full bottle. Entrees were $30 & $35. Very reasonable for high quality food & drink. Top notch service & phenomenal view. I highly recommend you dine here, a great culinary delight, worthy of the price. Will definitely be returning, this is the kind of spot I would bring my out of town guests. Ambiance & view were stunning. For those that say it's a little outdated, I'm not sure we were at the same establishment. Loved it.

5lYgX-uocvxyhp8ekEyNuA.text: Definitely check this place out.  Come here for a romantic date, as the view and the ambiance is fantastic.  Come here for a casual lunch and you will be greeted with attentive staff in an uncrowded restaurant.  Come here for a celebration and live up the night.  Whatever the reason you come here, you will enjoy yourself.  The food is great.  I usually only come here for lunch and I have tried many thing but I cannot get over how good their ceasar salmon sandwich is.  I get it almost every time now after being introduced to it awhile ago.  Prices have gone up a few times over the last year or so but I still think it is worth it.  Go to appetizer for myself and pretty much anybody else who goes into the restaurant is the shrimp on the stone.  Try it.

DgQUhpCqbN9UpEzPU-CwGw.text: Beautiful view and great service.. all of the people working that we came across were exceptionally professional and kind. The calamari was fantastic. The maranara sauce was great as well.

0O43Z5cq2b_unJa3pxttMQ.text: Save your money, I'm not Italian  but my husband is and I grew up on my neighbor's  Slciilian food.  I resent spending $14 and up for pasta covered with tomato sauce from a can Sure the place has a nice Italain vibe, the coffee was good and our waiter was nice, but the 2 times we tried it, it fell far short of being a place I would return to and I definitely would never recommend !  I certainly would never take my mother in law there!

om8oqYESdyddOnU0F__X0A.text: The Calamari is my favorite. They really won't serve it if it isn't pass their expectations. My daughter loves their pizza from the kids menu. Keep in mind it's like a small family pizza portion. Love the atmosphere as well we always ask to have a seat outside on the patio you get a nice overlook of the Las Vegas Strip and our neighborhood.

JGZSxMuDVEBFN4gPpU0RWQ.text: I got food poisoning from the lamb chops.   I'm sure other people will have a great time here, my experience was just unfortunate.  It's a beautiful place, the staff are nice, the food smelled amazing, it was just bad timing I guess.

ABsJVBu8GqpGrVTXj6yffQ.text: Really great Italian restaurant.   Traditional with very good food.  They have a huge menu.  The Lobster Bisque is yummy.  Their bread is amazing.  Good pastas.  Good Eggplant Parmigiana.  Good salads.  Good calamari.  Traditional Italian and Italian-American food.  Like, very "this was made in grandma's kitchen" kind of place.   Good restaurant.  Oh and super nice owners and servers. I always go with my parents when I go to visit them.  We're sort of "regulars" there.  Well my parents are--me only a few times a year.   Fairly decent prices.  Everything is expensive these days so relatively I think they're way better than average.   Mmmm.  Now I want their Lobster Bisque.

oyHtzKnykQzbgrw-L7CNlQ.text: It's been a while since we've eaten here.  Met another couple for lunch today.  Lunch prices could be better, but they're not outrageous.  Service was excellent but it should be -- there were very few customers.  I do hope the lunch trade is normally busier than today.  Now that I've had lunch here, I'd like to do so more often.  My Chicken Picatta was VERY good; much better than Buon Gusto's.  It comes with Linguini Picatta; perfect combination.  My husband enjoyed his Sausage & Peppers Wrap and he was pleased that the French Fries were crispy.  He was only able to eat half of his wrap and not all of the Fries.  I wasn't able to finish my lunch, either.  My friends, who dine at Ventano more often, knew to split a sandwich.  They started with a mushroom appetizer which was very tasty.  They shared that with the table.  The restaurant provides soft breaksticks with oil and Balsamic vinegar.  Our friends then had Ventano's special slaw and a sandwich which, as I said, they split.  It was the perfect amount of food for two seniors.  I'll keep that in mind going forward.  Great view.  Excellent service.  Very good food.  Not horrible prices.  Easy parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Sausage &amp; Peppers.  You can have a wrap or a traditional sandwich.  Comes with FFries.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Mushroom Appetizer -- very yummy and enough for a party of four
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Picatti with Linguini

U4hcN3Z2jKyotX0zQ3Px8A.text: This was the best recommendation one of my co-workers could have given me. Off the busy Las Vegas strip ... a must eat at. I can't say enough about the food. From the bread being hot and fresh, to the pasta having the perfect amount of sauce and seasoning. I wish i had room for dessert as I know that would be awesome too!! I even had left overs!!  Not only was the food good the service was too!! Overall a great experience and I can't wait to go back
