Wn0GyWkaVOqZHoio3SJmXQ.text: If you are in the Henderson area in Green Valley you must visit this restaurant. It has great views of the Las Vegas strip especially at night with the night atmosphere. Italian food with Great menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Spaghetti à la carbonara and eggplant Parmesan
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggplant Parmigiana and Spaghetti alla Carbonara

5U1vCgdrGJjA1SLIaycXaA.text: Pricey but so good and worth it!! The portions are really Big, enough to get full and have possibly leftovers if you like. I can't wait to go back!

IAylZN7ELVgoiho3i5hyaA.text: Never been disappointed with a visit or meal at Ventano. Service is exceptional, staff is friendly and knowledgeable about their menu, and their red wine selection pairs well well with evety dish. Marcos was at our veck and call through our entire dinner. Cannot wait to dine here again! OMG Couple having dinner on patio, pregnant girls water broke while sitting there! Their first one. Guy is a Vet, didnt have time to catch their names. Congrats!!

ZQ5ZorVwD8muL11vpw1BDQ.text: Do NOT waste your time or money here!  There are too many choices to go to eat here!  They split an entire plate of salad on my mother and my fathers beer in his salad.  They handled the situation in the worst manner possible.  There was no manager on staff and absolutely noone to try to make the situation better.  The hostess was on her phone and rolled her eyes at the situation.  How can you run a restaurant in Las Vegas like this?  Dont waste your time or money here!  You have choices..the food does not warrant the amateur service.  I'm appalled.

guf-CkHXqGAjpWP7YGLxqw.text: Love this place!  Found it by accident and decided to try it. Food was excellent as well as the service!  Family friendly and you can dress down or up! But, its also about the view!  Wow! I think when temperatures cool off a bit, the best seat would be the view from the open patio! You got to go there to see and appreciate it! Bona petit!

pjwMLBM7FXq_Xw6d8zxkcA.text: This is definitely one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas.  It's hard to beat the flavor, service and ambiance that you get here.   The location is great with views of the valley that are amazing.  Our dinner was perfect and we followed it up with some dessert.    I'll be back soon as there were so many things in the menu that I need to try.  I've also got to get back and dine outside before it starts getting to cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

-h6DJ2zMasHaC7Jx7v_rNg.text: Just returning from my visit ... sadly this restaurant has gone down greatly.  The food, the service and atmosphere have changed drastically.  The server we normally have, is gone and the manager was so unprofessional discussing the servers departure.   We decided to try one more time before we left Vegas and sadly ... food and service remains the same as our first visit.  I am hopeful the owner, whom is failing in his health will have a speedy recovery and get his once amazing restaurant back in shape.

6gVmqleFlYV1ju8pwMSwCA.text: Ok for a neighborhood restaurant. I wish I had a better experience. Servers made me feel like I was too much trouble and couldn't bother with a table for one. I wanted to sit at the bar but there are only gaming machines, also can smoke in there so not ideal if you don't smoke.  I ordered Shrimp Ventano and asked for something other than pasta be served as I don't eat gluten. They brought vegetables which was fine but I was charged for a side of vegetables without being asked or notified beforehand. This is poor customer service.  Portions are good size but overall just an okay experience.

0UxR082wG7U3ZvIOvXJ4oA.text: Let me start by saying that the food was good. The negative review is due to the service. We had a table of 4 on a Saturday afternoon at 4:30. It was not busy at that time. Our waiter introduced another person as his "helper." 3 of our 4 meals were delivered by the helper but he said nothing about the 4th meal so we assumed it was on its way. We waited a while to eat but still  nothing. The waiter never came by to see if everything looked okay. Finally, my husband walked over to our waiter (who had his face in the computer) and asked how long it takes for a bowl of spaghetti! The waiter seemed surprised that we were missing a dinner. He went into the kitchen and then came over to tell us that it would be out soon. He apologized as he should have but 3 separate times blamed the kitchen/cook. He kept saying it was on the ticket so it wasn't his fault! Guessing he was trying to protect his tip. It doesn't matter who was to blame. We were the customers and the restaurant staff is a team so the waiter needs to accept responsibility on behalf of the restaurant. He even went so far as to say, "Even though it wasn't my fault, I will be happy to buy you another glass of wine or dessert." Seriously? Nobody wanted another glass of wine or dessert but my problem is with his continuing to say it wasn't his fault. That is not how to do service recovery. He should have told the manager who should have come over personally to apologize. When the food was delivered, the "helper" should have immediately told the waiter we were missing a dinner. The waiter should have checked to see if our meals looked okay. There were so many errors along the way and had any of them not occurred, the restaurant would have recognized their error right away and could have rectified it immediately. What's more is that after the waiter kept blaming the kitchen, the missing meal came right out. It was obviously ready and just sitting somewhere in the kitchen. Too bad this place has decent food, decent ambiance and a decent view. They seem to be stuck not knowing if they want to be a finer dining restaurant, a sports bar or a lower-end chain restaurant. They definitely need customer service and service recovery training.

KJh2ZroWwZlTs1TxjzHWhQ.text: Probably some of the worst Italian food in Henderson. Decent view, but everything else stinks. It's where old people with no taste buds go.   It's completely overpriced.   Better options in this area are Bella Vita at The District, Bottiglia at Green Valley Ranch and Bravo at Galleria mall.  Whole place needs to be demolished to make room for somewhere nicer.

eWyV1e57bLWqYTPE971jWw.text: This has been my favorite Italian Restaurant in Nevada. The place is beautifully decorated having the ambiance of being in Italy . You are greeted by a pleasant and sweet host followed by the the most friendliest and accommodating General Manager.  The menu has so many delicious items to choose from and every food are cooked deliciously to your liking. Every single detail from the look, the smell and the taste were perfection. Highly recommend this place to everyone!

J_ghwU3XMnsgF92ir4XcTw.text: My go to place for great Italian.  The chicken picatta is delicious.  It says a lot about a restaurant when you crave their food.  Some would consider the service slow but it is a relaxing experience, not a turn the tables as quick as possible.

jvtUoKQf8g64oYPZtlJuTg.text: Ventano's Italian Grill is awesome! We came here with a group of friends and the food and service were great. The atmosphere is perfect for a large group of friends, families or a date night. My wife and I definitely took note of the patio and noticed that from the patio, you have a pretty good view of the strip. They have hanging white patio lights on the back patio, that give it a more intimate vibe. Everyone loved the bread and oil/vinegar and everyone loved their meals. I got the Ventano Chicken Tortellini and it was great. We will definitely be back soon!

yeUpfkMLZO0mFUPwd1DyJA.text: Always a favorite! A great Italian restaurant with amazing views of the strip. We have been spending Birthdays, graduations, testing and just because Lamp chops on the hot stone is our to go to every time. We love the saute clams, which you get almost 30 of them as an appetizer. The pasta are all delicious and the wine menu is spectacular. Everyone is so friendly, professional and accommodating. We just love this place

A11Db3fCpk3kbS13EpSPDw.text: We were recommended by a friend to come check out this restaurant. It was an amazing experience! The food is absolutely delicious, the shrimp and scallops under the specialty pasta was so delicious. Our server Alex did an amazing job recommending items from the menu. He was polite, well mannered, and super nice! He made the experience worth it.

gRXRaQncr4n4AIgJmFLK_w.text: This is an absolutely wonderful place to relax and enjoy. The view of Las Vegas strip at night beautiful. The food is always delicious and the the service is always exceptional.

5HmCF66XoHzfiKhMRWrO2Q.text: This place was amazing love, love, loved the food, very friendly, and the view of the vegas valley is beautiful!!! Can't wait to go back!!! This place will be added to one of our favorite place to go to in Henderson!!!

RqqnPEuApWnhTU1PEwGbug.text: The service was poor, the food was mediocre and the management never even apologized in person for a forgettable meal.  I recently had a meal at Ventana, the meal arrived 50 minutes after I ordered, it came prepared different than I ordered. I had to send it back 3 times to get it right. The bill came and I gave my credit card and when it came back to sign, it was not my card. I asked the server to get my card and he said the people just left. I asked him to follow them out and get my card back, he didn't. He then told me he would discount the bill by half, I asked how since my card was gone. He said he had the number, I asked for it and he said he didn't have it. I asked for the Manager who refused to come to my table and the server said he would comp the meal for loss of my card. When I got home I called the credit card company which showed the whole amount was billed.

HHtFgErrZ4FYyJAOsspXtg.text: This restaurant came highly recommended, so I came with an appetite and high expectations. The parking lot was full and the walk to the front door was all the way around on the opposite side of the parking.  An oddity, to set the evening off.   I entered and was met with a friendly greeting from the hostess.  She's seasoned and knows how to handle two guests with different needs at once.  I came alone and she invited the other party to wait for their entire party so she could seat me. I was shown a table with a "view."  Across the restaurant and out the windows, yes, one can see The Strip.  My view was of other customers who were attended to while I waited. And waited. And waited...   Yes, bread and water came relatively quickly. My order was taken after a while. After a longer while my salad came. A long time after I had finished my salad, it was removed.  And then I waited further until my overdone and very bland chicken parmesan and side of pasta arrived.  I guess what I wanted was Italian food and what I got was a step sideways from Olive Garden.    I was ignored though out the entirety of my meal except for the question of whether everything was alright as I had taken my first bite.  Once I was done, I waited, and waited, and waited.    When the waiter came by with smiles to run his script about coffee or dessert, I pointed out that a side dish was missing and that he'd have to adjust the bill.  "OK, thank you" was his reply with a big smile on his face.  I wasn't doing him a favor to tell him to correct the bill.  I was telling him he missed bringing me a portion of the meal, but no one bothered to check on me.  I corrected him, "You mean, OK, sorry," which he then echoed.    Where I was seated was at a main pass, against a serving station with a computer.  When they entered orders, I got pushed on.  When they rounded the corner, they'd slap the edge of my booth.  When they argued about who is bringing extra plates to the table with the birthday, they did so over me.  So - it's an annoying lay out with mediocre food and horrible service. I'm doing them a favor tonight by giving them two stars.  They get that because the food was hot when it came to the table.  There was no management visible and the friendly hostess didn't ask how everything was or I might have told her.  When I'm back in town, this place is off of my list.

Ryel76xqFJzW57fvwuHdyw.text: I usually don't like Italian food, but I took my wife here and let me tell you this place was not only beautiful with the amazing view but the food was delicious the staff there were very kind and friendly I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that enjoys a wonderful view while eating an amazing dinner!

fhyxI9m8tGni6UV7JGo5Ew.text: for having the same menu for as many years as advertised, This place is well exicuted and keeps the taste and look of that old school italian vegas restaurant.  Nicely done.

5v25qIRibAj0AQgLlpPC-g.text: Beautiful restaurant with a decent wine list. But only $$? I think more like $$$. $20 and up on entrees and pastas start at $19. Still well worth a great meal, but you have to deliver a great meal, and they do NOT! So it's $$ if you're splitting entres or ordering the cheapest items with no wine and up to $$$$ if you're eating an app, entree & dessert per person with one bottle of wine. The service is lacking. I hate walking into a place and getting stared at like I don't belong. As if 2 people walked into a restaurant at 6:30pm and had no idea what they were doing there. Then act like you're doing me a favor letting me eat there. Also, with the decor and prices, I do not expect the Chef/Owner to be prancing around in a filthy T-shirt that has to be years old. It's great that you want to be you, but I certainly don't want some desgraziato approaching my dinner table. Get a Chef's Coat or wear a button up with an apron over it for heaven's sake. Have some respect for people eating even if you have none for yourself. A great place is great because they make every guest feel like it's "theirs", like they're welcomed. Well here at Ventano's, you feel very much like you are in someone else's space and you are there by their grace. Cold, uninviting and borderline inhospitable.  Bruschetta, I wouldn't even call it that. It seemed more like something that would have been complimentary with a Pre Fixe. Simple diced tomato with olive oil, basil and toast points. Nothing was seasoned and the tomatos were cold and flavorless.  Baked Clams, Chunks of raw garlic in the sauce and underseasoned, but they were tender and they were littlenecks. The breadcrumbs were flavorless and it was the first time I ever sprinkled salt on clams. And this was the best dish of the meal. Thanks more to Long Island than the chef.  Fettuccine Alfredo, Bland, lumpy and seperating before our eyes. And I love when I see some noodles stuck together at one end. Nothing says the guy cooking your food cares quite like that. How hard is it to make sure noodles aren't stuck together?   Eggplant Parm,. Topped with Fresh mozz and a nice portion, but with just eggplant stacked up on top eggplant it was dry and also very Bland. For over $20, I expect some more mozz or even ricotta in the layers, but I would have been content with just sauce so it wasn't so dry.  Their Bread Service? The worst I have ever seen, inedible.

pnPR-grDolQR1tc6ZSF0dw.text: I am still on a quest to find a really great Italian restaurant in Las Vegas since I moved here 2 years ago. Sorry to say, but Ventano's isn't it! First of all, the main dining room has the ambiance of a mass eatery, noisy, and bare wooden tables. So if you'd like to have a dinner with at least some ambiance, make sure you get a table on the patio, which has a great view of the city. Staff was friendly and attentive. Now to the food: I want to start with the bread and olive oil and balsamic vinegar they bring you. The oil has absolutely no flavor and the Balsamic tasted like a red wine vinegar reduction. Basically the cheapest stuff money can buy. We started with the beef carpaccio which was actually ok. I then had the cioppino. Portion was huge, and the broth tasted ok. Good variety of sea food, calamari, clams, mussels, scallops, - but Popcorn Shrimp????? I don't mind paying $28 for a plate if the ingredients match, but I have the feeling that whoever is purchasing / cooking there has the attitude of "Nothing is too cheap for our customers"!  My wife had the veal parmigiana. Again, big portion but the veal was dry. Pasta was cooked al dente, but drenched with a bland tomato sauce that tasted like it came straight out of a can.  All in all, in my opinion, the place is just a bit above Olive Garden with twice the price. Not worth the trip.

tpzBiW42B1GJsNCLjXDVBA.text: Amazing view and food is great quality. Only thing I disliked is the dining room had this slight rotten fish dish water smell. I'm guessing because they had redone the kitchen the day before but it was really strange. The smell is most likely gone by now so I'll be returning soon!

xdrh2HBKLuAoDRVWTufuyQ.text: This place is kind of eclectic IMO. I first went here for a rehearsal dinner in their private room 2 years ago, and have been back everytime I am in Vegas. I say it's eclectic because you will see people dressed to the nines (wedding/rehearsal private parties), others dressed nice but casual (khakis and button downs), and then people - usually families with kids- dressed like they just came from off roading (shorts and t-shirts). I find this odd but in a good way because it makes you feel welcomed and relaxed no matter how you look.   The star here are the pastas. I had the Ventano oven baked dish with cheese tortellini, grilled chicken, and pink sauce and it was out of this world good. The pasta was firm yet melted in your mouth. Oh, and the salads are great too.  Service and price are a-ok and so is the parking. The scenery is pretty too.  Great place to go when you want to leave the strip!

ZxCtJTQGIIFWZSA55f7IjA.text: Set a top a beautiful hill overlooking the strip Ventanos is not just another pretty restaurant, the food is amazing to boot!!! Our new favorite place.  They have such attentive staff and I can't rave enough about their menu.  Definitely coming back.

YbAbq0to0FnrEEmiqJrvZA.text: My husband and I went to Ventano for the first time for lunch yesterday to celebrate our anniversary. We wanted to try someplace new since we tend to always go to the same places. I didn't read previous reviews but saw that it had a good rating. It was after 2 when we arrived and there were only a few other tables occupied. There was only one server and one busser working, since it was not a busy time of the day. They were both wonderful and helpful. We ordered a bottle of wine from their very extensive wine list. I ordered a white pizza with mushrooms and artichokes and my husband ordered his favorite, lasagna. They offered us bread while we waited. The atmosphere was lovely and there is a wonderful view of the strip that we look forward to enjoying when we come back at night. Our food was amazing! We thoroughly enjoyed our first time here and look forward to coming back again. The only thing I would change is to bring the bread out in something nicer than a brown paper bag.

2XBXfFVu561KgBDMtt31RQ.text: Went for a late dinner, service was very good, view spectacular but my dish was horrible.  I ordered Chicken Fettucini Alfredo.  The chicken was tough, like it had been boiled or maybe 3 days old, it was stark white with no grill marks and tasted old.  The sauce was not creamy tasting or fresh either..  The noodles were very thick.  My husband had lasagna and it wasn't too bad.  Over priced in my opinion.  This is our 3rd time to go and I've never really enjoyed it, why do they put breadsticks in a paper bag, its a beautiful restaurant, seems like they'd wrap them in a napkin and put in a basket..  Was hoping the 3rd time would be a charm but not this time...

r-0VmF1EDY1D9v8xTN0Q7Q.text: Always ask about their specials! They are amazing and always are willing to customize any dish. I can't remember the name of special#3,it was a pasta with crab, lobster, shrimp, etc. I had them sub Alfredo sauce instead of red sauce. I also had their house merlot. I am the happiest diner in town!!! Yummy!!

KkLNHmCDjaqkkCPm51JdLA.text: I love this place.  The food is always spectacular, the view is outstanding, and the staff are always friendly and warm.   They are on top of their service, whether it's keeping your glass filled or clearing the table.  We never feel rushed to finish and get out the door either.  Our favorite restaurant in the valley!

z51ktQwOfSlh-XF3KAvo0Q.text: Clearly one of the best Italian Restaurants in Nevada. Very authentic most of the food is made from scratch. I have had several different entrees and always have food to take home. The service is excellent. The atmosphere very comfortable with a nice view.

jdtTtr_TzQc2FVwww0sugQ.text: The server named Mike and another young man sever and busser helped me set up my dad's birthday last minute.  Amazing! You guys really made this a breeze. It meant everything to us to give him a great birthday because it's our first without mom. Because of you guys I will rant about this place and definitely come back. Your food was delicious! Thank you guys

a-YkZQMg2X4kF7K8PC2bnQ.text: One of the best Italian restaurants around!! If your looking for authentic Italian look no further;)

5xhnC1S_h453LPN-QIwfgw.text: Ventano sounds like your cool Italian cousin from back east that make a mean ravaoli! Well, that is not to far off for this place. Ventano's is located in the heart of Henderson and overlooks beautiful Las Vegas. One of the prettiest views in the city. Great place for a romantic dinner for too or to enjoy the company of good friends.   Pros: The atmosphere is very relaxing with a beautiful Italian / Tuscan feel with amazing views of the strip.   The service is always great and everyone is extremely friendly.  The food is always good and they serve good size portions so you should not ever leave hungry.  Cons: They bring a credit card machine to your table after your meal and do the transaction right there. I HATE this! You feel pressure to tip in front of your server. I just think it makes for an uncomforatble feel and they should consider just taking your check, running your card and letting you fill it out like most places. In fact, we have not gone here because we do not like to end the meal with this weird machine and our server staring us down. Not that our service has not ever been less than great, it is just a weird feeling.  All in all though, its a nice place. If you want to avoid the awkward pay at the  end... just bring cash :)

H3WkM8BCjZFGL_qfK1AmLw.text: I took my dad and husband here for Father's Day for dinner. Fabulous food and service! Everyone's dish was flavorful; and the portions were generous. We will be back soon!

sWObjIQ6w2opGGvxHzo5SA.text: Food was great service was great  the ambiance was very romantic and intimate. Though I took my wife on her birthday , an she was craving the stuffed mushroom caps, an the waiter came back to our table am told us they ran out of mushrooms so we didn't get s full order. He said they were going to comp them. An we got charged full price for a half serving of them.. other than that it was a good experience

6KxQSXKe2iE_slICPcNu0g.text: I'm giving this place 3 stars because the waiters did try and the food wasn't too bad. The hosts were okay but the gentleman working the night we went seemed aggressive which can come off as rude if he isn't careful with how he says things. When my family and I sat down the server was very friendly and immediately asked for our drink orders. We soon received our drinks and breadsticks. The breadsticks are delicious!! Or we were just hungry, either way we wanted more and it took 3 different servers to say "okay I'll bring that right over".. They were busy so maybe thats why it took so long which we can understand.   A server brought over my son's food and dropped a chicken finger thinking we didn't notice. Because it was my birthday I didn't want to worry to much about that and just let it slide. I don't know if he even picked it up or not.  I ordered the Manicotti which was as expected, a delicious cheesy mess that I haven't had in years with a side of steamed veggies. The steamed veggies tasted like they were boiled in seafood water and I couldn't finish them because the taste it left in my mouth was gross.   My boyfriend ordered the Linguini with Clams which he had to dig out the clams from the shells which sucked for him as it took him forever and I understand where they are going with that dish because it looked fancy. My daughter ordered a mac n cheese which was tiny and her being a kid assumed it would be large. If you have children over 9 years old the mac and cheese is not large enough for them. I shared my Manicotti with her.   Upon us waiting for the check it took forever so we just walked to the front where the hosts were and then our server noticed our table was empty and caught up to us. There was no have a goodnight or farwell so to us that was a common thing that sucks in restaurants today. Sadly we won't be returning, we'll stick to Brio at Town Square because it's very good and the customer service is on point.

NWaYqeG8a5Y6Byq756rH-A.text: The service was on point. Two servers per table at lunch was a plus properly attired and more importantly were polite.  Atmosphere was casual and the property was clean. The pasta.selection was above average and the wine selection was extensive. Of course I hit the dessert though I was already full.

s4ENLznk64YsPhjomO5jlg.text: What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said?  The food is great and the service is top notch.  A little on the pricey side but you get what you pay for.    I stopped in with a friend after getting pedicures and working up an appetite shopping.  We had calamari and a side of meatballs for appetizers which were both delicious.  Oh and the bread sticks were outstanding! Now I know where olive garden got their idea, ha ha.   For dinner we split a steak special which was a 16 oz steak with a rosemary demi glaze (((are you drooling yet?))) served with a side of shrimp,  roasted potatoes and your choice of either green beans or brussel sprouts. We had all of the above and none of the items disappointed.     We didn't have room for dessert and ended up taking home a ton of food but it was all amazing.

Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Meatball
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Calamari

p8L_bPCn9mU7dJYanO_MEw.text: We come here at least twice a month, and are always treated well.  Tonight we came in, and there were only two other couples in the dining area.  Apparently, the wait staff was more interested in setting up for a large party than waiting on us.  After 15 minutes waiting for any type of acknowledgement, we left.  Probably won't be back for a while.  Not a good way to treat customers, especially regulars who have been there at least 15 times this year.

LPJ0EmkSyes3dmFYE3TBpg.text: This has been a go to of ours since we moved here in 04. Food is always good and many choices. Last night the service was way off. If not for the "bus" staff and the food runner we would have left. Saw our waiter twice once when he took our order and the second time he came back because he forgot our order. Rest of the meal he never stopped back to check on things, worry about refills or anything else. He never even stopped back for the bill had to track down some one else for that. If not for the food being exceptional I would not go back.

g3hcM6U2n4HVgy0e3sF9Hg.text: Marcos was a great server. A buddy of mine recommended this place what a great view from the patio the bread was super fresh and delicious and my past it was amazing I just moved to Vegas three months ago I will definitely be back I live on the strip but this was worth the drive  Went back today a month later and it was amazing again.  LALO was a great server

_37zExpzo53HnuoqZudoew.text: Absolutely amazing Italian food and specialties.  Great service as well.  The GM, Mike, really takes care of his guests.

_T2Pf16i4bBdnk-TYWZJIw.text: Unfortunately, the only good things I can say about this spot is that they have potential for a good view and the location is near home. I see how crowded this spot gets on Friday and Saturday nights and assumed it was worth visiting.  My husband and I ate here for lunch on a Saturday. The oil and vinegar for dipping bread was the first thing I didn't enjoy. In full disclosure I am an olive oil and balsamic vinegar snob. They are foods that I can't enjoy if it's low quality or obviously cheap. The vinegar was also not a high quality balsamic. You can tell if it has that overly vinegary smell and odd after taste.  My husband had pizza and I had pasta. There was nothing noteworthy or tasty about either dish. We each had about two bites of our lunch before we commented to each other that this spot wouldn't be worth visiting again. Maybe we caught them on an off afternoon, but our experience didn't help us understand why anyone eats here.

8_nE1Sit5vDJQyqSmoTBLA.text: This my family's home away from home. We are original NY'ers and have lived in Henderson for 12 yrs now, and have been fallen in love with Ventano's before we had even moved here thanks to our realtor. Their food, hospitality, ambiance, loyal staff members, are a staple in our lives.  Arnauld , the owner, his family and amazing staff, have all made every occasion and every out of the blue dinner, a special occasion for all of us. The food is exactly what we had left behind in NY, and when "experimenting", usually due to hunger pains and impatience, we've "joyfully" been disappointed, and make a plan for Ventano's the following night for redemption.  Their family has become apart of our family, and we're blessed to have their paths connected to ours

7RLM45VtfZfOuSS9uV4Reg.text: Best place to go on a date, host a company party, and celebrate New Year's! The food is beyond perfection, the ambiance is romantic, but the views will take your breath away. The main dining room gives you a full view of the strip. We have celebrated New Years for the past few years here and it is always a fun and enjoyable night to remember. They surely know how to host a fun party! They are open really late hours too so you can stop in after a late movie and eat at the bar. We love this place!

W6iWAQjWFcJHCX5gQ77D_A.text: I initially was not in love with this place. Now I am a regular, and am curious what happened on my first visit to make me give them only 3 stars.  Pretty sure they know my order by heart. Shrimp on a stone blackened, risotto, or fish as an entree, and a glass of Chianti, or a bottle of Riesling. Depends on the mood, but I usually stick to those items. All of the risottos are great so don't bother asking me my favorite. The shrimp on a stone, gets the table next to us asking their server, "what is that?!" EVERY SINGLE TIME! You can hear it sizzling before it gets to your table, and there is quite the lingering aroma once its in your presence.  I have always have pretty good service. A longer wait one time when I went with a group, but the food was worth it.  A perfect date night, as it has an amazing city view. Also good for large groups, or beautiful outdoor dining.  They are family oriented so just because its perfect for date night, does not mean you cant bring the kiddos.

ocr5ALEq9l5Z1B493UZ-WQ.text: Came here late Monday night 4am ish sign says open 24 hrs. lights were on walked in to bar area and no one was around waited a few minutes and 2 guys came out of the bathroom smoking cigarettes one was apparently the bartender, he was obviously drunk or on something. I turned around and left because the whole situation was awkward.

dxBFtI_Non5UIfkFAz2LoQ.text: Ventano's not like it was when we moved here in 2004. Were always pleased with the food and service. After having not been there in a few years, we returned on Sat. Service very spotty. Food was horrible. Egg Plant Parmesan mushy and tasteless. Rigatoni Parmegano was beyond bad, no flavor, no distinguishable sauce and pasta over cooked.

Bmu-QNxRS5LnPgG_6VD-Zw.text: We came here on a Saturday night with 8 PM reservations and requested a table on the patio with the restaurant almost at full capacity. They did have a table available and we enjoyed a nice dinner with the well documented view of the Valley.  I was pleased that they carried Left Hand Brewing's Wake Up Dead Imperial Stout which was a great paring with the dozen oysters ($23) we had for appetizer. It's frustrating when other restaurants that serve oysters don't offer any kind of stout. It's a classic and obvious pairing to me.  For entrees, I had the pan seared mahi mahi ($38) special being offered that night which was accompanied with a vegetable risotto, seared scallops, and a crab cake. The Mahi Mahi was cooked slightly over, otherwise it was a flavorful seafood combination. My wife enjoyed her chicken saltimbocca ($28) with sauteed spinach and roasted potatoes. For dessert, we had the recommended caramel pecan ice cream cake bananas foster ($7) by our server Carlos. This was a nice, sweet finale contrasting our savory entrees. An absence of photos was due to the patio being lit dimly with a relaxed ambiance. I didn't want to be "that guy" disturbing everyone with a flash firing through the dining area.  Service was more than adequate with an extended delay waiting for entrees being the only snag. Although I did provide Carlos some income for the evening with our tip, I am certainly not his "boss." In the setting we were in, for him to repeatedly refer to me using that term, didn't really rub me the right way. Overall though, a great meal and there is no reason why we won't be back.

9WlKfoCGke-fbB2KCHkWnQ.text: If looking for a great italian restaurant outside the las vegas strip and hotels? Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood is one of the best options in Vegas. You will be surprise but at night the view of the Valley is pretty cool from anywhere in the dining room. If you really want make it romantic and embrace the view they have patio area outside that you can dine. I have been here few times for dinner and other times just hanging out at the bar drinking talking stories with my roommate. Another five star point I really like fact the restaurant has been there for years and has lot of old school Vegas nostalgia. Rat Pack. Italian mobsters/Italian restaurants. Lol! The dining room is in no way run down it very modern and even the bar area. The bar area with all the booths, the bar counter, and feels old school to me. The bartenders are awesome. Richard is one of the best bartenders in Vegas. Friendly and if your endurance junky the guy can talk stories with you all night. Also learn few training tips along the way. Just like the servers everyone is very attentive too your needs, never empty glass, and makes ones dining experience great one.   My last visit had the spaghetti bolognese. Awesome. It was nice hearty. The tomato sauce was delicious.What I like the most was the balance between both!!! Nothing worst then have overload of meat or sauce. It was tasty till the last noodle. I have tried the grilled shrimp and scallop on the hot plate. I love the presentation on both. Different. Thinking just shrimp or scallop on hot plate. Both well seasoned and once add fresh lemon juice very much refreshing light dish.   I feel most of the menu is reasonable price. Not doubt cheaper then going to Italian restaurant on the stip. Just wish not on the opposite side of town so could stop by more often. If am on that side of town. Ventano spot would hit up in heartbeat get my italian food on!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Spaghetti Alla Bolognese

0hQ25dnwcNGmOJ1W67hWlw.text: Family of 5 screaming children for 3 hours. Absolutely insane. Nice staff, but really - too nice. I understand the family might need a warm roof to be under. The restaurant politely asked the family to move and they declined. Hostess said families always come in and milk them like that. Time for management to take control of their establishment.

Qf3Zm2Mvj3HMUdCgTUU8tQ.text: I think you have one of the most beautiful views in this city, hands down! Gorgeous decor, amazing staff. New Years for me was a lot of fun but I will say lol being vegan has its challenges, and part of my experience was to see how you guys would manipulate my dinner, thank you for all the effort.. I will say lol... sliced strawberries for dessert? Setting a banana on fire with rum would make sense...I'm not so sure that 109 plus tax, given that I had absolutely no meat, was fair. Anyway! Thank you! And I am thankful for a full tummy for a new year.

BOk1MQ1TuK9pxrFBiCYYwA.text: A full room on a Saturday night after all these years goes to show they're in touch with their customers. Great location, great food, and no complaints on the service. They were very flexible and accommodating. Keep it up.   Suggest making reservations if your thinking about visiting on a Saturday night.

uc2jr7gPZ4rQWbusLInA0g.text: I visited here twice  Great rice balls and a quiet location off strip  But it's not the best Italian.  But it's ok.   Service is as expected, parking not an issue  Never ate here on a busy night.

i2MuRG3OVILZpoEx6JO6AQ.text: Really LOVE the views here! Unbeatable. Indoor and outdoor seating with great service!   Ima real fan of the Ceasar Salad.  Ill be back!!

MMqtc4LRFkWXT6eGTrMtYw.text: Second time here more of the same. Slow service on a Tuesday nite with only one other table on the veranda. My wife ordered rack of lamb MEDIUM.  It came out rare! Waste of money and the only good thing is the fabulous view of the Strip!  Second disappointing time here and our last!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Rare instead of medium! They didn&#39;t seem to care either!

x3JZeE4COPmlKy6NxepzmA.text: Great food, amazing views and excellent service. So happy to find great Italian on our side of town.   Our server Carlos and his support staff made our visit a memorable experience.   Try the Caesar salad with shrimp (small ones), perfect cook and seasoning on the shrimp.   Pastas and sauces were all delicious, can't go wrong with the meatballs.   Get the cheesecake to pacify your sweet tooth.

SxvNd9f7lDRwnj8UuDSYjg.text: It's been a years since I've been, but didn't have any complaints when I went. Will update review when I go again.

MJ3gbDVhzx9477W9ieEteg.text: I didn't even get to take photos of the food because that is how amazing this place is.   A friend of mine recommended, excuse me, highly recommended this place. She couldn't stop raving & me & my other two friends were sold on it. We headed over to the restaurant and the rest is history.   Aldo, our server was incredible. Knowledgeable, professional, sincere, & genuine we could not have been happier with their service.  What an amazing menu. It wasn't too big & had just the right amount of choices to choose from. I let my friend do the ordering & this was her favorite restaurant & is never disappointed.   Shrimp Llamb on a Stone Caesar Salad Cioppino (without the pasta)  Now here is the clincher. I mean how much better can it get you might be asking. Well add to this outstanding experience, one of the the most perfect views in all of Vegas. Coming from Florida you think when someone says to you that you think what the heck do you mean view. It's not like you are on the ocean. Well take a look at the photo I was able to take of the view. It doesn't really do it justice. Hopefully you can appreciate it.   PS I found out the bar area is open 24/7 and does a have late night/bar menu. I do not know the times or how much of the original it consists of.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Spectacular View. Make sure you come at Sunset

2dA7Vhen4JPKk14t3Hcqlg.text: Been coming here before the houses around it were being built. Glad to see that front area still open to allow for Strip city views.  In and outdoor seating, with bar seating. There is also a separate enclosed bar w/gambling ti the right if the host station.  The hot breadsticks presented in a brown paper bag is always something to look forward to. Its served with evoo and balsamic. Got the hot stone shrimp, shareable morsels w/dipping sauces. The Jam red wine went down easy. The lobster ravioli and cajun shrimp in pink sauce was lovely.  Attentive service. Enjoyed my lunch here, as usual.

iTsj-qCZyU2uFE6ARUxsyQ.text: Excellent location and the strip is a longshot nice view past the parking lot. The restaurant has a nice warm feeling however the food is served on out dated plates... similar to my grandmothers china. Presentation of food very basic.   This may be great for sensitive digestive systems. Salmon was not seasoned,very simple preparation.  The bread comes fresh from the oven in a brown paper bag...it's a highlight w/ vinegar and oil that's served.  Our table Enjoyed the bread maybe a little too long as the entree was delivered quite late in the evening and the restaurant was not busy on a Wednesday.   Proportion or modest.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Salmon, zucchini and half tomato

26fmosGq4crKk_Pm0RzcCw.text: This place was a homerun for us. Luscious beautiful Italian affair made with excellence and care. The presentation was amazing. But I absolutely loved the service.  Danielle was very attentive and even gave us extra bread and vinegar and oil upon request. I had the shrimp carbonara which was amazing cooked perfectly and my family each enjoy their dishes as well. Danielle was very attentive and even gave us extra bread and vinegar and oil upon request. I had the shrimp carbonara which was amazing cooked perfectly and my family each enjoyed their dishes as well. Again, great retreat from the busy Vegas trip and excellent quality. Relaxed casual elegant atmosphere and a beautiful view of Love the mountains and the sunset. It made for a perfect evening with the family.  You must come here if you're visiting Vegas. Hendersonville is a great jewel!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Shrimp on the Stone Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Beautiful Decour here. The bar is gorgeous and overlooks the kitchen area.

5Z2-Y_CwWoJmQAVjWpg8lg.text: My expectations were high since the restaurant seems to be busy most times I drive by. We decided to dine at Ventano before a concert at Green Valley Casino. I ordered linguine with clams in a clear broth. Very tasty.  My hubby ordered Veal Parmesan. He did not like it because it lacked flavor. We also shared a Caesar Salad. Mediocre, dressing was sour. I wonder why restaurants are ok serving average food. Where is the pride and passion?  Too bad. We won't be going back

H9jd1aBzV9pOqZCT-t7JXA.text: Seriously the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to.  I was seated in a booth by the window and the view of the strip was so beautiful.  The service is impeccable and the food tastes amazing!  The owner/chef came out to our table after we received our food to make sure everything tasted well.  By far the best experience I've had at a restaurant.  100% recommend eating at this Italian restaurant.

NYUfEiBnACsEW_u58MyrtA.text: We have dined at Ventanos many time. Last night, we had cappuccinos while we ate the antipasti platter. At this time, Marcos brought us a bootle if cab sav (Joel Gott) and let it breath. We then split the Gnocchi Con Pesto and the chicken vesuvio. So good. Ventanos is always good time. Fantastic view of the strip and a spacious dining room. See you sion  6/22/19  We are back. Early dinner. We had the entire dinning room to ourselves. Don't get me wrong. This place is usually paced but we came in after lunch and before dinner.   Sergio set us up with water, bread and the lovely oil and balsamic (which is really hard not to fill up on).   Adam told us that our favorite wine wasn't available and suggested a less expensive bottle. Looks like we have a new fav. So yummy. As always, we ordered too much but that means LEFTOVERS.  The chicken parm is my fav and never disappoints. Debbie had the special, haddock, crab, and scallops. Soooooo good.   We do come here a lot. Never had a bad experience. Thank you Adam and Sergio for making an ordinary Saturday feel special.

Xdnm1x64BDF1-4j6ip5G1w.text: I have an 80 year old grandmother.   I cancelled my Christmas reservation and asked if they would accommodate a pick up order to make things easier for everyone involved.   Ventano told me they would accept pick up orders before 3pm.  I call prior to 3pm to place pick up order to feed her at the house and they decided last minute to not do pick up orders.   Thanks for messing up my Christmas dinner plans for my 80 year old grandmother.   I'm now trying to scrounge to find another restaurant to pick up food for her last minute.   This restaurant will never get my business again.

Qzr3RnO0tl5RrBgiDgFfMQ.text: 3.5 rounded up Fine dining atmosphere at an affordable price is hard to come by in Vegas, but we found just that at Ventano's in Henderson. The panoramic view of Vegas at night was just beautiful! We felt a bit out of place upon walking in at first because it looked so fancy and their servers were all in tuxes (this Hawaii girl was wearing slippahs, oh heyyyy!), but we immediately felt at ease when our friendly server Austin greeted us with a sweet smile and whisked us away to our table. After looking around, we noticed everyone is is dressed casually as well, phew! Everyone was as professional and attentive as can be, but still very approachable and friendly. CALAMARI FRITTI ($12.50): bit.ly/2yX57JE You know you got it made when your plate of calamari comes with more tentacles than rings. - Tender squid fried in a thin crispy batter. However, it was unseasoned, salting it immediately out of the fryer would've helped immensely. - The homemade spicy marinara wasn't spicy and could've used some salt as well. SIDE OF MEATBALLS (3pc for $6): bit.ly/2qBYW9q - Juicy tender meatballs the size of my fist, they sure don't skimp on portion sizes here. Very meaty and not a lot of fillers, I likey. - The meat sauce was like crack. Delicious. We were using that flavorful meat sauce as our dipping sauce for the calamari. VEAL PROSCIUTTO with linguini ($27): bit.ly/2SWy3JZ - The veal was perfectly cooked and the pasta was al dente. - There was just a single slice of prosciutto thrown on top of my veal. I'm used to seeing the prosciutto either wrapped or pressed onto the veal, but no biggie. - The vodka sauce consisting of roasted red peppers and black olives was really salty. I like olives, I eat them like candy but the olives here were unusually salty to me. CHICKEN FRANCESE with linguini ($24): - Chicken breast coated in parmesan and egg and lightly pan-fried. - The lemon butter sauce was intense. It was mouthpuckering, slap-your-face lemony. Tastes like chicken piccata without the capers and a ton of lemon juice. My friend really enjoyed it though. I'd come back for the jumbo meatballs with crack sauce. Hours: Lunch 11 AM to 3 PM Daily Dinner 3 PM to 10 PM on Sun - Thurs, 3PM-11 PM Fri & Sat Lounge & Gaming Room: 24 Hours a daily Parking: Lots of stalls in their private lot

sMdNNinhasjKQ9v1UogrWw.text: I've been here a few times now and it's a consistently good Italian spot.  Everything I've tried has been on point and the portions very decent.  I tried the Grilled Lamb Chops on Stone which was very tender, the Calamari Fritti which was very well seasoned, the Scallops and Shrimp which came with large shrimp and scallops and the Prosciutto.  I think the only item which was delicious, but a bit on the small portion side was the Cheese Ravioli.  Love that they serve hot bread in brown paper bags with olive oil, balsamic and butter.  Wish they had a garlic butter option too but it's plenty good even without.  Definitely a solid place to go if you're craving Italian food.

WBdVo7r5LpLwErHkb_sEHg.text: We made a reservation for a patio table, our family said they had a nice view in the evening for sunset and the Las Vegas strip. Hummingbirds were flying around too.  We ordered a bottle of wine, they also offered 1/2 bottles which is nice. The menu is large, hard to decide on all the good choices.  We ordered the shrimp on a hot stone for appetizer, very good and enough to share. Our party had the angel hair with pomodoro sauce,  the special which was haddock with crab meat and scallops with a lemon sauce. It was excellent and came with asparagus. The house salad and Caesar were also very good.  No room for dessert for us. Our waiter was excellent too.

Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

bzG5oSD36-sXuj-afri60Q.text: Don't like it at all. Eaten here at Least 4 times. Tried various items. Shrimp on a stone is tasty, Everything else, not so much. I Finally found an item that tastes halfway decent. But how many times can you order the Same thing? And it "ain't" cheap! Sunset Pizzeria tastes "tons" better!!! Would I recommend? Only to those who can't cook and don't know what good Italian food should taste like. I cook better!!!

VgeuGX6hWm780uz4cyafUg.text: We came in around 730PM on a Friday night with a group of 6.  We didn't have a reservation and the place was busy so we were told by the hostess the wait would be 45 to an hour.  My friends are regulars here and so they asked if we could sit outside.  The hostess was able to seat us immediately.  It should have been a red flag that there were only 2 other tables taken outside...  The good: - The view.  Wow!  Took a few pictures of the sunset.  Gorgeous. - The menu.  Easy to navigate even though there are a lot of items on there. - The shrimp on stone.  Get this.  It's very good.  Doesn't even need the sauce (although the wasabi one is dynamite).  Sure the shrimp are the smaller kind but the ones I had were flavorful and very tender.  The bad: - The service time.  It took so long in between getting seated and having our order taken.  We weren't checked on that often and items we requested were not brought to us.  Then the check situation was a bit of a nightmare.  But maybe that was our fault for needing 3 separate checks.  - The classic salad was drenched in dressing.  Ask for it on the side.   Overall, a nice place in the neighborhood to get a good meal.  Just don't sit outside.

Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Orange roughy
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp on stone

C9ORnNm6sCRkzE7Ok5QiOg.text: We were staying in the area and were craving Italian so we decided to try this place.  When we walked in it was nothing spectacular, just your basic Italian place.  They all seem to be cracked from the same mold.  Our waiter was a bit high strung and not overly friendly, but he was very attentive.  There were 3 of us dining, I got chicken parm, my wife got shrimp and scallops and my daughter got shrimp fettuccine.  First off, their bread was really good.  And without getting into to much detail, all of our food was pretty good but again nothing spectacular.  They did have nice big shrimp and the scallops were not fishy which can be a problem.    This place was pretty good, but with all the great options in the area not sure if I would go back any time soon.

FwSk8djE6yspKgiMCTtZ7g.text: This place used to be one of my favorite places to go to for Italian food. We used to come here to celebrate birthdays but the last couple of times we went were bad. We tried to give this place another shot but the last time was just confirmation that we won't be coming back. I get sad thinking about this place because a very good friend of ours that had passed away loved this place so much & was the one who recommended this restaurant.

ztmd9E8iV8SxPbJ-QNWJ9w.text: Three strikes and you're out. I too have experienced bland food on all three occasions of dinning here. A little seasoning can go a long way. Good wine list and breadsticks.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Wine dinner with Del Dotto.

zJESu1avV0ipRqT2ReHy4A.text: (I would actually rate Ventano a 3.5)  I was introduced to this restaurant by my dad, who has dined there 113 times (pretty specific, huh?). Suffice to say, it is a neighborhood joint. I had been there previously, and never been disappointed. Upon entering, you'll see a nice looking open space, with a raised bar area that is partially separated by half walls. Clay colored walls and exposed beams and woodwork give it an upscale casual feel.  Most importantly, the food is good. This time we came for lunch. We started with an order of shrimp on a stone, which is served sizzling in garlic butter glory. A few orders of this would have been fine for me, but I ordered the veal picatta ((capers and white wine) which was very tender and good. It was served with penne and a red sauce, but the veal portion was a little small, even for lunch.  Service was spot on - not hanging over us, but never too far away to ask if everything was okay.  Pricing is reasonable. Lunch for three (1 appetizer, 3 entrees and non-alcoholic drinks) came to $75 including tip.  Recommended.

tDLwn4c_e48g2YZQVTke_w.text: Made reservation on Thursday for 6:00 pm Friday .. Told person taking reservation was for 62 birthday and wanted to be seated by window... For the view ... Was offered patio ... Declined... Told window seating would be fine. Arrived Friday @ 6:00 ... Hostess ... Confirmed reservation .. Even window seating... Then said wasn't available... As window seating was popular... But we could sit on patio ... Under heaters...or wait 20 to 30 minutes.. When said we were leaving .. Told we could pick from open seating... Bait and switch???... Incompetent hostess??... Result Happy Birthday!!! Never again!!!!

PCZjqL3KN0ZO2QQDby5UQQ.text: Always have a great meal here,  the view is great,  the food is great,  the bar is fun.  the chef even came out to ask us about our dinner on mothers day one year.  the baked clams appetizer is better then we get in New York.

ALOLi-tZzKJsOQHkJ4gocA.text: I have lived in the area forever and never been here, so I decided it was time.   Okay, the view, we get it. IT'S LOVELY... and quite perfect. I really do love the view, but the other reviews definitely cover this part:].   The restaurant is very elegant, cozy, and spacious enough to have your own conversation without someone eavesdropping.   My favorite part about Ventano's is the staff. They were all super friendly and kept my water glass full (my favorite) and made sure everything was up to par. As for the food, I felt it was mediocre. The bread served before the meal was not as I expected. They seemed like pre-made (wannabe) fresh bread sticks, but they give you oil and balsamic vinegar for dipping, I'm not sure if I should be feeling this confusion with bread and dipping... but I associate oil and vinegar with fresh bread.   For an entree I got a pesto dish, which.. Yes, was good.. but I still feel it was average. My friend got another pasta dish with spicy marinara which he enjoyed. We also indulged in dessert.. tiramisu. Enjoyed this as well.   Ventano's is good. Nothing more, nothing less. I enjoyed my experience here, and food was definitely a step above an Olive Garden. I will be back on the occasion.

uKKbg1XTT6CEm1779Dkbow.text: I had the field greens & the eggplant rollatini. Hubs had the chicken piccata! Both good. I think my favorite part was the garlic toasted bread sticks though! Great view @ night. We went for lunch.

-WY_u5zbrSdGqO_qg2PUFQ.text: Wow - went there for lunch and the food was excellent.  There lunch menu prices are very reasonable and service was impeccable.  Adam and Carlos were great, we never waited for a thing and their suggestions were right on.  The view of the strip is fantastic, I can't wait to go back at night when it is lite up.

nC_vglMKUENvwBR80oJ0dA.text: First time here.  Service was horrible . Took forever for someone to acknowledge us and then hardly saw the waiter.  The food(shrimp parm) was good but due to the poor service would not go back.  If they dont care about me, why should I care about them.

4jw0zvDpC0X5H4mRj1_ouQ.text: Great local italian place.  Million dollar view from the patio of the valley.  The Bolongese was very taste and the pasta was cooked al dente.  Kid friendly and good service.  I did a banquet here for some doctors and the food was tasty then.  If you can serve tasty banquet style food for 50 people, you can serve tasty food for 6 people.  Hidden gem in Henderson.

LgfAWudJ2iW6ZVGX7EWhQQ.text: Absolutely great food! It was Delicious, good price, big servings, great view, nice and quite.   My only complain tho, is the service from the Hostess, they suck! get them off their phones and have them seat people. this place would be a 5 star if it wern't for that.

yjJmfgkO4gpGrccaREceow.text: All in all a very disappointing dinner with my mother visiting from San Francisco. We were never presented with the specials and assumed it was all on the menu. The waiter (manager?) took our drink order and upon returning to take our order, again never recited the specials. We started with fried calamari and ordered two entrees: Pasta Putanesca and the Pasta with Shrimp and Porcini Mushrooms.  And, so it started downhill from there. The calamari was tough and chewy and we sent it back.  They fried it some more and brought it back still chewy, just hotter and oilier.  Their suggestion was to order stuffed mushrooms, which were floating in a greasy liquid but edible.  On to the entrees. The Pasta Putanesca was so salty from the unsliced kalamata olives, capers and anchovies, that I couldn't eat it on the overcooked spaghetti.  In the meanwhile, the same waiter was listing the specials to the table behind us.  I sent the pasta back and he recommended the Dover Sole which was tasty but oily and covered with a Thanksgiving-type stuffing with bits of crab and a dry butternut squash risotto.  My mother was able to eat a bit of her pasta but was pretty sure that the porcini mushrooms were really button mushrooms and was challenged by the chewy shrimp.  The pink sauce was bland but edible.  I also was surprised that nobody checked on my cup of decaf coffee which remained empty or whether we might want to order more wine for my Mother.  To add insult to injury, the waiter was defensive about the specials and glossed over his error, implying that we ordered too fast. He comped us the mushrooms (he was sure that this would make us happy). However, when i saw that the sole was $27 ($12 more than the pasta), I felt that since I was no longer hungry after attempting the calamari, mushrooms and bread and ate only a few bites of the sole that this was steep.  He begrudgingly took off $5.  The place was empty save for 5 or 6 tables and I often gauge service by their attentiveness to my coffee cup. I felt that even with our complaints, or even as a result of them, that we would have been watched over carefully.  It was a first try for newcomers to the area. I guess I will keep on looking.

KKHO-FHAIgkddDICVJEyCA.text: Not only does this restaurant have an amazing view, but the food is amazing. The images on their website look meh, but when you get there you will not be disappointed. The staff is delightful. The portions are generous. I can't say enough about how great this place is.

6GyDFks8VkGayYomdUxWig.text: Service was awesome!! Lobster Bisque wasn't :( I will deff try something new next time!

XdYiO_wbRhM2ghimMuus-A.text: Ventanos was one of my favorite restaurants until this New Years Eve. Since it's opened our family has celebrated NYE with an early dinner at Ventano's. This year made the same reservation. We got there and the restaurant was not full. We were seated in the banquet room on a small dance floor. I asked if we could move to the restaurant and was told no. Those tables were reserved. Yes, I had a reservation too. The floor was very slick and the table was very unsteady- as it was a folding table. The food was okay. The servers were very accommodating. There are so many choices for restaurants. It's a shame we won't be returning to one of our favorites.

yrGYydLIYh8kJsUb5OXDpw.text: 12-11-13 1800 Party of 55 We had a great view of the strip We had fantastic service, And we had very good Italian food.  Great place for a Christmas Party.

Tt3Dm3eBJzAsQzXJYjOkBw.text: Went to Ventanos because a friend recommended it and we loved it! The wine was excellent, the bread had a good flavor, the food was delicious, and the view was amazing! I can't remember our server's name but he was terrific. No complaints on this place. The decor and ambiance was warm and inviting and my date loved the place too.

MZ5vqPRqsHfyO6NRoVTZGw.text: Nice ambiance, with a gorgeous view from the patio...definitely recommend asking for a table outside.  Food was good, albeit a tad on the pricey side. I had the cheese tortellini which I enjoyed.  The breadsticks were probably what I enjoyed most though! Yum.  I would definitely return to try more of the menu.

IGB_yLJtK872mDxuRiPZcg.text: Excellent food, service and view of the Las Vegas skyline at night!  The Grilled Shrimp on the Stone was a huge mound of little shrimps with a slightly spicy kick. It came with a creamy horseradishy dip that I wasn't too excited about partly because I'm not into horseradish but also because the shrimps were already a little spicy and perfectly marinated. I did however wish the shrimp were a little bigger; I wouldn't have minded getting fewer of them.   The Arancine consisted of three large fried balls with a gooey filling of risotto, mozarella cheese, ground beef and peas with a marinara dip. They were good but it was also very filling and a little too heavy to be a thoroughly enjoyable appetizer.  The highlight of the night was definitely the home made linguine with scallops and shrimp in your choice of sauce, which for us was an absolutely delish garlic cream sauce that our server recommended. The linguine had a great bouncy texture and was cooked just right with sweet fresh scallops and large shrimp. This was one of the specials for that night but we were told that they often vary this dish so you could try something a little different each time. This is sooo good but I love scallops so I might be a little biased here.  I thought it was a tad warm out on the patio that night and it would have been nice to have ceiling fans or some kind of misting to make it a little more comfortable. Although we were seated outside, the staff were attentive and kept our glasses filled and checked on us often.  UPDATED on 8/19/2010: I signed up on Ventano's website about 3 or 4 weeks ago and only just received a one-time-use coupon from them for $25 off $50 purchase that expires September 1, 2010. I don't live near Henderson so if you can use this, please send me a message and I'll email it to you.

oV5Z5oVH6oN_RylcdO4XSg.text: My Wife and I go to Vegas twice a year to enjoy the casinos and visit our dearest friends (Tony & Carol) who happen to live in Henderson. Our friends know that each time we visit, we will definitely want to eat at Ventano's. They are always happy to oblige since it's one of their favorite places as well.   Best veal I've ever had. If you've got a big appetite, get the Lasagna! I can honestly say that every single thing we have eaten there over the years has been absolutely wonderful! Be sure to make a reservation!!!!

jYuciqAImIEyl8V8eTUvlw.text: Shortly after I moved to Las Vegas, friends took my husband and me to Ventano's. It was a great time but we ended up frequenting La Collina/Carmine's on the Hill when we wanted a nice Italian meal and a great view. Since La Collina/Carmine's on the Hill is now a Mexican restaurant, my husband and I decided to give Ventano's another shot.   First off, the view. It's fabulous. When the weather is nice they have a lovely patio where you can sit and eat as you look at the lights of the Strip. It's still summer, and a hot one as usual, so we decided to sit indoors near the windows. When the sun was setting, staff went outside and dropped the shades so myself and others would not be blinded. As soon as the sun fell below the horizon, they put it back up.   We decided on some wine, and some complimentary bread was brought out in a brown paper bag. I try not to fill up on bread when I am having Italian food but this bread was really yummy. We also decided to get the shrimp on a stone appetizer, having remembered how good it was when our friends ordered it on our first visit. My husband is not a fan of any form of sea/lake dwelling creature, but he enjoyed some of these.    For our entrees my husband had the manicotti, I had risotto with prosciutto and peas, I didn't try the manicotti, because my risotto was delicious. And the serving was huge. When I was done it looked like I had just gotten started. But I was too stuffed to get dessert.   Service was very much on point for the majority of the evening. Never had to ask for a refill and our waiter checked in on how we were doing on occasion without being overbearing. When it was time for the leftovers to be packaged up and the check to be brought over the restaurant was a little fuller so we had a itty bit wait but it was really nothing that would prevent me from returning.

uWy3yPaXCmUYyzW2Kw9PQA.text: Caprese is a quintessential Italian salad consisting simply of sliced fresh mozzarella (preferably buffalo) and tomato dressed with olive oil, garnished with fresh basil and finished with salt.  I ordered Ventano's Caprese which adds a balsamic reduction to the classic recipe. Unfortunately, the tomato was inedible - anemic pink with the consistency of Styrofoam and not a scintilla of flavor.  The mozzarella lacked the creamy texture and delicate flavor of fresh mozzarella.  The fresh basil and the balsamic reduction did not succeed in rescuing the inferior tomato and the dry mozzarella from embarrassment.  The service also was sub par.  A youngish server failed as a sommelier - did not allow tasting before pouring and having poured the initial portions, did not return to offer additional pours.  An attentive server would have noticed that I had barely touched the tomato and inquired whether the dish was acceptable - he did not.  Our party was seated in a booth with a view of the city lights and the young lady who managed the bread supply did her job.  Although my companions said their veal saltimbocca was "good," the presentation lacked any artistry whatsoever.  Granted, I am a Caprese snob but, at a minimum, if the chef cannot serve a delicious tomato and creamy mozzarella, don't serve the dish.

q5AYUgaOmI-h87pHSGRdHQ.text: This place is maybe okay at best.  The service is good, but the food is inconsistent and mediocre.  Been here for a few big group events and the food tends to be of poor quality.  Just doesn't seem fresh and authentic.  Has a catering feel to it.  Had a crab cake as a side to my entree and it was burnt on one side and looked as if it was dropped off the plate, stepped on, and then served.  No thanks, not going back.d

hKyKuO-l13w-07ZCcSNCCg.text: Patty, did not say anything but when the patron starting having a fit she RAN over to adjust the fan for the third time, catered to this gentleman and I use the term loosely and never asked if we wanted another drink or anything when we made a comment about the fan she them made it so it went right in our faces.  I the stepped out ordered our dinner to go from the hostess offered her the 20%tip and we left. All the time the patron was glaring at us and I finally said "what" to him and he looked away.  Her job is to make sure ALL enjoy the bar not just one.

-h-ZcTYV2Oh2zxmKqRrnVQ.text: The rating really should be 4 plus because everything here was so delicious and our waiter, Adam, was the best we have had anywhere.  Ok, here is why I didn't give it 5 stars--We are an Italian family from Lake Como and I reserve 5 stars for Italian restaurants that serve food precisely the way Italians in Italy serve food.  This is more an American version but an extremely good American version.  Let's start from the beginning.  Freshly made breadsticks arrived which were phenomenal.  The olive oil and balsamic vinegar were of the highest quality.  I had the caprese which was delicious and tasty with firm tomatoes and good, but not the best, mozzarella.  Then we all ordered pasta and their pomodoro sauce was exquisite as was their puttanesca with high quality olives.  We finished it all off with a dark chocolate cake which was sinful and yummy.   A delectable limoncello after all the food was devoured and we were on the road full and happy.   What made this meal so special is that the night before we had the worst experience at the snooty and overpriced Las Vegas restaurant, Il Mulino.  It was no fun and spending $330 for 2 adults and 2 kids trying to be careful about what we selected because of the expense was not a pleasure.  Adam, our waiter, made this meal so much fun.  He was flexible, always attentive to our requests without hovering too much and extremely proud of the restaurant which makes for a fun time.  If I lived in the area, I would be a regular here.

kSZWYKgsBIlaN0UmLPFL8g.text: Really like this place. The shrimp on the stone was delicious, and I really enjoyed my lasagna. Our waiter was very good and went the extra mile.

ctr_vcWFVn5vrzXPDVC3aQ.text: Went to Ventano's for the first time on my birthday. Made online reservations from Yelp. This is a great restaurant and the food was amazing! The outdoor seating is nice with views of the strip. What a great location. Prices are a bit on the high side but the quality and favors of the food was so good I'll definitely come back again. My only complaint (Im whining here) was they didnt recognize my birthday after being told 3 times. Most restaurants at least bring you a small birthday dessert.

4xcduzy-AKxWfeAS-AxDZg.text: Love this place been one of my  favorite restaurant since I went there randomly if you love Italian food and oysters with amazing view of the strip and staff is amazing

PnILGonup1HE5GjEfA8tng.text: I must say.. I LOVE everything about this place! The view, food, decor and the staff are a delight.   Keep up the great work!

PF9G_v4E85vTtRAa4yKMXw.text: Great food and view! We had the fettuccini Alfredo and lasagna. Good family restaurant with a lot of space. Our waiter was excellent. Will return again!

_VGvurwtHvtT8O1e-qSMwQ.text: Wonderful service, great food.  My husband had Linguini with Clams and I had the Shrimp and Scallops. The servers were absolutely amazing.

KPDXSCTQPZrksoeyuCG_WA.text: I've been to Ventano's half a dozen times so far and have never been disappointed. The food and service is excellent. Make sure to go at dusk and request a window seat or even eat outside. The views are great!  I recommend the chicken scampi. It's awesome! Great place for a date or to take friends and family when they come to town.

2Zx5-ZhnlYUK0FRgj2vnGw.text: Cioppino is fantastic! Every time I come here I am not disappointed! Staff is always on point and I love the view! I've also ordered the potato wrapped salmon and I usually never finish a plate because I can't finish it all but there was literally nothing left when I ordered this because I couldn't stop eating it. Bravo! Bravo!

qaJJoMUIGnCjZVw7c0CaCA.text: Sooooo disappointed. Wow. Beautiful view, nice pleasant staff, horrendous inedible food. Orzo was rock hard and greasy, "crab" on top of Dover sole literally looked like vomit. Potato wrapped salmon was chewy and dry. We took one bite and sent the food back and left. Waiter was super sweet and service staff was very attentive- too bad the food was so awful.

2-_bjpnm4P-UOVGdKd18lw.text: Outstanding and helpful service by Michael.   The Romaine salad appetizer was excellent.   The lasagna entree was tasty and "wonderful Italian comfort food", not to be confused with being the least bit boring or pedestrian.  A great selection!

aW7FOUN1sV4R3Kax82F7Pg.text: I moved near this restaurant a few months ago and since then I have been in 4 times - 3 times for dinner and once in the bar area after the main dining room was closed.  Every time we have been in this place has exceeded my expectations. Service is prompt and formal which I appreciate being in the industry myself. The decor of the restaurant and demeanor of the employees gives off the feeling of gourmet dining but casual at the same time. Perfect for my husband and I.   Each of the 3 times I have had dinner I ordered one of the daily specials. The portions are generous, my beef has always been cooked to the perfect temperature ordered and specials are always unique and delicious. The wine list is extensive and fairly priced. The bread is served inside of a brown paper bag - I can appreciate the whimsical touch.    If you go in you must try the beef carpaccio - a classic dish which I have enjoyed at many different restaurants but there is something about this dish at Ventano's that keeps me craving more! I have literally begged my husband to go in  just to eat this appetizer!!  Another cool thing is they offer events regularly like wine or beer maker dinners. Not to mention they have the best view of the strip!! Definitely check this place out and you will not be disappointed!

pHGGbqBNxCqTOw-j14cJYQ.text: I loved everything about this Italian restaurant. The service was amazing, the staff was kind and welcoming, and the food was amazing! I loved how the menu was written in Italian and it had the atmosphere and culture of Italy. Definitely one of my most favorite Italian restaurants now.

RCZ85TWkybOT9SH5QD0NoA.text: I have been to this place many times. The food is excellent (and I really love the shrimp on the sizzling hibachi appetizer). Atmosphere is beautiful, especially if it is nice out and you can eat out in the patio

UckgsL6gwWBm3gO-BFMBzQ.text: This is one of our most favorite restaurants in the Las Vegas area. Classy atmosphere. Plenty of parking. Patio dining with the best view of the whole Las Vegas valley and the Strip. Service staff is incredibly attentive. They are very accommodating if you want to make substitutions. They have Linguine con Scampi Fra Diavolo, but I prefer it with Calamari instead of shrimp, which they are more than happy to do. This dish is to die for. Prices for dinner are on the expensive side, but lunch is reasonable. If you have an Entertainment card, it makes dinner a great value. The food and service is always incredible and worth it. Highly recommended for special occasions and romantic dinners.

T4sqqrYogfGzKjPjRxOztw.text: Beautiful Italian restaurant with spectacular views! We've been going there for over 10 years & always enjoyed it. My favorite chef Arnold:)

StO7WktPZ9e9EJjKjAUSJw.text: The best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.Definitely a Hidden Jewel. Great food, Fantastic view and an Unbelievable Service ,friendly to make  you fell at home.

iVGcHuUOntwjP1PX4ULkMw.text: Ventano's never disappoints.  From the view of Las Vegas to the flavor of the food,  everything is unique.  You are greeted by a welcoming staff and seated in a timely manner (reservations are suggested).  I have been to Ventano's now 4 times and have ordered something different each time and have been impressed with each dish.  This has now become the go to restaurant for my wife and I when family or friends come into town or just want to go somewhere nice.

DzRhB5vNeIu7_TNrPcTcKg.text: Ventano's is one of the better Italian restaurants in town (on and off the strip). Food is great, people are nice and prices are reasonable. I do find the tip options a little weird. Instead of the traditional receipt where you fill it all out, they have this device that calculates either an 18% or 20% tip to your meal. That's all good and well, but it's like "What if I feel the waiter/staff didn't deserve it?"   Anyway, all in all, we love this place and keep coming back. I don't know if it's proximity to the house is a good or a bad thing!

7xYJnjnm9dnSITvFQXznSQ.text: Must have been a seasoning rationing... Every plate was bland and lacked harmony. Wait staff was simply okay, Michael, our waiter was in the kitchen for upwards of 15 minutes before returning to the dining room. One pasta dish was severely overcooked and the other was undercooked. My glass of Pinot Grigio was the only enjoyable part of the meal. Sadly we will not be returning to this "Italian" restaurant.

VQnymQjLtoCCKSWG28kB0w.text: This place is very intimate and the ambience is so relaxing. First off we were greeted by everyone and the owner came over as soon as we sat down. The table was already set up with water and silverware which was awesome because I had 6 kids with me. The service was excellent, and the Fettuccine Alfredo was the best I have ever had!! They owner made us feel very special and I was so impressed with everything that I tasted as well as the service. I will definitely be back very soon and I would suggest this place for anyone wanting to eat great Italian food!

lr9-14YqZC-lxBUJ7TRqFw.text: No words can describe how much I love the fettuccine con funghi. Honestly, this is the only dish I get but I'm sure the other dishes are amazing as well but I crave for this pasta! Waiters/servers are very nice as well and the manager checks up on you and the chef and it's just a great atmosphere.

5Y7CW5_UUrA_qdUABuEbXg.text: The food was excellent when it finally arrived.  Seems that when the restaurant is holding a banquet, that takes priority over walk in guest.  So the service was inadequate to say the least.

Iq-05sygUx72yQBK740t6g.text: Really nice view from the patio :) and excellent service thanks to Carlos! He was attentive, funny, and I appreciated his honesty. Baked clams were yummy,  Shrimp and scallop pasta was incredible (definitely could have fed 2 people), and the delicious Zeppole made me rethink the size of my tummy... I'm surprised that nobody had to wheel me out of there :p I'll definitely be returning,  so maybe next time ;)

nac9l_zt8uDrCA0YhwMkHQ.text: Good food, just the right spice on my fra diavlo.  Ravioli was ok, nothing special.  Service was a little slow but was busy.

BkPlxXKoBHHy-2ihuoDSHw.text: My husband and I went to this restaurant on 6/8/13 for the first time. Saw some pretty good reviews and thought it was worth a try. We will not go back again.   Here are the reasons why  Service:  1) It was a nightmare. The water had a funny taste to it. We ordered unsweetened ice tea. The waitress never came back to refill our glasses. Finally refilled our glass when someone next to us asked her and then she filled our glass that was like 15 minutes my glass was empty.   2) The waitress was either forgetful or too lazy to get us the correct drink. We ordered "Unsweetened" ice tea, not sweeten ice tea. She gave us sweeten ice tea 2x when she refill our glass.
