We didn't bother to tell her that it was wrong and see how long it would take for her to realize it was the wrong tea. She refilled us when she was refilling another couple with the same ice tea. She didn't notice and didn't apologize for the wrong drink. It was terrible. I wanted unsweetened ice tea b/c sweetened ice tea gave me heartburns.   3) The tip options were set for you. You basically have no other choice except to give 18% tip for bad service or 20% tip for regular service. It was set on a handheld machine.  Overall service, it was terrible. The waitress came to check on us once during the entire meal. Keep giving us the wrong ice tea.   Food: 1) It is way over priced with the quality of the food they serve. We ordered an appetizer and 2 basic main course, Arancine $10, Chicken Piccata $20 and Chicken Scallopini $20.    2) Both main course dishes were cover with tones of sauce like swimming in a oval platter tub. The chicken piccata sauce was terrible, lemon juice and cream, way too much lemon juice gave my husband heartburn immediately.   3) Chicken Piccata only had the lemon cream sauce and a few capers with a couple of small chicken breast and an abundance of pasta on the side. The pasta had no taste to it, just basic crushed tomato sauce on top, no seasoning what so ever. My husband is Italian and grew up in a big Italian family. He hated the food.   4) Chicken Scallopini was also swimming in a oval tub platter with pasta on the side as well. A chicken breast was pounded to death. The other chicken breast thickness was uneven. Another small piece of chicken breast somehow crawled into my plate look like some leftover.   5) Arancine, rice ball with mozzarella and peas. It was not worth $10 for 3 rice ball. It was not good at all. I guess that was the reason why they gave us a big bowl of red tomato chili sauce on the side. One bite, I was done with the dish.   Overall food, it was terrible. Not worth coming back., not worth the price. The food on the menu is simple, and you will probably think it shouldn't be too bad. Well for some who likes tones of sauce on their food and throws anything in their mouth and think is good, yes, this place isn't bad at all then.   Total bill for 1 appetizer 2 main course plus 2 ice tea & 18 % tip is $70+  You could definitely spend the same amount of money elsewhere for better service and food.

amhmJVsJ3Nid9QzfeAidTg.text: I am leaving a second review in less than a month because I had my graduation celebration at Ventano's and I was treated so well by Michael and everyone at Ventano's. I had a large group (16 people) of family come in from out of town and everyone was very happy with the food and service. Our server Michael went over the top and made sure that my mother who planned the party did not have to worry about anything. This place is awesome and it has a great ambience especially if you can sit out on the patio on a nice night like we did!

nZ1djkincJY4x14bIOZXQA.text: Maybe one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to. Service was amazing. View was awesome. Portions were for a giant. Great flavor. Went here with a buddy from work and was just amazed. Must try this place! A little spendy but well worth it!

w8GlpbDrycOgHHfeVHpybw.text: This place is one of Las Vegas hidden secrets! It is great!  The food is awesome, I love to go after work with friends to the bar and gamble and drink fine wine and at the same time you can eat the most delicious Italian food ever. They also have a full size dining room that is completely separate from the bar that overlooking all of Las Vegas. OMG it is a beautiful establishment. I really love the bartenders, they cater to me, because I love to gamble but the restaurant is where my husband and I have the most romantic meals in Vegas or I guess I should say Henderson. You have to see it to believe it. I drove past it 4 year's before I realized it was on a cliff with all windows,  I only noticed the entrance which is in the back. Reasonably priced also for such a lovely dining room. Top shelf wines also, Cheers.

spmkvIXiXxtZeXZtx6F4BQ.text: Everything here is delicious!  This is our favorite restaurant in the entire valley. Grilled salad is amazing, veal is amazing, ribs are amazing, everything is amazing!!

hg6srBVeSZp876LU3SFqxQ.text: I went in with great expectations, but I was sincerely let down by the food.   If you go here the oysters are a must have, they really are to die for, best oysters thus far in Vegas.   I ordered the Linguine alla Vongole, the serving size was large and the pasta was very tough, the clams were tasteless, but the sauce was very salty.   I also had some of the salmon from Filetto Di Salmone and it was okay, not much taste, sort of tough. Nothing special.   These three stars go out to the service which was really great. and the whole decor of the restaurant was lovely AND THE OYSTERS! Overall the food here was mediocre.

rD2MYMBHZzBpkkuPAz7sRw.text: Excellent food presented by a well trained staff. The  view of Las Vegas is stunning at night

GMvc9L_FOhgVhZHj3kjcoQ.text: Two things I love here, the grilled romaine salad and shrimp on a stone.  I literally get crazy cravings for these two dishes. Nothing else on their menu seems more than mediocre to me. Staff is pleasant but to get their real attention you must be a regular.

PRrxlI4MzLA8Sprr-ojeQA.text: Amazing.   They deserve every star. Michael was our server along with Javier. So attentive and nice.  I forgot what good service felt like.   The food was amazing! I got the rigattoni with pink sauce (recommended by Michael) and the shrimp on a stone.   Also, what a view. Enjoyed watching the sunset while having diner!

jZUFs3sfxuTIMlB2xNOaqg.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great patio with view of the strip, great service! And I ESPECIALLY love the sign behind the hostess stand advising parents to keep children seated. A-MEN!! We took friends who were in town visiting and had a wonderful experience!

X504X57J8_kjYB7e-EB8Tg.text: Had my birthday dinner here out on the patio.was fabulous! The food was to die for,but the very best thing about the evening was our waiter,Carlos! So informative &personal! Made the evening a delight! No was not in his vocabulary,give that guy a raise,he soo deserves it! Will definately be going back!!

r8f4bZxZOoi-_nYzi99b_w.text: Excellent service, nice decor with panoramic beautiful views, great wine list, Caesars salad, breadsticks with olive oil/balsamic vinegar and lasagna were awesome!  Great value at only 70 dollars with bottle of Oregon Pinot noir!

otKI9GCAMHeWNaPJkPGtLw.text: Stopped in your oysters.   To die for! Or should i say fish for. Awesome.  Calimari was rubbery and over done.

wE8WJKK5VY2_4uttIi45LQ.text: Ok I am a regular customer however tonight I was told the window seats were reserved for the managers family and friends. I reserved a window seat but was told this after I arrived? So if you want a good Italian restaurant that puts customers first choose Casa de Amore!

dGyW77pTtIth48i5E11e8Q.text: We wanted to like this place considering a lot of positive reviews about the food and the view. We went on a Wednesday evening around 7pm and the place was about two thirds full. The decor was Tuscany ish but the restaurant is basically one big room, so the acoustics leave a lot to be desired. The tables all look like they are 40" square tops so intimacy is not a strong suit here. This is not a romantic restaurant. The kitchen is situated behind glazed glass and the loud clanking of dishes just seems to carry throughout the room. I think there was some sort of music playing but it was all garbled with the rest of the noise. The "view" is nice but looking out the windows wasn't all it was cracked up to be because of the reflections of the lights, tv's , and exit signs. I guess if you eat outside you can appreciate the view better. We were a little taken aback by the high end prices. A drink I ordered was good but small, and for $8 you would think you'd get a decent size glass. Warm breadsticks in a bag reminded me of Olive Garden and weren't good. The complimentary oil and vinegar really was third rate.  Can butter be that more expensive? We split a Caesar salad $8.50 which I have to say was very good. Freshly made, cold, and just the right mix of dressing. We then ordered Veal Parm with Spaghetti $26 and Lobster Ravioli with Blackened Shrimp $28. Any Italian restaurant worth it's salt is known by their Veal Parm and their sauce. The veal was tender and plentiful and nicely plated but the sauce was really a 5 out of 10. Being an Italian from the east coast makes me a snob I guess but the sauce wasn't that good at all. How can you charge $19 for Spaghetti Bolognese and then if you want two meatballs add another $4? Manicotti $22? So I can get Veal Parm for the same amount as Spaghetti & Meatballs. Doesn't make sense. The Lobster Ravioli was very good but consisted of only four medium sized ravioli and four medium sized shrimp topped with two pieces of asparagus. We didn't stick around for dessert but we bagged the left overs. Two people with the above and tax was $75. I'm not sure what the owner thinks justifies the high entree prices. Yelp needs to add another $ sign to their price category for this place. As I write this their sauce is repeating on me. Time to find another place.

j0LnhOnE1PsOne8CgzUxIg.text: This is an expensive place and you should expect the best.  We had a caesar salad and the lettuce was perfect, it was well tossed, the garlic and anchovy were well balanced, the croutons were crisp and tasty.  I've only had better caesar salads when it was table prep in very high end restaurants.  The lobster ravioli was extremely good.  The pasta is homemade and near perfect, the lobster flavor was strong, the sauce was well balanced, and the shrimp (unusual in lobster ravioli) was very slightly overcooked.  We will definitely get that again.  However, I cannot recommend the veal saltimbocca.  The veal was a little tough, but acceptable.  The prosciutto tasted a bit tough and had too much basil flavor.  The creamed spinach could have used a bit more creaminess.  The roasted potatoes were fine, but nothing to write home about.  But the killer was the whole leaves of basic on the veal and slightly mixed into the spinach.  Have you ever tasted a whole basil leaf in your mouth?  It ruined the dish.  We will be back to this place to try other dishes, and especially more pastas, but no more saltimbocca....  If we had just had the lobster ravioli, it would have received 4 stars.  That said, when we passed the bar, the smoke was a bit much, but you couldn't smell it where we ate.  Parking is off to the side, but acceptable.  The wait staff had good personalities, but service was lacking when the restaurant was full.  We waited a good 15 minutes just for the bill.

e9SrIJJiE3E3TKi57nsmsw.text: Delicious!  Loved everything and Carlos was great!  Can't believe I've lived a couple miles away for so long and this was our first time here!  Will definitely be back...there is so much more to try!

fOdo2YeEscKnowpzuEX8hA.text: After lots of great reviews we were looking forward as part of our "new restaurant Tuesday" adventures where we try a new place usually always based on Yelp. Nothing bad or glaring, but I feel this place has seen better days. The ambience is not as old school Italian romantic as more a little dated. The faux murals on the wall and a little tired interior could use an update. The waiter was very good, attentive and helped steer us toward a couple of favorites. The food here is solid. We enjoyed both our appetizer (calamari) and our entrees. I had the Tortellini house specialty and it was very good. Wife had the penne which was OK. No room for desert and we took about half of our portions home for leftovers due to size. The location is good near the highway and the view is interesting. Nothing glaringly bad but nothing that knocked our socks off. This is a solid neighborhood Italian place where you won't be disappointed but not be overwhelmed either.

Fg1zKIKsTQcy1DfUn1sL1Q.text: Really poor service lately. I used to frequent Ventanos at least once a month. I have been twice in the last month and had the same experience. Over an hour wait for food after ordering and no one caring. The first time I chalked it up to bad luck, paid and took it home. The next time I spoke to the hostess. Talk about a "don't give a hoot" attitude!  I'm done being a customer

VIWhlNAnxMWXNnb6R8I6fQ.text: Best meal that I ate while in Las Vegas!  I had the sauteed scallops and shrimp with asparagus, a roasted tomato and risotto (in this case-rice; I'm used to risotto being a pasta) delicious nonetheless.   5 stars for their roasted tomato (soup or bisque) yummm, I wish I had some right now!  Loved their canoli  Great ambiance  Great company. Our friends that took us there had some fall off the bone short ribs which he really liked. His wife and daughter standardly get the grilled romaine (it looked good) The service was really good.

ZCj5gPQYBs6cp5ERGcx0TA.text: This is absolutely my favorite restaurant. Everyone has always been wonderful and the food is great. I chose it as a place to propose to my current wife.

D5CqkhNbEaeuE38rdbA_zQ.text: The place was empty for a peak lunch hour on a Sunday afternoon. That should have been my first clue. The bread was delicious but that is about the only good thing I can say about the food. I ordered a salmon wrap and the caesar dressing was terrible and bland. The olives overpowered the meal. My mother in law ordered the chicken parm sandwich and it was really really dry. The service was good. This just wouldn't be a place I would recommend for lunch. The view is beautiful but not a reason to eat here.

M21EBjyuVediCvWPEs-W0g.text: Just mad at myself for waiting so long to try this spot. We went on the Friday of Valentine's weekend without reservations, and had no issue with waiting 15 minutes to be seated. The server was very attentive (sorry for forgetting his name) throughout our meal, and we split an appetizer and each had a pasta entree. Food was piping hot and not from a heat lamp (huge plus), and portions were such that a bunch came home with us. Will absolutely return and bring visiting friends and family.

1-izM367iU7ajpXUNvmlUQ.text: Had my first experience last night and it was great!  I love the atmosphere and the service is amazing, wish I could remember my servers name. The food was amazing but they made a mistake with my plate and the chef came out to personally apologize and was so kind.  I can't wait for my next visit!

jb-IWn2mQP9VWarHsY4T0A.text: Had dinner at Ventanos while in Vegas and now that I have a yelp account I had to put a review up for my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  If you have not tried Ventanos I can not recommend it enough!!!!  I moved away from Vegas 6 years ago and it has been a while since I have been back but whenever I come to visit I always make sure I get to Ventanos.  The food is absolutely mouth watering.  Unfortunately when we visited Chef Arnauld was off the night I came in and I was so disappointed to miss him.  He has special dishes he makes for his customers once he finds out what you like.  But even though he wasn't there the dinner was still incredible.  There is not a dish on his menu that you won't love.  We had Shrimp Arnauld and the Rack of Lamb.  Each dish was cooked to perfection and my mouth is watering just remembering the experience.  If I could I would give Ventanos 10 stars, it truly is that good.  I will be back around Thanksgiving and I will see you then Chef.  I don't know if you remember me from my picture  but I am looking forward to finally having my favorite dish, Your Shrimp Roast.  I am already counting the days.

AMjdUgTDxsz7YY5zLU78bQ.text: I like this place. I've eaten lunch a few times here. My favorites is the shrimp on stone, its an appetizer but with the fresh bread with balsamic and oil, it's a very filling meal.  I also liked the gnocchi and lamb chops.

CY7xAFYhcA72qDFh2z2fFA.text: we went here for a birthday dinner.... it was $89 per person for the wine dinner... 5 courses and a wine pairing. it was loud and we sat in rounds of 8.  the first course was a wedge salad with hot cappicola...and it was so good!  great salad!!  i was impressed....  next 4 courses...not good.  the food was so unmemorable... it felt like buffet food.  the wine pairing was all red wine... i didn't drink any of it... since i prefer white.  good thing our friends love red wine, they drank 10 glasses or wine for me and my man. lol  who knew cops love red wine!!! lol.  i will never eat here again.  overpriced and mediocre.  the highlight of the evening is we won a magnum of the wine... red of course, so we gave it to our friend.. the birthday girl!

MfDFHm8QUTXEJchMxpfbgg.text: What a view! Great staff, great management, great food...Each year we visit my grandparents there (it's their very favorite restaurant) and there's no reason to go anywhere else. Be sure to book a table for sunset!

GgTKDbfUOxbak8RRyFZ2GQ.text: Nice atmosphere, great view and pleasant overall experience. House salad and balsamic dressing was truly noteworthy. Entrees had large protein portions and the pasta was cooked nicely.  The server was friendly, but the service was average at best, as it appeared floor was understaffed.  Go during or after sunset and you won't regret it.

cDPAvBdxVVemmioHX6IKGQ.text: Great place! Quiet, peaceful atmosphere, and delicious food! One of the best views in the Las Vegas Valley. Don't miss this hidden gem!

jtO4nV0Y4ZmHKpNGiv9yoQ.text: My favorite Italian restaurant. The view is amazing and the food is delicious. Try the grilled shrimp on the stone and calamari. Their pink sauce is excellent.

6vyt0PiidnfXnl92JyFfRg.text: I have been searching for a good Italian restaurant in the valley and since this one was close to home I decided to try it.  The view is beautiful but unfortunately the food was bland.  I had a rigatoni with chicken and the food had no flavor.  The breadsticks were so bad that I would rather eat the Olive Garden breadsticks.  The beef carpaccio had a mustard that tasted horrible.  Nothing was positively memorable about this place.  Definitely would not recommend it unless you want a nice view of The Strip.

SHCRi4BQDV391a32f-9UfQ.text: Mi piace davvero! (I really like it!)  I had passed by this place for 6 months, never really thinking about going inside.  It was date night and our FAVORITE Italian place (where they called us by name for the last 14 years) had closed and we were really craving REAL Italian, not Americanized, chain food.  We were not disappointed! We always try the Caesar Salad, love a good one, and will leave a so-so one to wilt.  Theirs was packed with flavor, intense but not over done- we enjoyed every last bite!  The bread sticks were soft, and would accompany a soup well, but not really dip-able for olive oil and balsamic.  We each ordered the Linguine with shrimp, roasted red peppers, and scallops in a cream sauce, something I hate to do because I love trying different flavors, especially from a new place, but it sounded good and was SO OTTIMO (FANTASTIC)!  The shrimp popped, the scallops so tender, but the cream sauce was really the star of the show!  So well developed, rich and smooth!  The portions were huge and even though we kept taking bite after bite, the bowls looked full even at the end.  On top of it all you have this amazing view of the Strip, so unexpected, but along with the soft lighting and the friendly waiters, was just great!  About $80 for the two of us.

9ral3AnPSRUvCOYiMglg1g.text: I haven't even tried the food yet but lady bartender who is working today, Thursday 9/7/17 is absolutely rude over the phone.  Regardless if there are customers "waiting for drinks" and regardless if my "order doesn't make sense" please take the time to be courteous and either place me on hold or have someone who has the time complete my order.  I've worked in customer service for years, I absolutely hate when I receive terrible customer service from others. Especially if you work off tips, get it together.    As I mentioned, I haven't even tried the food yet.  Customer service has a huge part to do with my whole experience smh

oUKr3nF6VOHCU1EUMoIfIg.text: Such a shame.....I love the food and servers here but every time I come, I get attitude from the front desk hostess like she owns the place. I've worked in the restaurant industry and I understand how it gets busy on the weekends but the last thing I need is to be greeted with disrespect because that will ruin my entire meal. She can't ever answer a question without giving disrespect to me or my husband, I will make sure to catch her name next time. I'll give them 3 stars for everything else because it is a friendly and yummy place, and it has taken everything in me not to write a review but it's ridiculous....you get paid to seat people and greet people, don't act like you're better than everyone else.

VrgwAau8N0qpypR5Y4dCjw.text: Great luncheon experience Very attentive but not intrusive staff . One of our group was trying to remember an entree she'd had at dinner on a previous visit. Our waiter was very accommodating and was able to get us a lunch portion for a dinner special. The food was great. Also he brought tastes of wines we were asking about. The view is very nice. Love the no tank tops for men policy

WLhVThOnpUDcelXoZVDTlA.text: We are locals with two young children (5 and 3) and ventanos is consistently some of the best priced, well rounded, great ambience, and friendly service location. View is amazing, the owner/wine sommelier are amazing and they even had my frank family 2015 even though it wasn't on the menu. I have eaten here consistently and probably over thirty times, and I really have no complaints. Perfect, family friendly (but not too causal for not having an amazing date night) and their wine list is the best in Henderson. It's been around forever, but it still remains the best Italian in henderson.

0UoiuaOHB-aSr-k3MvRDYw.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in the city. Great views and service. The food is phenomenal. My favorite? Lobster ravioli with grilled shrimp and asparagus. So good! Entrees are about $25 pp. Very nice wine selection. They have a separate bar area for smokers with some slot machines (a few tables to sit down and eat in there too). Food is always fresh and delish.

-ea9MK9TiR1KeSaAS0YjcQ.text: I tried to find a reason to give this place at least 3 stars, but I just couldn't. Went on a Sunday night around 7:30pm, restaurant was pretty much empty. I should've seen that as a red flag but decided to give it a try anyway since reviews were so good.  We asked our waiter for his opinion on a few dishes, and he pretty much tried to steer us away from all 3 LOL Ended up ordering the shrimp on a stone appetizer, which were the teeny tiny baby shrimp that are the cheapest ones you can buy. Gross.  Got 2 different chicken dishes for entrees, both were very average. Skipped dessert because we didn't want to continue the disappointment.  There are SO many better Italian restaurants in Vegas. Will not be returning here.....

3R9znw0d47YBP6R5s4SiLw.text: I had the Shrimp and Scallop pasta on their special selection menu and it was awful. I paid $29.50 for a pasta dish drenched in rich cream sauce. It was more of an expensive soup than a pasta dish. My kids didn't like their pizzas either. We should've gone to Cheesecake Factory or Olive Garden.

Vpo7ebSqIfz8qfM5YxD5aA.text: Me and my co worker absolutely love this place we went every day for a week it was so good. We would go late so we would be by the bar and we ordered almost everything on The menu. You won't disappointed, we've probably told everyone who loves Italian food as much as us.

9xuiTF5yrRcz-qvI5zW3yQ.text: First our reservation made through Yelp and confirmed wasn't there. They did add our reservation when we called to make it earlier... We had the risotto balls as an appetizer which were excellent... My date's chicken marsala was great.. However I was disappointed with my potato wrapped salmon... It was just ok... Won't order it again... Our waiter did bring us a piece of the Tiramisu, as we were celebrating a birthday on the house... It was very good... All in all we will go again, but I won't be ordering the salmon...

fw_sduJ63IJkG8wxcyxo5A.text: I have never been disappointed with my experience at Ventano.  The food is always delicious and piping hot and the chef usually stops by to check on us.  The views of the strip are breathtaking at night.  Try to get a booth by the windows; or a table on the patio if it's a nice night.  We got stuck in the balcony, in the back next the glassed in bar this time and that was not my favorite location.   I usually start with shrimp on a stone for an appetizer,  but opted to just get an entree tonight because I was feeling like some old school chicken parm and the portion is massive!  I still did not even make a dent in the chicken or the whole wheat pasta!  Should have skipped the breadsticks entirely, but they are so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiano with whole wheat pasta.

x_grLrcpDL5Lr0w8N8qsHA.text: I have reviewed this before and I wish to add that our server Marcos, who has served us many times is exceptional. Always attentive and informative with the menu. Thank you for a great dining experience.

IV_DpFh-ub_uiFYgqyunEA.text: Yummy! Had their fettuccine salmon pasta!! It was delicious! We came here to celebrate my husbands new job and their service was superb.

UwCxUbL3C3X0Hl5PSrHAYA.text: Called at 4 pm and reserved the table for 6:45 Christmas night and when we arrived we checked in with the hostess about 45 minutes early just hoping that a table would be available earlier! After checking in with the hostess she told me that we were there too early and our appointment wasn't until 6:45 I told her that I realize we are early just hoping it table would open up sooner. There were four or five tables open for the entire 45 minutes we were waiting and we were never sat until our appointment time and the table we were sat at was open the entire 45 minutes. After we were sat it took 15 or 20 minutes to get a drink or for our waiter to even acknowledge we were there! Then after taking our order it took almost another hour to even get our food. Then after we were finished eating we were sitting there for another 15 or 20 minutes waiting on our check! Although the food was great the service was very crappy! When the manager came over to ask us how our food was it was very quick and uncaring and just seemed that he only asked because he had to not that he actually cared. We have eaten here many times but will not be back! I also asked the second Hostess who sat us why we could not have taken that seat 45 minutes prior and she said because the tables were dirty but that was complete BS and I explained to her that the tables were not dirty and they were ready to be sad and she began to argue with me that they were dirty and not clean. Attached is a photo of all cleaned tables while I was sitting and waiting

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

h--vqXoealtDExduKpnXqQ.text: From the moment the executive chef and owner Arnauld Briand held the door to welcome us on our first visit, our experience was stellar...one of the best ever. All of the staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. When asked for a menu recommendation, i went with her recommendation and had the crab-stuffed halibut, which excelled as an Italian and Seafood masterpiece without equal. Then there's the view. Sunset over the city of Las Vegas. Arnauld stopped by ours and many other patron's tables repeatedly to assure satisfaction. And then there was dessert. Great wine selection too. We will be frequent guests from this day forward. Don't miss this experience !

FwZFahHMtkkaMT9rLtB9qw.text: If your looking for heart warming Italian food, with a great ambience,& spectacular view away from the strip!!! This is the place to go! Your welcomed by a nice hostess, an then you see the awesome view! The kitchen is open, not only are your eyes pleased but your nose is! The service is great, they know the menu. They are more than willing to help you make a choice from the delicious menu, as well as wine parings! This place is perfect for date night, family dinner or just a girls night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak,&amp; Shrimp!! Big enough to split or a meal for the next day!
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Ohh the view, a picture doesn&#39;t do it justice!

gJwHaB6dC8t7XPnYAPggBg.text: Ive been to Ventano many times, and I've never had a bad experience. Their staff is attentive and the food is great. Recently, I started going there at night. I did not know this place had a bar with gaming machines that stays open all night.  First of all, the bartender is great. This guy Matt, he can truly make a drink. He spent a lot of time advising some of the regulars about wine, and he made me an original cocktail that was amazing. I ended up staying super late.  Second, they have a late night happy hour that starts at midnight where ALL FOOD IS HALF PRICE!!! So you get food that is very good, for half price in the bar. Love it.

B1AwTLjVyP1pjzukCx3GUw.text: Very disappointing. I had the mushroom risotto with chicken. Risotto was overcooked and the chicken had the tenderness of crisp bacon. This place has a wonderful view but unfortunately I've had better Italian food at Fazolis. This is the third time I've eaten here for business meals. All 3 times were poor meal experiences.     We were in the restaurant at 7 pm on Tuesday, February 28. Large party of 12

vPYGT3pEyw22YbJP9XyVNQ.text: LOVE this family owned restaurant.  The service is amazing.  They are gluten free knowledgable and will accommodate every dish with adjustments.  Ask for the gluten free flat bread!

-I1R6Ot5O308GJnoja1e6g.text: Probably one of my favorite local Italian restaurants. The view is nice and the set up is even better! I ordered the blackened chicken Caesar salad and it is the best in town! Definitely recommend it.

WeHgPjgW68--ebRFagiVug.text: WOW WOW WOW!!!   We came in late with a group of bartenders, long day, and we were starving!!! Half off the whole menu? Deal.  We ordered the steamed clams, steamed mussels, bruschetta, lobster bisque, spinach salad, cioppino, lobster ravioli, BBQ ribs, shrimp & scallops, and zeppoles...everything was EXCEPTIONAL (including the service, thank you Rafi)!!!   I'm currently in a food coma but already dreaming about what I want to try next visit. Veal and pasta fagioli next up YUMMM

HptvBmOgSPLjt3gW3HiC-A.text: Our local favorite...always good italian food, great service and nice atmosphere...perfect for date night!

NhPki0_PHC37RNg3_EDg7g.text: Very good seafood and pasta!  The service has been attentive both times we visited.  Great view of the valley!

FtF03Nqci5aNToIrik9W0g.text: great view.  excellent food.  nice patio.  definitely worthy of the reviews and worth trying.

wQ9B2aitL8_n31YaxB60EQ.text: Love it.. We didn't plan in coming here but because of other restaurants incompetent we ended up here.  Our server is wonderful, they sat us right away and ask if what we want to eat. She also mentioned how hot it is outside and we must have some refreshment.   Our food was excellent.  Lobster ravioli Shrimp and scallops  Calamari Steamed clams and mussels.   Oh my! no desserts.

RSG2J_Ncb5KkIzvgGwWACw.text: Great food, outstanding environment, beautiful view of the strip, comforting service, and good vibes.

gTl2hhdlvgj8rMedMBqfgA.text: Excellent restaurant, we made reservations and they had the table ready when we arrived. Wait staff took great care of us and the food was incredible! We will be back again soon and the views of the valley are just a bonus.

LRLKOr3mzwNdUGortGbeCg.text: This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I gave a few gift certificates to my brother to use on date nights with his girlfriend and they both loved their experience every time. He told me the food is always phenomenal and the service couldn't be any better than perfect!!! I came here on a random moment and the hostess kindly sat me in a booth that had a spectacular view of the Strip. I took a photo, but it really doesn't justify how breathtaking it looked being there. I would definitely recommend anybody that is looking for a romantic spot for a date, anniversary, birthday, you name it.. any celebration.. this would definitely be a wonderful option to consider.   I was greeted by a busser? named Kevin and surprisingly he took care of me during my whole time dining there. The first that I ever experienced, but I didn't mind at all, since he was very attentive and gave me exceptional guest service from being my server, busser, and runner. Even boxed my leftovers and refilled my raspberry iced tea without having to ask not even once!!!  After placing my order, Kevin brought out a brown bag accompanied with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar on the side. The idea of having two warm soft pillow bread sticks waiting for you in a brown bag was actually quite appealing and made it more appetizing to eat. It tasted light and delicious... warm bread sticks are hard to say no to... I indulged and enjoyed them.  For appetizer.. I ordered the Calamari Fritti. Love that it wasn't deeply fried to crisp, but just enough so you can enjoy the airy crunch and lightly breaded squid. I was given two sauces: a spicy marinara and a miso chili sauce that was in a black plastic sample cup to try out. Both sauces were delicious... the spicy marinara tasted so fresh like they just whipped that sauce together like it was made to order. The miso chili sauce was incredible in flavor... I wish they could make this in a jar to take home!!! It had this sweetness and then a tangy end note.. went very well with the calamari. I could have ate this like popcorn in a movie theater... stop only when there's nothing left :)   For the main entree... I ordered the Lobster Ravioli. The portion was beautiful... there were four plumply rounded raviolis with three enormously sized blackened shrimps, and three thick asparagus cooked to perfection. The pink sauce was oh so savory and the flavors were so balanced.. nothing was too rich to enjoy. The shrimp was tender and the spice gave it such an impact of delight. The ravioli was filled with a generous amount of lobster meat and the texture from the pasta itself was wonderful. Texture always gets me in pasta and this was definitely a winner.   I can't leave an Italian restaurant without trying my favorite dessert... Tiramisu!!! Great presentation and goodness gracious was it GOOD. One bite and I was dizzy from overdrive of joy. It comes with one lady finger cookie, topped with shaved dark chocolate flakes, and the filling also had bits of this flake, which was pleasing to break in your mouth and gave it... Character. The whipped cream was heavenly... so fresh and cooling to the tongue. I imagined bathing in this, it felt so silky and smooth in my mouth... AMAZING. The breading with the filling was luscious, soft, and moist. One of the best Tiramisu I ever had. Mind blowing magnificent in Tiramisu creations.   Overall, this place is striving with excellence.. in food and service. I came here right when they opened for dinner at 5p.m., not even 30 mins. and this whole place was packed. Must be a locals hangout or favorite. My favorite in Italian cuisine and definitely one that I rave about to many!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. The view is absolutely beautiful here.. This doesn&#39;t do justice! So so romantic! Haha
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. One of the best Tiramisu I ever had.. Light fresh whipped cream, soft moist cake.. Absolutely in love with this dessert!
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Lobster Ravioli.. So delicious!

sFYJwtL15aVgfUDbTMpoPg.text: One of the absolute best date night places in town.  Tonight was yet another wonderful night when we just wanted to go somewhere after a long week and it turned into a perfect evening out thanks to the service, atmosphere, view, and of course the food.  Mike always takes complete care of us, whether we just want an appetizer and glass of wine or we let him talk us into the amazing dinner specials.  Everything we have ever tried here is memorable and the only problem we have is not being able to finish, but we can always pack it up for later at home (even the unfinished bottle of wine).   Enjoying a lovely sunset from the patio and watching the city light up for the night is a bonus, as are the birds and flowers that make it so charming.  Everything starts with an oven-fresh bag of bread with a plate of EVOO and balsamic, then we usually start with a sizzling plate of oh so tasty shrimpies on a stone - even if we're going for the special it's hard to pass on this to start the night off.   The regular menu is fantastic, well portioned, and perfectly done, but we so often go for the irresistible specials - bone-in ribeye or sea bass or halibut or whatever it is that night, usually with outstanding crab cakes, scallops, or whatever they have that night.   This is one of those places that you're always sad to leave!  Although taking some home for a snack later or the next day helps a bit...

XyoTRhK9ukEpkRjV0_MGng.text: I can't say enough!  We were in Las Vegas on vacation and left the strip on a whim, overwhelmed with the pricey, under appealing food.  We happened upon Ventano's through an internet search and could not have been more pleased.  From the moment we walked in the place was amazing.  Danielle took fantastic care of us and the entire staff worked together to make the experience phenomenal. When we arrived we noted the fantastic view of the strip and the potential sunset.  The staff worked as a team to make sure that the sun was never a bother and in a single synchronized effort made sure that pall of the blinds were open for the diners to enjoy the majesty of sunset.  Add to that the delicious food and completely reasonable prices and I am not sure why there was not a line out the door.   If I lived in Henderson I would be a regular for sure.  Again, thank you so much for the special attention and for a wonderful evening.

bPjRQMKLKInuPR0j27rlFw.text: If you're a lover of lobster bisque, Ventano is the best place in the city to have it. They serve it in a bread bowl and it never disappoints! They also have great breadsticks that are baked fresh.

55GB1qO_XOYlRRcJNpLDqA.text: **Summary** - Decor - I love the ambiance. It's not too dark like Carraba's and not too "grandma's Italian backyard" look like some Italian places like to try to go for. It's half way between comfortable and fancy. A very nice date place. - View - A whole side of the restaurant is glass that overlooks a breathtaking view of the strip. - Quality - The food is a definite step above Carraba's and probably the best Italian restaurant I've tasted in Vegas. Flavors are spot on and the food is very fresh. - Price - Prices are on the higher end however. They range from 17 to 30. Most dishes are around $22ish. - Bread - Their bread is freshly made and very fluffy on the inside. It's not too buttery or salty like other places. They give it to you with the usual olive oil/balsamic vinegar combo, but I asked for butter. - Service - The staff were friendly with just the right amount of personality. **Ordered** - $10.50 Beef Carpaccio - This tastes the same to me everywhere (yelp.com/biz_photos/5zDP...). - $5.50 Insalata Classicche - Salad with balsamic vinaigrette. Dressing was slightly sweeter than average. Quite enjoyable. - $25.00 Cioppino - Seafood soup with a light marinara sauce. Shrimp were small, clams were big, and mussels were normal size. There was also clams and fish in there. No carbs. Not a lot of food, but I ate it with the bread (yelp.com/biz_photos/5zDP...). - $7.00 Caramel Pecan Ice Cream Cake - If you like caramel, you'll love this (yelp.com/biz_photos/5zDP...). **Recommendations** - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a nice date place or a quality meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. $7.00 Caramel Pecan Ice Cream Cake
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. $25.00 Cioppino
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. $10.50 Beef Carpaccio

dPd6zyG748XQ8voET0MVcg.text: Firstly, the service was good, so my review should not reflect on the staff. The food, however, was actually some of the worst Italian food I have ever had. The bruschetta bread was just chopped, under-ripe tomatoes with what looked and tasted like Kraft parmesan cheese. The menu stated it would have basil, garlic, and parmesan cheese...there were like, two little shriveled up pieces of basil on one piece of the toast. From a restaurant with a dress code and recommended reservations, I expected A LOT more.   The steamed mussels did not smell fresh, and our order had no noticeable flavor. My husband kept picking broken shells out of his mouth, as there were several partially shattered mussels in the bowl. We were so dissatisfied with the food that we cancelled our entree order and left. They were kind enough to comp what we had eaten so far (which wasn't much of the order).   We had REALLY been looking forward to eating there, and actually drove 40 minutes to check it out.   Side Note: The website gives the impression that the restaurant is upscale and classy, but it has the typical dated "Tuscan paintings on the wall" that most stand alone italian restaurants have. I could have easily seen past that if the food was authentic and flavorful. Unfortunately, it was neither.

Jtp65NFLrQu-5KDhWByxmQ.text: Hands down - my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! Great food, great service every time. Beautiful views of the Las Vegas valley.

15q8Yg7PISk2F66b0xx5Lg.text: I made a reservation for 6:15 at this restaurant.  Arrived a few minutes early and was advised by the host that we would be seated closer to our reservation time.  We waited.  After about 15 minutes AFTER our reservation time (6:30) we asked how much longer it was going to be.  The host informed us they were just waiting for occupied tables to leave.  I asked if we could eat in the separate bar or the bar in the restaurant as we had a late flight out and were on somewhat of a timetable.  She said we could.  The bar in the restaurant was too full for the three of us so we went into the separate bar, where we then waited for menus.  We had to go retrieve them ourselves.  Then we were greeted by the bartender (after he had greeted another couple who came in AFTER us) and asked what we wanted to drink.  He then disappeared for a few minutes then returned only to ask a person in our party if they were 21 (he was 20).  We were then told we could not eat in the bar.  So after all of this we wasted 40 minutes only to be turned away.  POOREST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!  I don't care if your food is excellent, if you can't be good to your customers you should not be in business.  It costs you NOTHING to be nice!  We left and will NEVER go back.

YDcrtxW8bPED3kDUZATPvQ.text: Their views of the strip are beautiful! Love it on the patio. Have to try the grilled heart of romain!! It is fabulous. They are very attentive and seem to care about your experience there. We have been here countless times and each time I go I have just as good of an experience as the last.   Their servers remember who you are and treat you as if they want you to come back.   Don't forget to sign up for their rewards card! It gets you $50 off after accumulating so much!

TAd8SydsAdOAnFHtVmJTIw.text: Atmosphere is nice, service was great. The food is ok. A little over priced for food that's just ok.ill be back to try the oysters and to check out the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Fish with scallops and risoto.
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Buccatini past with steak and shrimp in a tomato cream sauce

flZigc0i7eZzBDCKPGzMdA.text: I would just like to give a BIGGS Kudos to our server Austin..... We dined there on June 16th, 2017, He was excellent and extremely knowledgeable regarding the menu, sauces, portion size and everything across the board. We had a great dinner along with our company.  Again, Thank You Austin :)

LevEjJ-4KMjg8dmEBrZw-g.text: First visit, First meal, Good ambience, Good service, and, indeed, an Invitation to "Return Before Long"

B7lMFhb1vWIHkaAskA1b2A.text: Arturo was an amazing host. Food is always top notch! However, service is less than adequate - Arturo saved the day without him we would have not had dinner nor dessert or drinks. Manager didn't seem to give a rip- Mike - overall, food is great service is a joke - and manager ( Mike ) frankly.... was rude. If you are out for good Italian and don't care about management / service - this is your place! I am a regular diner at this restaurant - sadly the service has gone down quickly. And the "sit you in your seat little girls" were exceptionally rude. When I walked to the counter to pay my bill - of course because there was no waiter to take my payment so I had to pay at the take out door, the kids at the door upon explaining why I was paying here vs the table simply laughed and when I walked out the door mocked my party. Wow! For an upper class restaurant they have some pretty low class employees.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

NnPnX7tcuhEWAOvBeIAZbg.text: This place has been my ALL TIME favorite for years! My x took me here in 2011 and I have taken every x since then lol ;) best calamari best shrimp on the stone best bread best food literally just best everything !!! Ill

Ak-_uhsWIYKvAT31ikQ1XA.text: We have been going to Ventano's for nearly 15 years, and the fact that on a Tuesday night, the parking lot is nearly full, tells the whole story.  The views are fabulous - overlooking the strip.  The service is also wonderful.  I don't think we have ever been there when the manager does not help wait on our table - as he does every table.  Finally there is the food - always totally wonderful.  The shrimp on a stone plate appetizer should not be missed.  Other than than hard to recommend an entree, and all we have tried have been good.  Atmosphere is very nice - a bit loud, but only because it is normally fairly crowded.

lkSuxiBMmy0NePsPHWFKtw.text: Its funny how things work. I ate here once when they first opened up and found it to be a bit overpriced and pretentious. Anyway I tried it again for dinner recently and was so delighted. Prices are fair portions are huge and the food was excellent. I am an Italian that grew up in the Bronx New York so I'm kind of hard to please when it comes to Italian food. My only complaint is their table bread. It's that soft doughy crap like they serve at Olive Garden. Get some real crusty Italian bread in there and I'll be back weekly.

QfikjK-FGmiG6jlCCfBYgQ.text: Pricey compared to Olive Garden and portions aren't huge like some reviews say. This is a place for special occasions though. Packed but it was Saturday night at 7 pm I'd bring my family back. The food was good but nothing special.

X2m_ynsc4mxg4cnttyf3dw.text: Great atmosphere. Romantic indeed.  Cheese tortellini with pink sauce, bottle of merlot, meat balls,  warm bread and soon...desert! Ur lady will love this place.  Beautiful and very tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

jhz90X4K2w0_fC_9JG7D-g.text: We had a large party for a birthday dinner - 20 people.  Worked for months with restaurant management and everything went perfectly.   Food and service top notch with no delays between courses!  Special shout out to Mike and Adam!

psGIk2I9hGRCIH14Yfv1jA.text: Easily one of my favorite places for Italian in Vegas. I've been living in Las Vegas for 20 years and haven't found anything comparable to the food and service here. The grilled romaine is to die for and the staff is always so polite and attentive. Plus, an amazing mountain view of the strip while you dine. If I could give this place more than five stars I would!

B4BO-reXB7oIoEFEFxN2Eg.text: Regularly choose Ventanos for my Italian cravings. Clean facilities. Pretty environment, with a nice view at night. Professional staff. Great pasta!   My favorite is the fettuccine con funghi (pink sauce), and if not in a pasta mood, the rack of lamb.   I recommend to anyone.

WO3de-XGwCqLTP1nyWEV5Q.text: The food here is close to 4 stars.  For the food you get, I feel the prices are reasonable.  So with that being said why 2 stars???  Clearly the SERVICE, it is one of the wrost in this town, unless you are out for at least a 2 hour ONE course meal.  Really????  This has been the case the last few times we went.  So why go back?  It is close to home and I thought they might have it figured out...NOPE...  Why would you have 2 people to handle the front door and ONLY ONE Waiter to take care of tables????  Why have 3 runners and only one waiter???  This place has been understaffed for a long time and I just don't understand the logic.  It is not that hard to have 2 full time waiters.  We went last night, we were seated and told our waiter was Mark.  Close to 10 minutes LITERALLY, before he came over and asked for a drink order.  Two drinks came and away he went, no ask of an appetizer, nothing.  Another person came and ordered an Iced Tea and a hot tea was ordered as well.  LITERALLY FIVE minutes to get the teas.  Finally an ask was made for appetizers and one ordered along with the food.  The appetizer came and was eaten very very slowly and aboiut the time we finished eating it, the food came.   NOW, in the defense of the restaurant, the food ordered did take some time to prepare and was prepared with quality, care and appreciation for what was being served.  A request was made for more hot tea which took the 5 minute waiting game again.  Once we were done, the plates were removed from the table in record speed...why can't accompish this with drinks and refills??  We did not want desert, we asked for the left overs to be placed in seperate bags as we were going in two directions.  So do you think the SAME guy who took the plates remembered who got what left overs???  NO, this morning it was discovered this task, which was only 3 plates was WAY ABOVE the level of competence of the guy who took the plates.  We asked for our bill and then watched the waiter run around, do several other things and pass our table several times before he finally came back and gave us our bill.  This whole process of getting the bill, 10 mintues...Needless to say we paid cash as we did not want to wait for him to take the card and never come back even though at this point we were one of ONLY 4 tables in the place.    He is a nice guy, but handling more then two 4 tops for him at a time, not a good idea...if you are going to keep the doors open to a certain time and have 2 people at the door, 3 runners including the manager, more then one server would be a good idea.  I believe we are done with this place unless we come across a day that we can spend 3 hours in a place to get a salad and a meal.  There are places in town with comparable prices if not better, with comparable food if not better and service that will BLOW THiS PLACE AWAY....

dTVTLc_kmt6_tOVQN_NmKQ.text: I have had parties in their private room for  graduations, baby shower, rehearsal dinner and bridal shower. They do a fabulous job and their food is absolutely delicious.  The view is great too! My husband and I also go to dinner there with our friends and it's always really good!

Lv_8W82vwSxaqgRKauetrg.text: Everything about this restaurant exceeded my expectations. We were a party of three and the hostess went out of her way to help us find a quiet(er) table where my father, who has a hearing loss, would be able to hear the conversation. Our server was funny and was constantly refilling our waters and checking on us. Everyone was happy with their food and dessert. I would highly recommend the Shrimp Ventano, the vodka sauce was the best I have ever had.

M9YB0EAfksNTcjqg-venxg.text: Awesome food and service. Good wine selection. We will return for more.

Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Good Italian food. Great service. The head chef came out and sat and chatted with us.

qvt-vZSbUWxezQkZoBgauQ.text: This is our go to Italian restaurant! The location is great as it is away from the strip but has an amazing view. I have never had anything bad off the menu and the service is usually good. Wine is reasonably priced and sometimes you can catch some closeout specials.

Fy9yYQ_9Odf2o881zjqK3w.text: Wife and i been coming here every December for the past 4 years. We are from california and we always sit in the same spot looking at that wonderful view. We use it as our end of the year trip to review the past year. This last time we went there the staff was so nice to us as we had to wait a little while for our table to become free.  They continued to check on us to make sure we were ok as we waited. I must say that for some reason when you sit at this restaurant its just so conducive to sitting and having long conversations. Eventually our table became free and we had a wonderful meal and reflected on the past year and made goals for the year ahead. I just want to thank the all the staff from the owner who spoke to us to the hostess and the waitstaff. This place has just a incredible staff that really cares about their guest and it makes us happy to come here every December.

H0gf2SR4a1_5kQS_O5FSdQ.text: After we were finally seated it took another 20 minutes to have anyone take our beverage orders for just water and sodas. I know they were busy but it could have been better managed. We ordered all our food together and that took so long we had to ask for more bread. Once we finally got our food, it was good, but unfortunately the wait and slow service overshadowed it. We didn't end up leaving until after 8pm. So disappointed in this place.

y-wr3aA4WTwCzc3o8ksRBQ.text: Amazing food.... Great atmosphere.. and service was fantastic as well!! Gaskets-N-More Brenda Grose

xxldJDP8tbCXhtt2R4R6_Q.text: I've been several times most recently for an anniversary dinner. The service, food, and wine have always been excellent.  The view of the city is really nice.  We had dinner at sunset and got a booth next to the window.   I wouldn't recommend the espresso it tasted like strong coffee. but everything else we've had has been great.

HFPy5PCWsjkZeJaJIitADw.text: We only had an appetizer here- shrimp on a sizzling rock.  They were the small size shrimp, and it was a decent amount to share for 2 people.  The two sauces were outstanding- wasabi and miso.  Service was ok.  Atmosphere wasn't as nice as I imagined it to be.  We reserved on Open Table and mentioned it was our anniversary, but they didn't acknowledge it. Looking at the menu, I thought prices were on the pricier side.  Bread was ok, but like others mentioned, why in a bag?

ATkuakKj1wReQFmHV6IxrA.text: I am not sure how to feel about this place. I went here with a friend who raved about how awesome this place was. I have to say I was not impressed to start since we had a reservation and they still made us wait to be seated for 20 minutes. When we finally sat, no one apologized for us having to wait, and then we waited another 10 minutes just to be greeted. Bad form if you ask me. Once our waiter finally took our order, I got a German Riesling to drink and the lasagna. The wine was delicious except for the small fruit fly I found swimming in it....  The lasagna was pretty good, sauce was very thick and noodles were scarce.  If you like basic bolognase sauce and fresh cheese with about 2 noodle sheets then this is the lasagna for you.  The portion was pretty big even though it didn't look it. I did like it in the end but I didn't love it.   My friend had the baked clams and scallopini which both looked really good but I was too full to try it. The view here is awesome, and on a nice, clear night it is great for a romantic date night where you can overlook the strip with the sunset.   Overall I would say I am not sure if I want to give this place another chance since to me it was mediocre. Between the long wait, a bug in my wine and just okay service I can't say I am running back.

KzDAuRVyTa41o528X_MQ2A.text: This is a view with a nice restaurant built around it.   Beautiful view of The Strip.  Very romantic setting at night with a lovely patio area for those comfortable evenings.  We stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner.   Will definitely go back.  The restaurant has an "old school" feel to it, murals on the walls, red leatherette seating.  The service was impeccable, constant without being intrusive.  The food is excellent (we ordered several things off the menu, pasta,risotto, sandwich, pizza and fish) and each was flavorful and a good wine list.   The other reviews have gone into more detail so I would simply say -    Food - very good, hearty and plentiful Service - Excellent, engaged and impeccable Setting - Old school comfortable View - Worth seeing Bar - Full and embraceable Value - Good value - a little pricer than the million other Italian food joints around but oh so worth it.  We commend Ventano italian Grill & Seafood to you.   Lunch is very good but really, go have dinner and see how much the view adds to the experience!

8SiH1agkACVI2v1hU3QYhA.text: I just moved back to Nevada and I was so excited to eat a blackened grilled chicken Cesar salad. My friends and I used to come 2 years ago on the weekend and grab a salad. I was so disappointed, The chicken had layers and layers of seasoning, so salty it hurt to swallow. I had 2 bites and threw it. The worse part is I was so excited I bought 2, 1 for now and another for later and it definitely wasn't cheap. I won't be going again.

qXmWcEErfEymdKes7nUmlw.text: Put it on the menu as Kraft mac and cheese then.  I would have steered her away from it.  Going into a great restaurant you'd expect homemade.   She's 5, and cant eat a full adult portion.  Your response, even though I love your food, makes me NEVER want to return.

A3ngq1LVQ42k6N0TNAtSjw.text: I had heard great things about this restaurant and really expected to love it. This is a really big restaurant and space that can feel overwhelming when you walk in. Our table had a gorgeous view of Vegas and the mountains, however the staff pulled the shade closed for most of the dinner (likely due to sun glare) so we were disappointed we did not have the view for most of our meal. I was with a big table of 8 people. We started with appetizers, rice balls, calamari, bruschetta and fresh bread for the table. All were tasty. Several of us ordered Caesar salads before dinner. I didn't think to ask for the dressing on the side though I wish I had. My salad was drenched in the dressing making it by so great to eat. For dinner entrees, the table ordered everything from steak and potatoes, lasagna, eggplant rollatini, bolognese and seafood/pasta combo. The entrees took more than 2 hours to be served to us. The chef proactively came out and apologized for the long wait and offered to give us a special dessert. We were all in good spirits, enjoying the company and understood this sometimes happens. Once the dinner entrees came out, it was mixed reviews. I was given manicotti instead of eggplant rollatini, my seafood companion thought the scallops were chewy. Others really liked their pasta meal. I did not bother telling the server my meal was wrong because at that point we had been at the restaurant for over 3 hours and just wanted to leave. The chef ended up sending a large plate of ice cream, donuts, etc. for the table to enjoy. I might give this place one more try next time I am in town, but likely will try another restaurant since there are so many places to eat near Vegas.

3npJg1D_L7yoCC7_-hgpPg.text: The service here could be a bit better. When being seated we waiting 15-20 minutes for the server to take our drink/food order. The busser who handled our table was great. If it wasn't for him we wouldn't have been taken care of. We only saw the server twice - when he took our order and when he gave us our check. The food is average and a little overpriced. I'm not sure we will be dining here much in the future.

-t9B8agMmnSy8r70kq_Q8A.text: I wrote this in the line at in-n-out because I went to Ventanos for dinner but I'm still starving...came  on a date and was excited for Italian. The shrimp on the stone appetizer & breadsticks were good. The rigatoni with meatballs was worse than hamburger helper, so disgusting we couldn't eat it. The pizza and it had an awful taste to it, I wouldnt touch it. My date refused to complain, and paid the bill. I came because of rave reviews and maybe this was an anomaly, but definitely want the owner to know about my experience.

9I0b9hyZztGO50iV-W5kAQ.text: My wife and I met our friends there for dinner, it was fantastic, the bread sticks, the main course's everything was on point including the service, the view is wonderful and overall a fantastic evening.

z_8B3sIWlq4qd4o9SHncsw.text: The place had decent food but I probably would not come back again. It's one of those places where i feel it's a hit or miss. We can in at 5pm when it was dead, it looked like a senior citizen  hang out. We waited at the front to be seated for quite sometime before the hostess showed up. The hostess was a bit on the slow side and really did not enjoy her job. She preferred to chit chat with other employees rather than paying attention to the guests.  The food was okay for the price. I did however really enjoy the oysters. If i were to come back that would be the only thing I would come back for.

vvteMFiBQKH5eR97rSzCRg.text: Rafael is the best bartender I have had in awhile! I appreciate good service and this was phenomenal service! Simply The Best!

pL4epZOCNkAuXb7fr8MWeA.text: Excellent service! My real estate team and I were visiting from out of town and we were made to feel right at home. The staff was super friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was warm and friendly. The owner made a point to introduce himself and speak to us at the end of our meal. Flawless experience.

JOh19cYdu6OicRigZ6Q_UQ.text: My husband and I needed to get out and have a date night so I suggested this place because I saw it driving by.  We really enjoyed everything , the food the service was great. We sat on the terrace outside that has spectacular view of the strip  We ate a lot :) I had oysters,  salad caprese,  appetizer lamp chops sizzling ...than lasagna and cioppino.  Being spoiled by restaurants in Las vegas everything was exceptionally tasty and fresh ! I don't think they need raw onion on the mozzarella salad but I happen to be ok with onion , if you are not let them know .  The atmosphere is very cozy ... a family restaurant.  People were celebrating birthdays and stuff . I think I can even bring my 2 year old with me and it would be appropriate. Austin served us and he was very accommodating   l liked that he suggested a half portion to try a dish so I didn't risk being stuck with a dish I wouldn't enjoy. We all be back !

v84COFpk9Fc3IuXkC9lXLQ.text: Grabbed food here tonight after not having it for several years. So good! I'll definitely be coming back soon!

kNGfjZ1Ko8UVq7lGD0liNg.text: I want you to know it's challenging for me to give you three stars when your food is FIVE *****. We've eaten at your place a few times over as the food is simply magnificent. Salmon wrapped in potato is one of the best courses I've had.  I even see the Chef...don't know his name...come out and table touch. This is a lost art of service because EVERYONE loves a Chef!   Now, your SERVICE CHALLENGES. Firstly, I speak with experience.  All three of my dining experiences were the same in regards to service so it's important for you to know it wasn't a one time problem. I will not use any of your team member's names as I will never cause them embarrassment.  Overall, they're ALL incredibly friendly and try their best...but lack training.  My background is F&B Director at 5 Star Properties in CA and I ran F&B operations with Harrah's and Stratosphere. I will try to be brief.  1.  I made a reservation through OPENTABLE and requested a booth.  Host persons are nonchalant when telling me they don't honor booth reservations.  We arrived at 5:30p and did not get a booth. When menus were placed, you still had the KRUG tasting dinner on the left hand side of the menu. I became excited as I know Krug product well. But then continued reading  and the actual event took place weeks back. What? I hope your other guests didn't experience this.  2.  Each occasion of my dining experiences, your food runners deliver the food and do not know who gets what items...no matter what course it is. They call out the items. Also each time they served me FIRST instead of my wife and there's no excuse for this. I am old school. This is an easy fix.   3. We ordered a Caprese. They brought no side plates or cutlery. My wife and I ended up using our BB plates and silverware.  4. Entree's arrived. I had to ask for new silverware. Requested a refill of Butter Chard...arrived very late as our server may have forgotten or a bartender issue...things happen...I understand but it's the accumulation of service mishaps is why I mention it.  5. My wife requested a side of Parmesan Cheese....it never arrived. 6. When finished, service staff cleaned my plate first without even asking if my wife was done.  She still had items left on her plate.  They need to ask the table if we are finished. Please don't just clear plates! 7. Had to flag down Server for my check.  I left a 15% gratuity because they're friendly.  That's usually a standard with everyone who receives great service.  I on the other hand leave 25%-30% which is common for me if service is pristine.  These issues can be corrected in a days worth of training by your FOH Managers and BOH participation.  Bottom line is...we will return.  Your food is just too good to stay away. As I said earlier, your service staff is very friendly...they try hard....but they don't know the intricacies of fine-dining service.  And I do think of your restaurant as fine-dining. Is that a good assumption? Your food and ambiance represent that.  See you again soon and thank you for addressing these issues.

kAKwv-sNRon73vIuFlUyrA.text: We enjoyed our lunch here. Food was very tasty and the service was nice.  We came here one afternoon for lunch because we wanted seafood and Yelp search lead us to this restaurant. The interior is spacious and the tables are large, so we decided to order a bunch of stuff to fill up the table. Our server was nice, attentive and efficient. The portion sizes are quite big, and the ingredients are very fresh. Prices are reasonable.   Service was good. Bathrooms are clean. Easy and efficient is always good for lunch.

0-CFAxmdEwFMKTJcvmVY8Q.text: Very homey restaurant with an amazing view and a sometimes hoppin' poker bar!  They should add "bar" or something to their name as I imagine they are funded greatly by the gaming. The sign does advertise 24 hour gaming, however. I have the most experience with the bar area and it's a grand spot to enjoy some video poker and their very decent wine and beer selection. For example, they have 3 Dogfish Head brews in their "beer lineup", although only 2 were available last time I asked about them. One is gluten free (T'weasonale- w/ strawberries & honey) and I liked it a lot! Also, Crafthaus is on tap so right on! I gotta say, I don't think you'll get a glass of wine here that you won't be impressed by.   I don't eat here often but see others eating at the bar regularly. On their menu on their Web site, there's a disclaimer (disclosure?) "no split checks" but they will "gladly accept multiple forms of payment." Not sure how to even process that information!  Also, the latest wine list shown on their Web site is 19 pages long!  There's usually a bunch of regulars at the bar and I may be inclined to become one  if only the bar was nonsmoking! Sigh. I used to get gaming offers mailed to me and haven't received any in a long time. Double sigh. Check out the view, it's one of the finest of the Strip from this tony part of Henderson.

UtfppvtTtpEyLTFuEAa6eg.text: Service was extremely slow, not busy at all. Went on a Tuesday, early evening.  ordered pasta with a red sauce.  Should be simple, it was literally made of oil, yes oil, garlic and tomatoes.   Breadsticks were put on my bread plate in a brown paper To go bag, still trying to figure that one out.  Four people at the table and the busboy stuck the paper bag on my plate ?  Really expensive for what it is.  Everything had meat or chicken in it,  they had no vegetarian options.  Really a outdated place.    More for chumpy meat head Italians /Americans with a ball cap and sun glasses turned around backwards.   The sign on the front door of this place says "No tank tops". That sums up the clientele!

UGXC5x1ljTsMxqP4LJEEIQ.text: Very disappointing experience here. We arrived around 5:00 on a Friday and the restaurant was practically empty. The furniture really needs to be updated but the rest of the decor is fine. The green cloth booths reminded me of a Marie Calendars or Dennys from the 80's or 90's.   A gentlemen in regular clothes (manager maybe?) who didn't introduce himself came by to take our drink and food order. We started with the arancine and ordered the potato wrapped salmon ($27) and cheese ravioli ($21) with pink sauce for our entree's. Warm bread took a while to arrive but was hot and fresh when it did.   The arincine were huge. Full of rice and melted cheese served on marinara sauce. The entree's arrived and were presented nicely. The ravioli were just okay, nothing great and sure not worth $21. The potato wrapped salmon was overcooked and very dry. It was also very fishy tasting. I found out they use farm raised salmon and not wild caught so that may be the reason. Our original server never returned to check on us or I would have brought it to his attention.   For dessert we ordered the caramel pecan ice cream cake. It sounded much better than it was. It was a slice of chocolate ice cream on a chocolate crust and caramel sauce which would have been fine served like that. However they decided to pour a bananas foster sauce over it which made no sense and did not taste good. It completely over powered the ice cream and caramel, just way too many flavors together. Almost like a burnt banana flavor. We didn't finish it.   Service was very strange. It was odd we had one person take our order, a different person deliver the food, another person clear the table, another person bring the dessert menu and a fifth different person take the desert order and bring our check. We never knew who was actually taking care of us.   Overall a really disappointing dinning experience. 2 stars for the bread and arancine. Can't see returning here with so many Italian options in Henderson.

rwCBusJiMerUr5UisJFvyQ.text: I have forgotten how great this restaurant is. Went there for dinner tonight and sat on the patio. The view was as good as I remember. We where celebrating a special occasion, and I am so glad we went there. We had the shrimp on the stone, lamb chops and an antipasto to share as appetizers. They where all awesome. For dinner we all had entrees that where all amazing. The shrimp and scallops I had where incredible. All the others kept raving about how great their entrees where as well as how generous the portions are. For desert we shared the tiramisu and a cheesecake, absolutely fantastic. We where all very impressed with our server Carlos as we never waited or wanted for anything. This is a great restaurant with exceptional food and service.

XM6W8YqsBDKEox3Fi6twoQ.text: Got to say that the reviews i have read are True....very good, food and service. The food. I had chicken parmesan that was fantastic. Wife had the chickens fet. Another good choice.  One thing so important to me...hot food. There is nothing worse then cold food. Not here. All our meals came to the table really HOT. So hot you had to wait to eat it, no problem here.  Hot food, because of the service. We had 3 different servers tonight. That tells you this place cares about your dinning experience.   Also, voted one of the best views of Vegas. Sunsets are spectacular. View of Vegas with the mountain range behind, and the sun setting behind that.   Great patio and great food   Dont miss this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Hard to beat this view

YQ4Hwk0CuFbqOht3QIITFQ.text: This is by far our favorite restaurant in the Las Vegas area.  Incredible food, service and view make this a great spot for a romantic evening or a large group.  I've eaten here dozens of times over the last 12 years or so, and have never been dissatisfied or disappointed.

4XAkKQKaV9b2jYymBlEmzQ.text: Went here for dinner with some friends on Friday night around 5pm. When we walked in, there was no one in the dining area and only one at the bar. When the rest of our party showed up, a few tables were in use. By the time we finished eating, the place was packed! Highly recommend reservations for those dining after 7pm.  The parking is behind the building or on the north side, and the entrance is located on the south side near the gas station. I would recommend dropping off those who have disabilities or trouble walking at the entrance before parking.  When you enter you have the host station, to the right a small bar with gaming, and a large dining area. There is outdoor seating on the patio, which has a beautiful view of the city. We were lucky enough to watch the sunset which was spectacular.   Service was great, a main waiter and a helper. Menu is extensive with plenty of options. I went with the potato wrapped salmon in a lobster sauce. It was cooked  right, the potato wrapping unique and added a nice flavor to the salmon. The lobster sauce was a bit much but worked with the accompanying risotto. I enjoyed my food. The table got shrimp scampi, fettucine alfredo shrimp, and lasagna. All portions were plenty big enough. Prices are a little high, but you get a fine dining type of experience so its fair. My vodka cranberry was $9...ouch.  Overall, beautiful view, great service, and good food. I'll be back to try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Potato wrapped salmon with lobster sauce on risotto
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. View at sunset

w7yw--BftcZjvr4vVUPdVA.text: I was so bummed by my experience last night. I've been here twice before and the food was amazing and great service. We did not get either of those last night. The service was awful for only having possibly 5 other tables filled. The food was just mediocre. I've heard it's gone down hill, and sadly it has.

I'm not sure if it's the Italian style of slow service/ ignoring patrons, but whatever it is, it's not for me. It reminds me of how I feel when I go to Walmart... within 10 minutes of my arrival I knew I shouldn't have gone.

If u r a late night person Definitely go talk to him. Super sweet and fun to talk to and knows what's good to eat. The bread sticks with oil and vinegar is like crack. I inhaled my ribeye and shrimp!
