M4ECEdsKbdl_UX6S5lp-jQ.text: 5 star bartender, 5 star food. Raf is the best graveyard bartender in Vegas and all of the food was half off. He recommended the potato wrapped salmon with lobster sauce and paired it with the Mohua Sauvignon Blanc from the region of Marlborough, New Zealand. Thank you Raf, we will be back to see you soon!

twQrpq8KVKtttPyK9K3cvA.text: I absolutely love coming here. There are quite a few delicious Italian restaurants in the valley; this one has a warm, familial vibe. The open dining area would remind one of a family's house. The only obvious difference is, no family home would have booths for seating.  Also, good to note, they have a large deck area for dining. Perfect to watch the sun set over the valley. Also, a wonderful view of the strip.   On one particular night, my husband and I ordered the beef carpaccio - well, we always order it - the beef was sliced paper thin, the mustard swirled all over was just the right amount, and the insalata in the center was a beautiful contrast to the beef. The lettuce was slightly overdressed. Still amazing.  For main course, we had Rigatoni Portofino - instead of ham, I subbed with prosciutto  and added chicken - and the Saltimbocca with chicken. Mine was delicious! The prosciutto was a brilliant decision; added another texture to the dish, a crispy bite. The Saltimbocca, was on the opposite side of the scale - horrible. Sauce was too salty, the potatoes were done in the oven and then fried-finished in the pan, also too salty...   For those of you who've been to Italy or are Italian, Saltimbocca is traditionally prepared with veal. Why didn't the waiter suggest this to my husband, when he ordered the chicken!? Saltimbocca should only be offered as a veal dish. In my opinion.  We'll keep going back. One bad dish won't deter!

cnkCjgD0JtxIXKKv3Htsbw.text: Amazing Food, great service and outstanding wine!  Highly recommend you try Ventano Italian Grill when in Las Vegas, we will every time we come to visit...only wish we lived closer so we could come more often.  Michael, the GM has created the ultimate in 5 star dining!  Highly recommend the Veal Marsala and Creme Brulee!

-55a_9GZUJFCYggYS4lshA.text: By far the best Italian food in Henderson! The Alfredo gnocchi is amazing, cheesy buttery, melts in your mouth. Also can't forget about the shrimp on a stone for an appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States

BMX-SfBkwtkLe9Z-dQ4SvA.text: There is nothing special here, I can make better Italian food in my kitchen. In my opinion, this is over priced for average food. Don't waste your time or money. They service you bread sticks in a bag, but want $$$ for a glass of wine.

Ht-N3hSQWyiiBRAJQT_8yw.text: Well off the beaten path and well worth it to get better food and avoid the tourists.  This is a great Italian option located way out in Henderson.  As with almost anyplace in Vegas, the service excels.  I was very impressed with the hot breadsticks served with olive oil and balsamic vinegar as opposed to the salty garlic spread at a certain chain.  Our appetizer of lamb chops on a hot stone was amazing -- the lamb was cooked to perfection and without the grease that sometimes accompanies lamb. My veal Marsala was also excellent.  Unlike many other Italian places, Ventano serves the pasta to the side of the entree as opposed to beneath it.  However, they still provide plenty of the sauce to accompany the pasta.  In fact, the fettucine with Marsala sauce could be a meal itself.  I cannot recommend this place enough if you're willing to make a bit of a drive.

tFqUe7woixOsU05ygqePkw.text: Ventano Tortellini w/ shrimp is my go to! Always a great a experience at Ventano's. The bread is freshly baked, food is made perfectly and you get a complimentary Tiramisu for any special occasion you happen to be celebrating. My favorite time to go is for Valentine's day because it never seems to fail in creating that romantic ambiance. It also doesn't hurt that the servers are easy on the eyes...

VKKUegXcR2lQ8Rxt34HvwQ.text: The food was good and server great but one of our party of 14 received his dish 20 minutes after everyone else was served. By that time we had shared our dishes with Larry so we refused the dish when it came out.The server apologized so had to be a kitchen screw up. The chef was notified but never came out to apologize. Next time we go to FERRAROS on the corner of Paradise and Flamingo.

9qZ4GkHqal-VvgIEf0iFpQ.text: The food here is great but the service is lacking. Dined here early in the afternoon and there was only one other table seated besides us. Took quite awhile for us to get our food. Once we were served we were never checked on until we were finished and the server came back to ask if we needed boxes. Only after we had signed the receipt after we paid was I asked if I wanted more water. You will enjoy the food but be prepared to wait and ration your glass of water.

FMWMhOQBuyAYp_Pv6yEqDQ.text: Another fantastic evening at Ventano!  My husband and I have been here several times on our own and with friends so we knew it was a great choice for our anniversary dinner.  We knew Saturday evening would be busy and they had a large event going on in the banquet room.  In spite of the packed house we were seated at our reservation time and greeted promptly by the service staff. I LOVE the warm, fresh rolls right out of the oven; they were wonderful!!  We started with the stuffed mushroom appetizer and were not disappointed; scrumptious!!  My husband had a baked pasta dish with the spicy sauce and he loved it.  I had the Chicken Proscuitto and it was delicious!!  I couldn't wait to scarf down my leftovers for lunch the next day. The service was excellent.  We brought our own bottle of special wine and were not charged a corkage fee.  Las Vegas has several very good 'real' Italian restaurants and this one is my favorite!!  The view here is spectacular even if you are sitting inside.

ZGWST-D0UfxdoTEolKwhPA.text: WOW! What a hidden gem! Absolutely phenomenal food, and service. Great value for the price too. This will definitely be a regular stop for me and I can't wait to try more dishes here.

Wlp_l5JGOQFpudFd8nY5dw.text: Today at mid afternoon I went to order my regular plate of delicious Spaghetti Bolognese and was very disappointed with the taste.  The sauce was not hearty or flavorful like usual, but watered down.  I hope the recipe has not changed.  The presentation was unappealing with cut pieces of basil with brown edges.  As I was digging out the brown pieces of basil while the waiter stood there holding the cheese, I told him that the basil should never be cut until the plate is ready to be served otherwise they turn brown.  He forgot to bring me more basil but it would not have changed the taste of this dish so I let it go.  My guest ordered the gnocchis which were satisfactory but not exceptional or especially good.  We were going to place an order to go plus a dessert but decided against it based on our meals.

PeBAmfqosXrfhYiZGIbJAw.text: Came here with a reservation to sit outside at 8 on a Friday night. No wait at all which was pretty nice.  The prices here are pretty fair for the amount of food you're getting. The food itself is a three to four stars at most. Huge portions, so be prepared to bring some home ^^.  For the most part the service was just below mediocre. After we got our order we weren't checked up on anymore. I was left without water for the most part.   The ambiance of the place is very relaxing and romantic, and the parking was very easy.   All and all a nice place to go eat with a date, but I wouldn't come back here again.

zGCNjdHzQ8m5_fXhBHfMZg.text: Three of us had dinner here tonight to try something new and use a Groupon.  The dinners were OK--nothing exceptional nor outstanding.  For an appetizer, two of us shared the 1/2 pound of shrimp on a sizzling granite stone.  The shrimp were tiny things, but tasty.  The dipping sauce was quite good, but the shrimp could have used some more spicing.  One had a Caesar salad that was very good, perhaps the best dish of the evening.  For main courses, we had Ventano Spiedini (chicken cutlets stuffed with cheese), Risotto Alla Milanese with blackened shrimp(4), and Chicken Saltimbocca.  We all thought the dishes were OK.  The sauce of my saltimbocca was very good.  The person who had the risotto was disappointed with the dish. The chef does not use any salt.  My wife, who rarely salts anything, used more than I've ever seen.  We skipped dessert.  Service was very good.  Our server was top notch.  The bus person could have refilled the iced tea faster, but that was minor.  The view would be excellent on a cooler evening, enjoying the lighted Strip from the patio.  I don't think I'd return.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp on a hot stone.

ohKjsYVN11P0iCCzefFwRA.text: With Groupon in hand, my wife, visiting mother, and I coasted into Ventano for dinner on the way between Laughlin and North Las Vegas. We had reservations so were able to be seated in a comfortable booth, and the meal started off well enough, but too soon it became like riding a roller coaster that eventually fell off the tracks.   I thought warm bread brought to the table and left there in a brown bag was a nice rustic touch. Vinegar and oil were promptly poured, but I had to ask for butter THREE times before any was brought to the table. Calamari Fritti with a fruity flavored, miso-based Chili Sauce nicely complemented the large serving of tender, lightly breaded Calamari. And, a Lemon Aioli was also prepared and brought out on request. It was rather oily, but lemony as well, and it was a nice gesture of the kitchen to whip it up on short notice, and not charge for this extra condiment. The spicy Marinara Sauce also served with the Calamari was mild but not very flavorful.   A Caesar Salad featuring Romaine Lettuce as it should was enhanced by an excellent creamy Caesar dressing, but I had to ask for ground pepper to be sprinkled over the greens. Presentation was nice on a porcelain plate featuring a green leaf design.   At this point what ensued was a tremendous wait between remaining courses. For some reason, the waiter did not take our entree orders until 20 minutes after the Calamari appetizer was finished. Then we watched TWO tablefuls of diners who came in after we had already been seated get their entrees served before us, finish their meals, have their leftovers bagged, chat a bit while sipping wine, and then leave the premises before we were ever served any of our entrees.   The setting was romantic, with a very nice view of the Stratosphere in the distance. But by now my wife was understandably grumpy because she was starving! It was around an hour of dead time before the entrees were at last brought to us. When they did, Shrimp Angelo with Penne coated in Lemon Butter Sauce was good but not so for real thick Alfredo Sauce. And, I was surprised to see that, rather than being cooked within layers of veal and sage, just one length of Prosciutto that didn't even appear to have been fully cooked had been spread on top of my Veal Saltimbocca. And, only little pieces of sage were mixed in with the veal. Otherwise, the veal in a light amount of Lemon Butter Sauce was tasty next to Fettuccine Alfredo. But this was not classic Veal Saltimbocca. However, Roasted Potatoes were great.   We were never given a chance to order dessert. Instead, our contrite server, unbidden, brought out an excellent Tiramisu that was not too heavy on coffee flavoring, and said that this was compliments of the house to make up for our long wait between courses that he claimed occurred because the kitchen "got behind." But he didn't explain how other later-arriving diners were able to leapfrog us in receiving their food orders.   At Ventano this night, I even ran into aggravation inside the men's restroom. First, the water from a faucet would not shut off. Then I learned that only one of two so-called motion sensor towel dispensers was working. What ensued next was a battle to attract the attention of this Sensor Cut paper towel machine to recognize my frantic movements and cajole it to finally disgorge two paper towels so I could dry my wet hands.   I haven't decided yet whether or not I will give Ventano another chance to redeem itself. The food was pretty tasty on the whole, and the ambiance very nice. But there are so many other Italian restaurants in the Las Vegas valley where the food is equally good or even better tasting, and where one doesn't have to be concerned about possible one- or two-star service to accompany what could very well be four-star food.

H5rpjncE6QHGGLxF3_qj0g.text: Great experience. I was recommended this place by two of my co-workers. I have heard about it for quite some time, but since it's nowhere near my neighborhood, I hadn't made my way down there until yesterday for Mother's Day.   My fella and I took our mom's here for a Mother's Day lunch. Both of them adore Italian food and we wanted to take them some place they hadn't tried before. My fella isn't as keen on Italian food as the rest of us, so he wasn't thrilled, but wanted to make the mommies happy.   We walked up and the smell was intoxicating and inviting. We asked for a window table, which is totally worth it by the way. There are great views of the strip, It would probably be much better during the evening to see the lights on the strip, but it's still worth it.   Our server was incredibly friendly and helpful. The food was delicious and even my fella was sold on this place.   I ordered the Cioppino, since I was trying to eat a little lighter than usual after a very filling meal the night before. The Cioppino was heavenly. Tasty and fragrant, just as I was hoping. My mom got the lasagna and she was in love with it. The portions were large and even after eating and sharing her meal with everyone, there was more than half left to take home for dinner. My fella got the filet with shrimp and he loved it. The shrimp were grilled and delicious. Great choice.   I was looking around from table to table and everyone's dishes looked great. I can't wait to try this place again in the evening when it's warm and clear enough for a nice view of the strip on the patio. I won't even mind the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Angelo
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Shrimp
Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Lasagna

0Uf9sfMlSsJfRWxlILegdw.text: The food was incredible!! The owner and all of the staff were amazing and friendly from the moment we walked in the door. We felt like family. My wife and I were visiting from Puyallup but felt like we were home. Thank you for the incredible experience!

wC-QPtv3E5HOxJR4h8HwIQ.text: Had dinner on Valentine's night. Even thiugh we had reservations and on time, we waited about 15 minutes to get a table. The hostess was kind enough to apologize for the wait. As soon we were seated we were given warm bread at the table and drink orders taken. Haven't been to this restaurant in awhile, seemed very crowded with tables to maximize the space. This took away from the ambiance of a nice quiet restaurant. Despite this rocky start, the food was great! The portions were out of control. The portions could easily feed 3 people. My son commented that he really liked his chicken fettuccine alfredo- that is huge coming from a teenager. The service was also great- very attentive and friendly.  We will be back again when it's not so busy so we can get a booth to enjoy the views of the city from the big picture windows.

iqKkPPDV_zRGB1ZEE6uhdQ.text: Well, last night's visit was horrible.  It was our wedding anniversary, and we had some of the worst service I can remember.  Our waiter (Austin) was out of his league, and pretty much ruined our evening.  We ordered a bottle of wine, and ten minutes later we were told they didn't have it, so we picked another.  We ordered the bruschetta, and sadly the bread was rock hard, and the topping was flavorless.  They also forgot to bring it to us before our entrees.    The main courses were good, thus the two stars.  After they were delivered, we were abandoned.  After finishing the meal, we go 20 minutes without a check in from our waiter.  He was over polishing wine classes.  We moved all our plates and glasses to the edge of the table hoping that would spark a visit.  Nothing.  We had to get the server's assistant to clear our table.  She was able to get him to at least bring our check.  There was no mention of desert, because at this point it was very clear he had failed us and wanted to end his shift.  When you are shelling out over $100 for dinner for two, I expect good service.    The Vegas valley has an abundance of great food, so there is little room for error.

NGjPfi0AFtK8YGh3OrEDVg.text: Roasted rack of lamb with the drizzle of dijon is to die for! I've been coming to Ventano's since 2013. The view at night is amazing the servers are always friendly the music is perfect.

QjFjaTInRfo64NJDmsDBSA.text: Ventano is our go-to-place for this Henderson family's birthdays, anniversary and other special occasions.The reasons are simple: the pasta tastes fresh, the service is awesome, and Arnauld (owner) is friendly, funny and a great person.

ThbOXXMDvZYper6B2bH-Rw.text: Extremely poor service. With a reservation for a booth, had to wait 20+ minutes for a table with other customers arriving later receiving the booths.  Had to ask constantly for our server, Michael, even when we were one of four parties left in the restaurant. Never saw Michaels face after he delivered our food......had to ask twice for our bill, a busboy took our payment. When asked if Michael was still there, he assured us he was. Again, we never saw him.  Food was fair. The special, Dover sole at $28, was so tough I could not cut it with my knife, but no one came by to check on our meals.  When asked to speak to the person in charge, the hostess replied to go to Yelp. Lovely way to do business.....? In reply..... Mr. Briand....we were in on 10/21. Our reservation was at 7:15

qny0tHhWRrLm-M3jQYNguQ.text: Had puttanesca and it was great. Tried the shrimp on a board app also very good. Caesar salad was just ok.  Service was some of the best we've ever experienced. Think their names were Javier and David. Good work guys.

KKtPlUlc5KJNGM6z3uw71w.text: Ambiance is nice. Great service. Clean. Attentive staff.  Our waiter said that the restaurant is known for their 'dinner specials' so I chose the sole with crabmeat with risotto and scallops. This dish was good.  Nice size scallops (3) and the risotto was creamy and tasty.  I wish the chef added more sauce to the fish (sauce was delicious). The crabmeat was a bit much for me atop the sole, but it wasn't bad. The presentation of the dish was executed exceptionally. You can see the kitchen staff took time to plate their dishes. Overall it's was okay, but not worth $35.  My sister ordered the chicken scalopini -sauteed onion and mushroom with white wine tomatoes and butter. This dish was good but deceiving. At a glance it seems like it's a white sauce but the plate came out and it was a red (more like marinara sauce). It was still yummy, BUT not what we were expecting.  The Caesar salad was yummy (a bit on the tart side) and the portions are huge!!!! An order of the funghi ripieni (stuffed mushrooms) was brought to our table but we sent it back.  It wasn't terrible, but not what we expected.  Very basic -stuffed with seasoned breadcrumbs and baked. Not what we were expecting, but again not horrible.   For desert we ordered the creme brulee and caramel pecan ice cream cake.  The creme brulee was yummy (custard was good) but the sugar didn't caramelize right. The caramel pecan ice cream cake was meh.  Wasn't worth trying you could tell they order in bulk and keep in the freezer.   Overall a good experience and I will for sure come back. It's a nice gem in Henderson. I love the outside lanai and the panoramic views of the city of Las Vegas.  Pretty much any seat in that restaurant is a great seat. I would stay away from the specials and order off the menu next time tho! Hope this helps!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Caramel pecan ice cream cake

JdOBWbeipGWYsFxv2wpeQA.text: It is always fun to trust Yelp and win!  Excellent food and friendly service.  I liked seeing the chef walk around greeting patrons.  Marsala sauce was perfect.  Cajun seasoning on the shrimp had just the right kick.  I like trying local places off the strip when visiting Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Lovely view.

UG77rxvwofUEtHbhxpsyJg.text: The owner of this Restraunt took the time to respond to my review and thanked me! I must say it was a well deserved review, the experience here was great and it's great for locals and the community. This business owner has a True passion for his business! I will be back and more often...

zarAC4VqjcIERdhd15-DbQ.text: GREAT local vibe & gorgeous view .. Had the tortellini, absolutely DELICIOUS. Service was wonderful. The GM Michael is awesome. He accommodated our huge party for a recent celebration and made our evening one to remember!! Our server Marco also exceeded our expectations. Overall, a great experience.

34DbPa3QfMt-MlOrMCcd2w.text: Always good food and wonderful service.  If you don't care for Italian try the ribs and everyone should try the risotto.

BPiAyxfVDxdAeZyDZusHVQ.text: wow; 1st time, adam our server was great.  large portions and very good food. bill/anne kamel

gD8p31kJAbiiDO-OQl8aUw.text: I normally reserve the 5 stars for proven restaurants.... Ones I visit often so I can see a pattern.  But since I am visiting here, and found it on Yelp, I thought I would share the love.   This place is just.  Very.  Good.  The service was great.  We were seated almost  immediately at about 9 PM on a Saturday.  From the apps to dessert, service was great. Wine list is adequate, decent prices. We had the shrimp on a stone for an app and it was delicious.  We shared a spinach salad and the portion was huge.  We both had the steak special, cooked medium rare, tender and delish!  The garlic mash potatoes were warm and creamy, the green beans just al dente. Portions are very generous!  We have lunch tomorrow.   For dessert we shared creme brulee.  It was a little to soft for my taste, but not enough to knock off a star. Overall, an excellent experience. Highly recommend!!

74KaF-srSm6-88vKkHPZmg.text: My wife and I decided to range far afield to have dinner and a movie...all the way to the other side of the Valley. After reading the reviews here on Yelp, and seeing that this restaurant was close to the theater we were going to, we decided to give it a try. After eating there, we decided it was time they got a justly deserved 5-star review.  Since we were going to a movie at 7, we arrived early and there were only 3-4 couples in the entire place. By 6 p.m., they were jam packed including a large wine-tasting dinner and a large wedding party.  From the moment we arrived and were seated at a booth looking all the way out across the valley to the strip, until we polished off the last bite of tiramisu and last sip of cappuchino, the service was immaculate, attentive without hovering and helpful with suggestions. The server recommended an excellent bottle of wine and, when I couldn't make up my mind between eggplant parm and the capellini alla pomodoro, she said the eggplant comes with a pasta side and she would have the kitchen do the capellini. That sold me.  I had read that the portions were large. The wife and I usually split entrees but she wanted the penne arrabiata which I don't care for and she doesn't care for eggplant, a recent addition to my 'likes'. True to what we had read, the portions were huge. She ate about 1/3 of her penne and I ate about half of my eggplant and capellini...enough left for dinner the next night.  As to the qualify of the food, I can only rave. I read that someone complained that their food was served too hot. Well, one of my biggest peeves is when food comes to me lukewarm as if it had been merely reheated or had been left to sit under the heat lamps. Both of us received food that was steaming and piping hot, so much so that we actually had to give it a minute to cool down. It was clearly right out of the oven or skillet.  Once I took my first bite, I could hardly keep from burning my mouth because the eggplant was too good to wait and the capellini couldn't not have been more perfectly 'al dente'...not mushy or tough...perfect. The sauce was amazing. My wife also loved her penne arrabiata although she said it was just a little too spicy for her.  We finished off dinner with 'due cappuccini' and tiramisu. The cappuccino was perfectly hot, just the right foam and just the right espresso bitterness. Needless to say, the tiramisu brought tears to my eyes as it is my favorite desserts and this was really one of the best.  As to the price, we ended paying about $100.00 including a $32.00 bottle of wine. We have paid a lot more for a lot less elsewhere. Considering the atmosphere, quality of food and quality of service, we felt it was a great value.  We wish we had something like this on the NW side of town and can easily see us making the drive again to eat at this wonderful restaurant.

Tc3ZI9x-0VxcTp7fy-_CYg.text: I love this place!  Every time I eat here the service is absolutely off the charts.  The lunch menu is as good as the dinner menu!

StwwF5l736UEfSZfA6WShg.text: I have been going to Ventano since they opened.  In fact, they weren't even on the culinary map of Vegas when i started going to them.  My wife and I had our wedding reception at Ventano in October of 2010.  We were a small party but they did a great job.  Mike is the wine guy and a nice guy all around.  He help us out with planning our dinner.    As for the food, where do I begin.  Shrimp on a stone is a great beginning.  The lamb chops are another great start.  I always order the Rigatoni Portofino for my entree.  It is one of Chef Arnold's creations and a great one.  Tip: It is even better the next day.  The wine list is extensive and reasonably priced thanks to Mike.  If you are able to attend one of the wine dinners, I suggest you go.

DhA0qEXpMO0TFO24z36gNA.text: beat Italian food in vegas... amazing view, will continue to go here til i move ! great job mike

Ul0Y_MAX8B-NaLS422siWA.text: Easy large parking lot. Went into the bar first and tried to order a crown royal but no luck. Unbelievable that they are just out of it. Ok I won't rant but it's UNbelievable.  So the great breadsticks came and asked for butter to go with the oil and they were hot and just perfect. We ordered the grilled shrimp on the rock appetizer and clams again tasted great and the presentation is nice. Main course was angel hair pasta with marinara and meatballs. This time all food was excellent and service for dinner was good. It was busy so service wasn't over the top but good. No room for dessert but will be back for the bombalinos.

Photo of Ventano Italian Grill & Seafood - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken scaloppine with pasta. Great sauce and served perfect temperature.

_UN82HgVLZL03EbNgAPrew.text: This is usually my to go place. If I didn't  have a feeling of neighboring and a relation to the owner and GM not sure if I would ever go back. Went for prime rib, very disappointed and some of the worst I have ever had. Gravy on prime rib, who does that. Ordered medium. It was gray and cold. The only thing worse was the service. All that for $38 a plate.

G1oqZvq9UiUiyTK9IVuOkg.text: I enjoy so many things about this Restraunt but they're just not consistent. The main chef and servers are awesome but it seems at times a line chef or two must not care about what they create. One thing we've never enjoyed any of their special dinner dishes. I'll keep going but stick to my favorites.

RyHxvceHxAkQNenjs41eZg.text: Very good Italian food in the Henderson area. I've been here 1/2 dozen times as it is walking distance from my house and have never had a bad experience. The staff is very friendly. I've had a variety of appetizers and main dishes over the course of my visits. All of them were good. I haven't had a bad dish yet so I would suggest picking whatever sounds good to you.   I've always recommened a wedding party of nearly 25 people from out of town to check this place out. At first they were hesitant as they were staying on the strip and it is about 15-20 minutes away but once they went they loved it and thanked me for the recommendation.    If you do go to this place I would recommend dressing nice. It is not the kind of place where you wear a tanktop, workout type shorts or flip flops.

W5sSIg5uitwfAcW60cIoRA.text: It was alright. I went in with high hopes and was a bit disappointed. The bar area is a gaming area with a couple of small booths. They do serve food in there, but it's small and icky. So I opted to be seated instead. The dining room is nice. Not romantic or anything. Like a step up from the Olive Garden. There were a lot of families with kids there. The view of the Strip is quite nice. (Tip: Ask to be seated by the window so you can enjoy the view.) The service was great. Very attentive and friendly. Perhaps I just ordered the wrong items? I started with the oysters. They were served on ice with a lemon (with no sleeve / catching thing) and just cocktail sauce with horseradish (no vinaigrette). They were ok, but didn't taste all that fresh. I then had the linguine with clams in red sauce. It was served with the clams in the shells (which I love), but they were all mixed in with the pasta, making getting the clams out a challenge (all the linguine was tangled in the shells). When I have had this dish before, the clams are usually on top around the sides and not mixed in. The sauce was not "zesty" as described and was quite watery. Not a particularly good food experience. But the by-the-glass and by-the-half-bottle wine list was decent. And the service and view were great. Perhaps I'll try it again and order something different. But my initial impression was it's something just a step or so up from a chain place. There are definitely far better Italian places around town.

RuAF8qP688od2MpFZ3ZRWw.text: We had a reservation on July 4 and we came few minutes early to check in.  Noticed a lot of people waiting and tables empty. We had to wait over  20 minutes to be seated.  Asked hostess what was the hold up she explained they were still seating people that had reservations 20 minutes before ours and the computer tells them who is next.  Got to outside table 108 out there and finally got water 10 minutes while other people seated after us got drinks and bread.  Dinner was ok my husband had seafood and some of the clams were not open sign of bad clam no pasta with dinner they should of not served the non-opened clams daughter's pasta was fine sauce was good, I had lemon chicken and chicken was fatty. Asked for bread sticks never got them.  Also outside there were steamers and they were so overpowering we couldn't see and my daughter got really wet.

7epJpCbAhjWps9T1CXE8_w.text: Very good food. Pleasant staff. Great view. Love the rock shrip. Really worth the trip!

uK9Q-ILpHay8Y0mZBqo9Ig.text: I've been here a few times and have had very good experiences. Honestly, I'm not a fan of Italian typically, but this place makes me forget that. They have many grilled items that I enjoy as well as some of their pastas. My girl and I took our mothers for Mothers Day and they loved it. Great views of the strip, too. We'd come more often if we didn't live so far.

FEx1_DpM7RVTV-wn-WaVLQ.text: THIS is where we always take friends and family when they come to town.  View, food, great wine selection and service where you feel at home.

0cTNALzeFZurBDb4B53gHA.text: The atmosphere of this place is great! However, the food is average at best.  I would've have given the place four stars and the food two stars, hence the three star rating.  The view and out door patio are terrific! They had a nice wine selection and the Riesling was delish.  The staff is excellent in every aspect.  But, I found myself wishing the food was just a bit better.  They give you bread sticks in a paper bag before your meal with olive oil and balsamic for dipping.  Yes, this is cute and the bread stayed warm,  but it didn't taste fresh or house made.  I had a Caesar salad which was pretty good and definitely a large portion for a dinner salad.  For the main course, I had capellini pomodoro. It was okay.  Nothing to write home about. I think they used canned tomatoes.  It was a huge portion and I don't think I even ate half of it.  My husband ordered the ribeye steak and shrimp special, which I of course sampled.  The steak was covered in a peppercorn sauce.  The sauce itself was good but too heavy and not necessary on a good steak.  Plus the sauce looked like it sat on top of the steak for awhile and had slightly congealed.  He loved the shrimp.  It came with au gratin potatoes which looked more like mashed potatoes au gratin style.  They tasted okay but perhaps they were a day old.  This time we did not have dessert.  I was craving pasta primavera with fresh vegetables and they didn't have that option on the menu.  Before we completely write this place off, I am definitely going back to try a different dish and dessert.  It really is a lovely restaurant.  I want the food to live up to the staff's service and the perfect view of the city!

GuEIkCn3X3px3Jp3V2xh0g.text: I think I may have discovered my favorite salad in town here. Its not a healthy salad by any means, but it is quite tasty. The Grilled heart of romaine salad. I think I could go back every day. The caprese salad was my old standby, but after being a little adventurous and trying the GHOR salad, I was hooked. Also, the shrimp on a stone, or lamb chops on a stone starters were awesome. I didnt get an entree. because that was enough to fill me up, that and all the beers :) I recommend this place if only for its salads and app's. Plus there is a great patio, with an amazing view of the city.

KHDkZ6V7k-FrvptDyfPprQ.text: This is the second venture, I believe of the Carmine restaurants in town. They offer the most ridiculously amazing Italian around, along with a hot Italian serving staff to bring it to your table. I do remember both my boyfriend and my father telling me to shut my mouth and stop drooling over the busboys...there really is something about a restaurant with a cute staff that will keep you coming back! But, back to the food...there is an oyster bar, or a gelato bar, they have switched it back and forth a few times, but regardless, both are great for sitting and sharing a coffee and gelato, or oysters and some vino. What is best about Ventano's however, if it's after hours atmosphere. After the restaurant has cleared out for the evening, the bar remains open. It is a pretty standard bar, but they leave the patio seating that overlooks the city open. When it is a clear night you can see the entire strip, and look down on parts of Green Valley as well. The bartender will come check up on you while you are back there, so you don't even have to get up for drinks. It is a casual spot for a night out, without huge crowds and loud music. Instead, the crowd is minimal (if any) and the music is soft instrumentals. Go for the food, but stick around for a relaxing evening on the patio...pretty fun!  Recommended entre: I always get the gnocchi, but with marinara on the side.  Recommended drink: Ask you server what red wines are available, I have yet to go wrong with any of their picks.

-l4ovpZgQqJZdzmPvXJfiQ.text: I LOVE this place!! We go at least once a month. The food is incredible, and I love their shrimp scampi. Honestly, have never had a bad meal. We like this place so much we have had Christmas dinner there the last two years. My only slight complaint would be that occasionally service is very slow.

8Q0nNXuzMaE4yI3PPFn_xA.text: This was by far one of the worst restaurants I have ever eaten in. First they brought the bread to the table in a brown lunch bag. We opened it to find small long rolls, heated but with no taste. Then we had the bruschetta. It too had no taste. Lacked garlic and good bread. Next we had baked little neck clams. These also were tasteless except for the chemical taste the clams had like they were kept in a icebox that was just cleaned with bleach. Two of us ordered the shrimp scampi. The shrimp wasn't bad but the asparagus tasted burnt. My daughter had the Thanksgiving dinner and it was all bad. The turkey was too thick. The stuffing was lumpy and tasteless along with the potatoes. My girlfriend ordered a dinner which had to be sent back because the breading on the shrimp was burnt. My daughter got a choice of pumpkin or apple pie. She chose apple to go. When we got home there was pumpkin in the bag. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. Awful!!  I am from the east coast. This is definitely not an Italian restaurant.

jl2Top1EPUEvFuujIfl_tw.text: I don't like to write bad reviews, so I save the bad ones for the places that are really bad.  My husband and I went to Ventano for date night.  Since my husband works 6 days a week and we have 2 small girls, date night is a rare occasion, we were looking to enjoy the neighborhood restaurant that we had never visited.  The girl at the door quickly greeted us and was pleasant showing us to our table.  We were shown to a table on the balcony.  We sat there 20 minutes before even a server or anyone came to our table to bring us water.  They said that our server would be right with us and he did come by and dropped off bread and said he would be back to take our order.  He seemed rushed as it appeared that there were only two waiters in the place with an almost full restaurant.  We could see our waiter through the large windows on the balcony.  We watched him greet people as they came into the restaurant with hugs and kisses and taking their order right away.  He did that to about two tables, which took another 30 minutes.  We sat there for about 50 minutes without putting in a food order, eating stale bread and water.  Enough was enough!!! We left and went to Settebello, which had much better service.

BBY45BspMF5VOgX9jc1JEw.text: My family and I just love this place. Fresh, real, consistently awesome Italian food. My dad is a "REAL" Italian and swears this is some of the best stuff he's ever had. The grilled romaine salad is excellent and something I've never had before but sure am glad I tried it! The shrimp on the stone is a must EVERY time we go there, the dipping sauce is addicting! I always seem to order the Ventano Tortellini, HIGHLY recommended! Chicken, mushrooms, tortellini in a pink sauce covered with cheese and baked in an oven. Its like "adult mac and cheese" and I can't get enough of it. My dad usually gets linguine with prawns and scallops and fresh basil, and raves about how fresh everything tastes and how perfect the pasta noodles are cooked. They also have a nice wine and beer selection for those interested. The staff are all super friendly and always remember us when we come in. This is a great neighborhood restaurant that is as good as anything on the strip or anywhere else. Prices seem fair because i'm ALWAYS happy with what I eat, I'll pay a few extra dollars for something I truly enjoy eating. And i havent had anything here that i didnt like. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for really good Italian food. Also, the view of the strip out the huge windows (or out on the patio) is amazing! We'll be back soon! Keep up the great work guys!

bZKcLRLwCkFQUvatTxuCOA.text: Great food but poor service. Been there many times but after Saturday 11/22 I don't plan to go back. We waited a half hour past our reservation time to be seated. Then waited another 15 minutes for a waiter to come to our table, so a friend went to the bar himself to get our drinks. Eventually Manager Mike came over and apologized. We order an appetizer, and the manager offer to add a little extra to the plate. No complimentary appetizer or dessert for our excessive wait.  Finally the waiter came and it got better. Food was great but we did not get offered drink refills. We finished our meal and the waiting began again. The busser cleared our plates but the waiter still had not come over.  After 10 minutes we asked the busser for our check. Still no waiter or manager.  No offer for dessert, no drink refills, just waiting. The busser took the bill and we walked out without the waiter or manager saying have a good night.  A total disregard for customer service left a bitter taste. We will not be going back to Ventano.

rNiWyWzFYQ7f9FoqCk4DrA.text: Love love love this place! Atmosphere is great, food is just as great. My only complaint would be service at times could be lackadaisical. Thumbs up for all else!

vAWKGkLS4sc3h5hhN3sr0g.text: After reading the reviews and seeing how many people liked it, we thought we'd try it. The view of Vegas from inside the restaurant is probably the best feature of the restaurant. Service was extremely slow. The general manager wound up taking our order. The food came rather quickly which was good. The food was mediocre at best. I had shrimp on the stone which had little flavor. I think the most unique thing about it was the stone. Have no idea why so many people recommended it. Its a sizzling stone with a bunch of shrimp that were previously frozen. Nothing to write home about. I also had the grilled romaine hearts. That was the best thing we ordered. It would have been better with blue cheese cause the Gorgonzola had little flavor. My grandfather had the eggplant rotolini. The eggplant was ok but the sauce had no flavor...no spice, it was just sweet. The same with the side of pasta that came with it. He also had a side of grilled veggies. There were mostly potatoes in the side and they veggies were very oily. Thankfully we had a groupon. That made the disappointment more bearable. Wouldn't go back there again.

fwz12c9x4y7SqQzPCIK3Eg.text: Hands down best Italian food place in Vegas plus the best service that I had at any restaurant. We sat in the booth so we had a nice view of the strip. The breadsticks were good and we ordered the half pound of grilled shrimp as the appetizer which was excellent. I had the shrimp scampi which was excellent. Everyone that I was with enjoyed their meal. Our drinks never went below the halfway point. I like how you can pay at the table when your done. The waiter will bring a small machine that you can swipe your card on and put the tip in the total. Great atmosphere to eat in and I highly recommend this place but if your overweight the only healthy thing they have is the half pound of grilled shrimp appetizer. If your obese stay out of this place because you will eat a 1,800 plus calorie meal along with the breadsticks and like the typical American that you are you probably going to eat desert which you clearly don't need. Just giving free advice so that you can live longer.

BEPbCNM-EeiWqjBhD2TDIw.text: A friends wife and kids were out of town again for the holidays so that means he calls me to hang with him to find a Italian place to grub. As always he gets his favorite meal of Chicken Francaise which they do a very nice job here, juicy and lightly battered. I started with a regular Caesar salad which was good and was not ice cold but I did see a few pieces of lettuce that looked discolored. For my entree I ordered the Spaghetti with a Bolognese sauce with a side of the grilled sausage. Pasta was cooked perfectly and the Bolognese was fresh and meaty. The portions were good sized and were filling. Service was a little slow which bugged me since it took a while to get the waiters attention at various times for refills, getting/not offered the fresh ground black pepper for my Caesar Salad after it was dropped off and waiting a while to get the check after it was asked for, when it was not very busy. I also dislike when you are ready to pay they bring out a mobile credit card machine to your table to swipe your card, kinda tacky to me. Overall, priced a little higher than I expected but the quality shows for most part. Place is very far away from where I live, and would consider again if I was in the area.

lWHtU9tRw_DzryojIj_xJQ.text: OK we went for my sisters birthday and this food was so good! I am so impressed with this I am going to tell you exactly what I ordered so you can personally request this special I had UNREAL "Pan seared mahi mahi lightly breaded topped off with crab meat served over potato dumplings tossed in garlic and olive oil served with fresh spinach and JUMBO shrimp and drizzles with creamy miso sauce" need I say more? Absolutely DELICIOUS !

I-b6YYUYN_KmLYNf089IoQ.text: Being in the restaurant industry I always like to go to the places that my fellow co workers tell me about. My sous chef told me about Ventano's and knowing that my wife loves Italian good it made total sense to go there. We have been there twice in the past three weeks and love everything about this place. The food is great, the service is on point and the atmosphere is great. I have to admit that the view is the best in Las Vegas. I love the short rib special and my wife loves any pasta with the meat sauce. If you are looking for a nice place to getaway to and try some awesome Italian, Ventano's is the place to go.

W7mG3hPm-42Bc1cmXQwAwA.text: My all time favorite Vegas/Henderson restaurant! The view is amazing, the food is the best in town. Most of my family doesn't even open their menus anymore and orders whatever that night's chef special is. Me, I am in love with the Spedini.

oW7SdxARPX_YV_tKzoEIPw.text: This was my second visit, the first being worthy of a second.  Sadly, perhaps they changed chefs or it was a bad night as everything was sooo tasteless and yet extremely salty. Our bus boy must have been jilted by someone as he scowled and slammed dishes about.  The waiter was mostly absentee... I don't think I'll be going back for thirds.
